address.street: Hong Kong, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong

reviews.comments:
We had a wonderful time at Sabrina’s apartment. Location is great, a minute’s walk to the mid-levels escalator that cuts through the Soho area with tonnes of restaurants and bars. Also super convenient is the fact that you have two major supermarkets within a minute’s walk (Wellcome just across the road and Fusion in the same block) plus a patisserie almost next door!
The apartment itself was very comfortable, full of natural light, plants and beautiful, carefully chosen Asian furniture and decor. There is a sense of home that grabbed us from the moment we walked in and, on a very high note, the bed is super comfortable… I am missing it already!
Sabrina was a great host, and even she was not in the city, she was always available for anything we needed.
We would definitely be back and highly recommend her place.

Very comfortable apartment for just two adults sharing the same bed.
The 2nd bedroom has small child day bed.
Modern building with 24 hours security.
Great location, very close to the escalator, Soho area and city center.
Sabrina is a great host, and even she was not in the city - she helped us with few requests and made our stay in Hong Kong most pleasant.

We had a fantastic 6-day stay at Sabrina's place in Hongkong. The apartment is in a pretty upscale neighbourhood in the Hongkong island, perched high up on the hill. The location is super convenient, as the Central Mid-level Escalators are only a few meters away, so it is very easy to get to the city center without getting into a cab or a bus. There are ample groceries and departmental stores around. The flat itself is tastefully furnished and maintained in top condition by Sabrina's super efficient housekeeper Perla. Three people could be accommodated easily. Only the bed in the smaller room is pretty small, even for a person of average height and build. But the room size would not allow for a bigger bed to fit in. The kitchen is well equipped, and there are 2 bathrooms, which makes it very convenient. We enjoyed every bit of our stay, and if we ever go back to Hongkong, we hope Sabrina would open her doors to us again :).

name: Nice and bright room in Kadıköy
summary: Hello, I'm a teacher living in the very heart of Kadıköy. My house is in a perfect location,  which is 5 min. away from buses and ferry which you can get to the historical places easily by using them. I look forward to meet new people :)
space: All puplic transportation 5-10 min. away
description: Hello, I'm a teacher living in the very heart of Kadıköy. My house is in a perfect location,  which is 5 min. away from buses and ferry which you can get to the historical places easily by using them. I look forward to meet new people :)
access: Kitchen,  bathroom,  living room

host.host_about:
My name is Sena. I live in Kadıköy where all the cultures mixed up. I think my place is the heart of the city. Im an English teacher who loves her job so much. I studied in England, lived there for seven years( considering its a long time)  I sometimes confuse my nationalty :)  I love music both listening and making. I play violin and guitar and besides Im a dance teacher too. I am a nature person who runs away to the mountains and lakes and camp there in her tiny spare time. I work busy hours because ı only work with business people.

My place is very central which is in a walking distance to all puplic transports and easy to get to and find. We have three bedroom in my big flat and ı sometimes I invite my students in the living room for lessons but very rarely. If you see people laughing around dont be surprised :) The building is not pretty new as nearly all flats are the same in Kadikoy area.  My neighbourhood is very safe and everybody knows eachother here and all of them are lovely people. I used to have a dog in the last years as you read in the rewievs but my friend  took her from me to a lovely farm where she is free and happy. House will be very clean when you checked in and I dont do a deep cleaning until you leave so try to be nice and tidy :) There are no rules in this house!!! I love people who treats this area as their own place. 

I have been hosting people on Airbnb for three years and had lovely friends and unforgetable experiences. Some of them stayed for a day and some of them stayed for three months bu we still keep in touch with most of them. I love meeting new people, listening different stories, learn abour their culture. Maybe Ill ask you to go out together if we have or play a game or even a long chat if you want ofcourse.

reviews.comments: Amzing host, really nice person who loves to help in every way she can. Her place is really cozy with a beautiful friendly dog Shera. Safe place and 5 minutes to the fairy station which takes you straight to the heart of the European side, she even offered me a ride many times. And also she's an english teacher so I'm sure you won't find any trouble communicating. If you're a fan of Turkish coffee and late night chat then you should definitely contact her. Thank you Sena for the great experience. X

Sena is a great host. She is kind and caring. Always willing to help you out if you need any help with finding anything or translating turkish for you. She makes sure everything from your bedroom to your bathroom is well cleaned. She was a great host and I enjoyed spending my time with her in the apartment. If you care coming to Istanbul and need a place to stay, I would highly recommend renting one of Sena room. The apartment is big, cozy and spacious and as I stated earlier, Sena is a pleasant person to be around.

Sena is a kind and nice person. Her flat is located center of Kadıköy and you have not a problem to park your car. Sena is giving very fast response for your accomodation request. Everything was perfect.

Sena was very polite, respectful also really helpful host. We've stayed omar, sena and me all together and i glad to meet with these two beautiful and warm people. i have got two nice friends right now. Sena you are a perfect host and best person i have ever seen. also Omar, mate you were wonderful roommate to stay with. thank you very much.

Inderdaad een zeer centraal gelegen ruime kamer waar het goed toeven is.
Ook heeft Sena er geen enkel probleem mee als je in de woonkamer wil verblijven.
Sena zelf is een uiterst aimabele en gastvrije dame die echt probeert je met van alles en nog wat van dienst te zijn. echt een top dame.
Erg handig dat ze uitstekend engels spreekt daar ze hier zelf les in geeft. samengevat : een prima deal.
Stay with Sena was nice. She did everything to make me feel comfortable. The room is spacious and her dog is nice and smart.

Kadikoy is the nicest place in Istanbul and Sena is the nicest person in Kadidoy! She is such a friendly and helpful lady that she makes me feel I'm staying at my own place. She not only gave me a lot of travelling suggestions but also helped me in every aspect of my stay at her home. Her dog Shera is very clever and cute and I truly enjoyed her company. Sena's place has the perfect location, 5 minutes walk to bus stations and ferry. It's really easy to go to the European side and find good restaurants nearby. If you travel to Istanbul, I highly recommend you to stay at Kadikoy with Sena. She's gonna make your stay perfect!

Sena is more than a host. When you stay with her she can even change the view of your life. Very cheerful very happy a perfect person. If you scared of dogs do not hasitate ever. Shera is like an angel well educated and very clever. Anyway i have spent nice but short two days. Everything was perfect.

I stayed at Sena's apartment for 7 days on business and the place is absolutely spectacular and the apartment is clean and in safety area. 
Sena was informative, polite and provided me with everything necessary to feel extremely comfortable. 
Thank you Sena!
Sena is so nice and she made a travel plan for me in Istanbul. The house location is excellent, I can reach anywhere by boat from kadikoy. I will choose to stay at her house next time.

Thank you so much for this enjoyable stay! 
Sena is a really lovely woman and I guess she knows everything about Istanbul! 
she always answered every question I was asking and tried to help me in any way to make my journey most comfortable.

Kadıköy is an exciting are on the Asian side with many bars, shops, and some more stuff u can find out 

Senas flat is pretty central and has a nice neighborhood
I won't forget her dog: Sheera is the friendliest and smartest dog I've ever met

It was a pleasure to meet both and I would definitely book it again :)

Sena was very kind and she's dog was so cute!
always ready for help.
and location is very good.
i wanted to stay longer.

Sena was a great host, very friendly and helpful. She accommodated me coming pretty early in the day and even made me breakfast on arrival! Her dog was super friendly and chilled out with me while I was working in the room. Definitely recommend Sena, her pup, and this room. A great trifecta!
Sena is just a great host! A warm welcome, great pasta and wonderful walk at a park >>> I just have to say: thank you :-)

Very quiet, comfortable and safe room. And also very convenient room for studying and reading, so I prepare for the exams very well. I would also like to thank Sena very much for hosting and her friendship.

Sena is a great host. Very warm, welcoming, informative and hospitable. The place is in a perfect location, just a couple of minutes from the ferries. Couldn't be better situated for a stay in Istanbul.

Sena's place is really close to the ferry port where it will bring you the the European side of Istanbul. It only takes 7-8 minutes walk. Moreover, there are some minimarts nearby and great breakfast places. I recommend to people who only need couple of days to stay

Sena was a lovely host, and her apartment was a great place to stay to see the Asian side of Istanbul. Sena was so friendly and accommodating - when my flight was changed, she stayed up very late to let me check in. She showed me some of her favorite spots around the city, and gave me tips for what to do and where to go myself. Her apartment is totally comfortable and homey. The location in Kadiköy is very close to markets, restaurants, coffee shops, and everything more you could want. It's also close to the ferry terminal for crossing over to the European side to see the more historical part of of Istanbul. I'll definitely plan to stay with Sena again the next time I visit the city!

If you're expecting a hotel, I'd recommend looking elsewhere. If you want to see and experience regular life in Istanbul, you've found the right place!

The bedroom and toilet/bathroom were dirty and unkept and not wholly like the photos, including - for example - no TV. Impression that Sena had forgotten the booking. Description on AirBnB is brief, perhaps indicating that the lounge area is an office where lessons are given would be helpful. Flat needs some TLC e.g. toilet/bathroom door to be fixed and inadequate and faulty lighting to be corrected. Some of the time: building noisy and lift not operating, perhaps normal in this old building.
Sena'nın yardımseverliği, güleryüzü ve evin konumu sayesinde yine çok verimli ve huzurlu bir sınav dönemi geçirdim. Her şey için çok teşekkürler.
Sena is a really warm and welcoming person, she helped me a lot finding my way around in Istanbul made my stay a really good experience. Thank you very much for having me!!
Sena was a lovely host. Very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect

Sena is a great host! Very open minded, easy going and always ready for help or advice. Helpful and pleasant characteristics when you stay with someone for a month :) Cosy room and great location as well!
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

name: Large & Bright-heart of Le Plateau
summary: Enjoy the trendy Plateau boho life in this 3Rd floor bright flat, amazingly located 2min walk from Park Lafontaine, 5min from Sherbrooke and Mt Royal metro stations. Bars, resto, Museums and all are within a walking distance BABY ROOM FULLY EQUIPPED
description: Enjoy the trendy Plateau boho life in this 3Rd floor bright flat, amazingly located 2min walk from Park Lafontaine, 5min from Sherbrooke and Mt Royal metro stations. Bars, resto, Museums and all are within a walking distance BABY ROOM FULLY EQUIPPED

reviews.comments: Amanda was a super gracious host. Her apartment was clean, spacious and had a lot of light. It is located in the great neighbourhood of the plateau , close to bars, shops and restaurants. Amanda was very accommodating, helpful and I would definitely recommend her space if you plan on visiting Montreal.

Wonderful location, very big and spacious apartment that looks as pictured in the photographs. Close to parks, restaurants, bars, and on a quiet street so the spot was perfect. Amanda left breakfast, which was very thoughtful. Leone, Amanda's friend who let us into the apartment, was extremely kind. 
We had an unannounced visit from a construction worker on Sunday morning who came into the apartment, and we were not able to get in touch with the host to see whether we should let him in, which was not ideal. So communication with guests should be improved. Bathroom cleanliness could've been better.

name: Roomy Updated Studio - East Village
summary: При посещении такого исторического города, как Москва, главной задачей путешественника является поиск современного, удобного и комфортабельного жилья.
space: *Check-In time: 3pm / Check-Out time: 12pm *Other times might be available depending on the previous guests check out and next guests check in. .... "downtown's most livable neighborhood"   The defining characteristic of New York is having anything you could imagine just a short walk away, and the epitome of that experience is in the East Village.      The East Village is like nowhere else.  If you can imagine it, it’s probably here.  International cuisine, specialty retailers, historical buildings, music, nightlife, museums, and much more.  There’s always something happening at nearby Tompkins Square Park.  Union Square is just a pleasant walk or short subway ride away.  Whether you’re a professional, an artist, a student, or just someone who loves to experience life, this is the place for you.    But not all East Village apartments were created equal.  This recently renovated studio is roomier than most with space for a full-size bed with headboard and a large loveseat and coffee tab
description: *Check-In time: 3pm / Check-Out time: 12pm *Other times might be available depending on the previous guests check out and next guests check in. .... "downtown's most livable neighborhood"   The defining characteristic of New York is having anything you could imagine just a short walk away, and the epitome of that experience is in the East Village.      The East Village is like nowhere else.  If you can imagine it, it’s probably here.  International cuisine, specialty retailers, historical buildings, music, nightlife, museums, and much more.  There’s always something happening at nearby Tompkins Square Park.  Union Square is just a pleasant walk or short subway ride away.  Whether you’re a professional, an artist, a student, or just someone who loves to experience life, this is the place for you.    But not all East Village apartments were created equal.  This recently renovated studio is roomier than most with space for a full-size bed with headboard and a large loveseat and coffee tab
house_rules: Guests are asked to be considerate of the following house rules: - No smoking inside the house. - Please remove shoes before walking inside. - Please be considerate of neighbors. No large gatherings or excessive noise. - Keep track of your keys. Lost keys will incur a $15 fee for replacement. - No candles or open flames. - If you break anything you will be charged to replace it. - If you use dishes or bring any food into the apartment, be sure to clean up promptly after you are finished. - Do not flush anything in the toilet besides toilet paper. - At the end of your stay, please leave the apartment in the same condition as when you arrived. - The Golden Rule: Treat the apartment like your own home. - Enjoy your stay.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I host my TV and Radio show as a main course. Hosting this tour is a desert. Kaplan is the last name of my grand Aunt who shot Vladimir Lenin in 1918. Proud to be her grand nephew.

reviews.comments: Booking this room with roman was a breeze. He was very flexible and the house basically had all the amenities except wifi. The room was lovely, perfect for a couple. Definitely would stay with at this place again :)

This was my first airbnb moment, and I was pleasantly surprised. The studio was very nice and its location was absolutely perfect for my trip. Roman is a very nice and personable man - the ease with which this all happened was great. My one bummer was not having Internet, but that was a Time Warner glitch. Roman spent hours on the phone trying to get it fixed. No worries, though, as a plethora of cafes with Internet are super close. Everything is convenient from this spot. The studio was in wonderful condition and had everything I needed for my stay. It was a great way to immerse myself in the city.

This was our first experience with Airbnb, so we were a bit worried. Roman was from the beginning very helpful and he always replied to our email and our questions very quickly! He is a great host and a good guy. The flat is gorgeous (exactly like the pictures show) and very clean (also the sheets and the towels smell good and we felt like home). Internet worked perfectly and fast. the flat is very centric and in a good zone to visit Manhattan. VERY RECOMMENDED HOST! :)

The location was perfect for our needs.  Very safe, and centrally located for our destination!  It was a bit noisy until about midnight, but that goes with the vibrancy of the neighborhood.  The apt. is small, but VERY NICE with clean, new kitchen, bath, paint on the walls, decent sofa for relaxing.  Comfortable queen bed.  Make sure the host knows how many are staying there (2 is good, 3 would be VERY COSY).  We only had one bath towel, and one very rough (think old hotel) towel for our showers.  We also found 2 extra pillows but no pillowcases (so we couldn't use them).  Bring your own paper goods...and ask for another bath towel.  I will definitely visit here again when I go to NYC.  I have recommended the apt. to a friend who also travels to visit NYU.

The apartment was cosy, clean and comfortable. What you see on the pictures is what you get. There's also superfast WiFi available. The  location was just perfect: a subway stop is just a couple of minutes away, there're loads of nice bars and restaurant around and the area is vibrant and safe. It was my first experience with Airbnb, but Roman made sure my friend and I had a great time. Roman responded very quickly and effectively to any questions I had before and upon arrival. He waited patiently when our transfer from the airport took a bit longer than estimated. Both the apartment and host are highly recommended!

Roman always responded to our messages very promptly – right from the get-go. He was very helpful and thoughtful. He even left us an umbrella for the upcoming stormy weather! We unfortunately had to check out early as the apartment was out of power due to super storm Hurricane Sandy (I would like to point out that the entire Lower Manhattan was out of power due to the Hurricane. It was not just his place!) Roman was very understanding and agreed to refund the nights we did not stay. During the power outage he checked on us regularly to make sure things were okay. 

The apartment is perfectly located. It’s a short walk to the subway station, Union Square. Also, supermarket/café/pubs/shops/deli stores are in close vicinity.  

The apartment is very clean and comfortable – perfect for two people. The place was recently renovated so it looked new! The wifi is FAST! There is tons of cabinet storage in the apartment. The kitchen is well equipped – there are pots + pans + spices + utensils etc. If you decide to cook a meal or two during your stay, everything you need is there. 

I would definitely recommend his place for your stay in NY city – long or short-term.  And I would definitely book his place again when I visit NY in future.

Romans place is exactly as the pictures show.  Bright and clean.  It's a perfect spot for two people without a doubt. The kitchen has everything that's needed and there were no issues at all with the apt.  The wifi was quick and didn't drop out once.  When we first arrived I wasn't to sure of the area, but after the first day I had no issues at all.  I found out that the area is filled with students attending NYU.  I felt safe the entire time I was in NY.  Roman met us out front with the keys and couldn't stay to chat, but was very quick to respond through email and txt.  The door to the apt was a little tricky, but once I realized that the first turn unlocks the door, then the second releases the latch so it opens, I was good to go.  Romans spot is a pretty close walk to Little Italy, China Town and Greenwich Village (very cool spots to walk around) and a close, quick subway ride uptown.  We walked most of the time, but it was good to know we had options.  There is a great little Mexican place a few doors down from Romans spot which we ate at and I would def. recommend that.  Walking from Romans to uptown every day is a little hike (so bring a good pair of shoes) but we were able to do it.  Overall my NYC experience was fantastic, and our stay at Romans was just as good.  I would  have no problems recommending Romans spot for a NY trip.

This place was perfect for our 2 night visit. We have family in the lower east side near Ave B and 3rd St so the walk to and fro was perfect for visiting, and with Tompkins Square right in-between the two places it made for a nice walk. It was easy to arrange to get the keys, and it was a clean and comfy place to sleep. There was a great bagel place right down the street, and every other convenience within two blocks. Would certainly stay here again.

Roman was awesome, met us up so we can check in earlier. Location was prime, close to all the good eats in NY. Amazaingly clean, cute, and comfy. I would definitely recommend Romans studio. Had a blast and felt like a real New Yorker :)

Roman was flexible and accommodating in meeting with the keys. Very nice guy. The place was sufficient and convenient, a few minutes off the L train and the entire street was accessible. There's always stuff to do. I recommend!

Roman was a great host and the apartment was exactly as advertised. I was ale to arrange to check in a couple of hours early which was a great help.  I only stayed one night so didn't use the kitchen facilities.  The apartment is in a great location and surprisingly roomy for a studio apartment.  Highly recommend both Roman and the apartment on Avenue A.
Nice host and great experience.  Highly recommended.
Clean, neat and priced right.  The apartment suited our needs perfectly and conveniently located.  We're hoping to stay there again soon!

We stayed twice, with a short break between stays.

We were very happy with the experience. The photos and description accurately represented the studio which was clean and easy to use. 

There was a little street noise (it was Christmas and there are several bars/restaurants near by) but this never really bothered us.

The location is very handy (3 1/2 blocks from the L train subway and also  several buses). The neighborhood was a little rough but we liked it and never felt unsafe. There are lots of interesting bars and small restaurants within walking distance.

Roman was very helpful and patient.

Husband & I came to NYC for my birthday over MLK weekend. This location is exactly what we were seeking. We could easily walk to SoHo for shopping, to the East Village for restaurants and to Bleecker St. for Saturday night nutty times. The price was right on so we booked it. Roman was responsive to email and was on time to meet us with the keys. This place is a 2nd floor walkup. The mattress is foam, which took a little getting used to.

Good food within 1-2 blocks and plenty of bars: La Lucha, Tompkins Square Bagels, 9th St Espresso. We didn't use it, but the place does have a big (by NYC standards) kitchen if you are looking to save some $ by eating in. 

A few small touches would make the place nicer, but it served our purposes and we have no big complaints. Will definitely be using AirBnB for future NYC trips - the neighborhood experience is far superior to booking a hotel.
Great place, great location. Roman did the extra effort to help me with few things. Highly recommend !
All good and very smooth communication with Roman. Thanks

Roman was a very friendly, accommodating and communicative host. The apartment was exactly as advertised and the location is great. Easy access to cabs, subway and Brooklyn. Would definitely utilize his place again when visiting NYC.
The apartent was exactly as it was described. It was in very good conditions and it is located near the L train, so you can transfer to all metro lines. Thanks for being such a good host. Matias

Roman is the man, he was very accommodating with my check in time as I had landed in JFK earlier than expected. His apartment was exactly as pictured and the bed is super comfy. He had the bed nicely done and left me 3 towels to use. Also, the location is awesome with lots of restaurants and bars in the vicinity. Highly recommended!

Roman was easy to communicate with, and was flexible with the check in time as our flight arrived early. The apartment is in a great location, easy to get around the whole city, subway is very close and neighborhood is very safe. Pictures accurately show the apartment. Great heating kept the place nice and warm and it has a big kitchen.

The apartment was clean, comfortable and had everything we needed. Roman was a wonderful host, making sure everything ran smoothly. I had a great experience overall and would most definitely recommend Roman as a host to anyone interested. Thanks for the very enjoyable stay!

O apartamento e exatamente o que as fotos mostram, clean, cama confortavel, chuveiro bom. Roman nos entregou a chave assim q chegamos no apto, no hrario combinado e depois a deixamos em cima da mesa, mto simples. Se for pra fazer compras, prepare os bracos pq o apto fica no segundo andar, entao sao 2 lances de escada. A regiao e otima, perto de metro, fomos a pe pro Soho, Union Square, Empire State, Macys...Ha tbm muitos bares e restaurantes proximos, e uma regiao boemia, mas nao se houve barulho no apto, por ser de fundos. Tivemos um problema com a calefacao um dia, mas falamos com Roman e Airbnb e no dia seguinte pela manha ja estava td resolvido. Enfim, recomendo a estadia no East Village, o apto do Roman e o Airbnb.

I would not recommend this place be rented out until it is repaired and cleaned properly.  There is significant water damage, especially in the bathroom.  The ceiling in the bathroom is caving in from it and looks like there is mold damage.  The shower does not drain and has mold all over the caulking.  The toilet had hair from previous tenants.  There was dust that was caked on the shower and walls from lack of cleaning and then condensation from the shower use.  There was more water damage throughout the place.  The brick fireplace was very dusty.  The apartment also smelled of smoke which may have been from a neighbor or previous tenants.  I could not tell.  We used candles to help hide that.  Also, the comforter pictured was not the one listed.  It was a cheap tiger blanket that looks like it could have been purchased at the swap meet.  We took plenty of pictures to document the problems.

As for service, that was strange from the beginning.  It was clear the owner did not meet us because he could not point out the apartment.  Once in, I looked for an iron and found a board.  There was no iron and I texted the owner who said there should be one.  When I let him know it was not there, he said it was not part of the ad and I would either need to buy one or get my clothes pressed.  Luckily I had a sweater nice enough to wear to a meeting.  As someone who deals with people on a daily basis, you never say that.  It is the equivalent to saying "Sorry that is our policy."  He could have said, "I am sorry.  I am out of town right now.  I wish I could help more."  That is less of a put off than what I got.  When I did contact the owner about the physical issues, he said he has been having issues with cleaners for a while.  With the owner being out of the country, I would think a professional property manager should be in place to ensure the place isn’t in bad shape.
  
On our part, we should have contacted airbnb from the beginning and just left.  Since it was our first experience, I was not sure what to do.  I contacted airbnb afterward and have been working with them since.  This experience is clearly not the norm since we stayed at a nice place in Philadelphia afterward from airbnb.

Some positives...  The kitchen seemed to be pretty clean, but we did not use it.  It had reliable WiFi and a nice TV.  The location is the best thing about it.  You can walk to a lot of good restaurants, bars and shops.  I also felt pretty safe at any time walking around.  These do not make up for the physical problems with this place and an owner that doesn’t seem too concerned with meeting his tenants needs.

El apartamento estaba igual que se muestra en las fotos, muy bonito,acogedor y reformado recientemente. Estaba situado en una zona que nos gusto mucho. Al lado habia muchos pubs para tomar algo y sitios de comida rapida y supermercados. Tenia el metro muy cerca y en diez minutos estabas en el centro.
En resumen, nos ha encantado y si volvemos a Nueva york nos gustaria volver a alojarnos en el apartamento de Roman
Very friendly service, very guest-friendly and clean space. Would come back in a heartbeat!

I never actually got to meet Roman his friend Elana who had limited english but was very pleasant met me with the key so there were no helpful tips on the neighbourhood etc.  But his studio is superbly located in a great area convenient to transport close to bars and eating places.  it is ideal for one person or a couple and being only two floors up - suitable for anyone.  This is a great part of New York to stay in and I would happily recommend it.

My stay in Roman's East Village studio was amazing. Great location to the metro, cafes, and great bars. The studio was also clean and comfortable. I highly recommend this studio to others staying in NYC.

My wife and I take an annual trip to NYC.  We stayed with Roman this spring in the East Village.  It was  a great place, very reasonably priced, very clean, and convenient to the L train.  The apartment was well supplied and roomy for a Manhattan studio.  Many great places to eat and go out in the neighborhood.  All in all, it was a great stay.  Thanks to Roman for great trip!

I booked this property at the last minute for my brother who was coming to NYC to visit me. Booking and collecting keys was managed well. The property was clean and simple in a good location, unfortunately the bed was really uncomfortable ( mattress made of foam).
Quiet nice place. I would definitely recommend this spot

Great apartment, clean, spacious and most of all, an amazing location. Close to plenty of bars, restaurants and the L line. Quiet inside the apartment. 

Roman's friend met me at the apartment to collect the keys, I arrived late, but he was great and changed the meeting time for me. All interactions with Roman and his friend made for a great trip to NYC, Thanks!
The place was perfect for a last minute visitor. Price was great for location and quality. Would recommend.

Romans place was in a great neighborhood. In our experience the best area in Manhattan. Lots of stuff to do and great restaurants. Easy to get around (L -line very close). The apartment was nice and cosy. We didn't meet Roman but his friend met us to give us the keys and everything went fine. The only bad thing was that it seemed to us that the place had been cleaned very fast. The kitchen and toilet were clean but there were areas that were pretty dusty. Especially the floor under the bed seemed that it hadn't been cleaned for weeks. Nevertheless we really enjoyed our stay in Roman's place.

Hi, Roman's apartment is in an awesome spot within easy distance to transport and bars and cafes.
He was very helpful when the door had some issues opening and was poised ready to fix it when we called him.
Very soon it felt like our home in New York and we made friends with the locals easily.
Everything you need is in the flat and Roman is pleased to accommodate you if it's not! Thanks will tell my friends in Australia !
Anthea and Rhonda
We enjoyed our stay at Roman's apartment in east village. The best thing about it is the location. So many cool bars and restaurants at your door step.

The apartment is in a perfect location, there are alot of good cafes and restaurants as well as cool shops around. Close to subway and bus stops.
The apartment is clean and pretty well equiped, wi fi connection is quick. Andre (Roman's friend) met us to give the key, he is very helpful and friendly.
It's a good place to stay in New York
Studio calme et fonctionnel, Andre est sympathique et flexible au niveau des horaires, ce qui nous a rendu bien service car notre vol de retour était en fin de soirée.

Andre was lovely, he always responded promptly and was really friendly and helpful. His place is quite bare and the bathroom was a bit grubby. But it's quiet, comfortable and three times the size of an equivalent price hotel room, and the location is great.

This was my first Airbnb-experience and I enjoyed it a lot thanks to Andre and his apartment in East Village.
First of all, Andre was very communicative before we arrived, during our stay, and even after we left. He was absolutely helpful and always responded immediately. When I had problems with my camera, he recommended some places where it could be fixed and even included contact details and store hours, to make sure I didn't have any problems.
When we arrived, he had been waiting for us at the apartment and let us in instantly. Before arriving, I was a little afraid that things might not work out and that we would have to wait, but everything was so easy with him.
The apartment itself was great and looked just as advertised on the pictures.
I would like to say something about the location: To be honest, before booking the appartment, we didn't know the exact address, we only knew that it was located in East Village but after booking we could see that it was in Alphabet City and I wasn't very happy about that because of what is being said about this part of town. The day we left for NY, I was really nervous about the area. BUT the location is simply amazing! It is absolutely safe and I didn't feel weird at any time. The L-train is very close by (connecting you to all major subway-lines and all of NY's must-sees within minutes) and so are many great places such as bars, restaurants, diners, and the post office.
All in all, considering the three most important aspects for picking a place to stay, host, apartment, location, I can absoultely recommend this place.

We had a great time in Andre´s apartment. The location was a bit away from landmarks but subway station was really close. The check-in was very simple and the check-out very helpful. Andre is a great host and we are willing to stay in his apartment again. Hygiene was perfect and the studio was perfectly equipped. We completely recommend this experience .

This studio is in a great location close to many bars, restaurants and  transportation is really easy to get to as well! Andre was very helpful settling us in. He is very accommodating with check-in and check-out times! I definitely recommend this little place in east village for those visiting NYC!

The apartment was ver roomy and in a perfect location for the subway into New York. East Village is very lively and has all the amenities you could desire, restaurants and pubs.
Andre was very helpful and everything was in the apartment you could need. The front door key was a challenge to start with.
I would recommend this place to anybody looking for a super stay in the Big Apple.

I enjoyed my stay at Andre's. The apartment itself is very nice and the depictions in the photos are accurate. The area is also very nice. There are plenty of restaurants everywhere or if you prefer to cook, there is a large grocery store within walking distance. You could easily go about anywhere as the station is right around the apartment. The only minor downside is there is a long stairs leading to the apartment. This wasn't a problem for me as I am carrying a very small luggage, but might be a slight problem with people carrying multiple large luggages.

First of all, when you come from Europe -in my case- it's important that you get quickly  in contact with the owner of the appartment. Landing in Newark, I had immediately contact with Andre after calling. When I arrived at the appartment, Andre was there. That was  great! Andre is an interesting and friendly, helpful person. The appartment is oké. It'.s a quit place. East Village is an active neighbourhood.. We loved it. The subway is nearby. From ther you easyly get everywhere.. The supermarket is around the corner.. You have a kithcen to cook, but if you like Asian food: there are really exellent take-aways in the neighbourhood. I can recommand this place.

This is a small studio apartment, approximately 25-30 m2 (the photographs make it look bigger than it is). Located in a good neighbourhood, lots of fun restaurants and close to a subway stop and two parks.  It has a separate bathroom, no separate bedroom. It fits two people fine, but for three people it really is too small. It's quiet, functional, not very cosy, a little cluttered (with cables and boxes), and, unfortunately, not very clean. When we arrived, we had to ask for clean sheets (the sheets on the beds hadn't been cleaned and had hair and stains on them) and also for someone to clean the apartment the next day, because it hadn't been cleaned.
We were met by a friend of the owners, who was really friendly and kind enough to wait for us to arrive in the evening, even though we were an hour late because our plane was delayed. He was available at all tines, which was lovely - he eve came back at night with the clean sheets. He tried to help with the cleaning, but after he came in the next day, most of the apartment was still really grubby, especially the bathroom. I noticed one of the other guests commenting on this, but didn't pay much attention to it at the time. However, we travel a lot, and this is the first time we were a little disgusted by our surroundings. 
The apartment basically contains everything you need though (tv, microwave, stove, cutlery, dishware, cooking oil, paper towels, matches, candles, condiments), and has an excellent shower (we didn't use the bath because it was too grubby). No hair dryer of kitchen towels, so you will have to bring these yourselves. The bed had a soft foam mattress, we slept very well on it. They were also very flexible on check in and check out, we arrived at ten thirty at night and checked out around two o'clock in the afternoon.
All in all, we had a great stay in NY, but I don't think I would rent this apartment again. For what we paid for it, it just didn't offer enough value, eventhough the neighbourhood was great. Plus we paid 31 dollars in cleaning costs and ended up cleaning the essentials ourselves.

Andre hosted my brother and his girlfriend on very short notice when they were in NYC last week.  They had a marvelous time and said Andre's place was GREAT!  

Thanks Andre!

Andre seems like a nice guy, however we never actually met him. We were a bit disappointed as he told us he would meet us at the apartment to greet us and give us the key, however when we arrived from the airport he was not there. If it weren't for the fact that I could get wifi on my phone to find out he had left the keys at the pizza restaurant opposite, we would have been stranded. The phone number that had been provided to us was also different from Andre's actual number, which certainly didn't help getting in contact with him! The apartment had clean sheets and towels, however that was basically it - no mugs to make tea/coffee, one roll of toilet paper to last 10 days, no information at all about the area or NYC, one towel each to last our entire stay, no soap etc etc. We also didn't find the apartment to be very clean, with old food left in the fridge and dirty cutlery in the draws. The bed was the most uncomfortable bed we'd ever slept on, with half the slats underneath broken and the mattress half falling onto the floor! The location was good with restaurants, supermarkets and subway nearby. I don't usually like leaving negative reviews, but we really didn't think this apartment was adequate or left for us in an appropriate state. If you're looking for a very basic place to stay in New York, this apartment might appeal to you, however I wouldn't recommend this to my friends.

Excellent host. The apartment location is excellent and within walking distance of many places. Very safe neighbourhood, with all you need around you. We were greeted by the host who informed us of loads of places to visit and in general we were very satisfied. Would not hesitate to use again.
Location was perfect and close to everything. Pretty ideal spot, would def stay here again. Apt had everything we needed. Thanks Andre!
It was a great neighborhood and Andre was a really cool guy. I really enjoyed my time there with my boyfriend. So I would definitely come here again!
It was a great flat, in one of my favorite parts of NY. Hollis was easy and flexible and we got along well. It was clean, fresh and very pleasent all in all. Hope to be back!

My last NYC Airbnb was nightmarish. Hollis completely restored my faith in the system. 

The apartment was clean, well stocked, easy to use, and exactly as advertised. Hollis, the host, is an excellent communicator, flexible, warm, and kind. 

I strongly recommend him and his studio!

Hollis was amazing. I really don't have the right words to express how awesome my experience was thanks to Hollis. I highly recommend staying here. The room is great and the location is perfect. Plus, if you are new to NY its a good place to start.
Great place, awesome location! Host was easy to coordinate with very accommodating

I didn't spend too much time at the apartment but for the basics the unit was decent. 

Neighbors smoke cigarettes so you may smell that from time to time.

The photo of the interior of the unit is definitely a professional photo with lighting :)

There is a fireplace behind the couch. Obviously not usable...

The temperature of the unit was good, even in 20 to 30 degree outside weather.

The bathroom doesn't have a fan but this is NYC.

The bed was okay. I would bring your own comforter if you have one. 

There was random dust in nooks and crannies of the unit.

The couch is not suitable for sleeping so if you have more than one person don't even thing about it. Actually it's not that comfortable for sitting anyway. 

Again I stress that if you are in NYC and will be out a lot this is a decent place. If you plan on relaxing at the unit you might have to make compromises. 

The location is great and the host was friendly.

Nice situation, enough space for two. However the appartement was really really dirty especially the bathroom.... I Will Not recommend this place...really disappointed as it was a week plan for my 30th birhtday...

I hate writing negative reviews - but I was disappointed. I thought 4.5 stars = amazing. But the apartment wasn't very clean, it was noisy and the bed was one of those cheap, saggy foam beds. Holis wasn't very responsive during my scheduling, and I almost needed to find another place at the last minute. In my opinion it wasn't worth the money.
Clean place to stay. Everything was upfront. No complaints.

Katie was quick to respond to my inquiries and needs.  She was polite and I was well received.  The place was clean and cozy, perfect for the East Village NYC. I had a great time, and loved the charm of the place.  It was what I had in mind for a small NYC apartment.

We spent 10 wonderful days at Katie's apartment and it was for us the perfect choice. The flat is clean, comfortable and located in an extremely nice and lively area where you can find lots of good restaurants and bars and any kind of shop. In a few minutes' walk you can reach the first underground station, but it is very pleasant to have a walk till Union Square. Our hosts were so kind giving us some good advice about how to move in town and where we could have a good breakfast or meal. We are surely coming back to New York soon and we'll stay at Katie's apartment again.

Katie was very nice, we had no trouble getting in (although the lock has a bit of a knack to it) and the apartment was great; right in the heart of the East village; by lots of cool bars and restaurants.

The accommodations were good for the price and the owners were very friendly. My only complaint is that I instant booked on Friday during the afternoon and they didn't have the place ready until 8:30 at night because they had to get someone in to clean and get it ready which took them quite a few hours. Meanwhile I was lugging all my luggage around new york in the middle of the night. My opinion is that if you have your property set up for an "instant book" you should prepare the place as soon as your previous tenant checks out. Thats my biggest gripe. I paid full price for only being able to stay in the location for approx. 12 hours.

Katie was incredibly accommodating, helping me check in by dropping the key off where I was working. The neighborhood was exactly what I was expecting and there was a Citibike station less than 100' from the building. Katie's apartment was a wonderful surprise. The building was old but the entry foyer and stairs in the common areas were wider and cleaner than some I have come across. Opening the door to Katie's apartment one is greeted by a generous, clean and well-lit studio that seems more like a one-bedroom. A firm and comfortable bed, a sofa, a surprisingly large kitchen, a clean and spacious bathroom. It really was an amazing surprise to find such a clean, contemporary, spacious and well-lit studio in an older lower east side building. Oh, and she also had stocked the place with shampoo, etc. In short, it is a remarkable value.
The apartment was in a great and convenient location!! The apartment is in great condition and is exactly as shown in the pictures!

Katie, was very professional and her place was clean and in a very accessible and cool part of Manhattan. My only complaint would be that the tenants downstairs are smokers and I could smell the smoke through the vents. Other than that the place was great. Maybe a little on the pricey side but still cheaper than a hotel. If you're looking for something in a great neighborhood and a host who will respond very quickly, this is the place for you. 

Thanks Katie!

Katie was very nice and easy to communicate with.
The apartment was very nice and clean. Great location. Thanks Katie. Until next time. A

Great spot. Great Area. Café Ost in front does not give WiFi in weekends thou.
Cleaning could be better but not disturbing too much for me.
Perfect timing for key exchange.
Room too light in the morning for me.

We stayed at Katie's for one week in June and had a great time! The location of the apartment is so convenient to discover Manhatten, Chelsea and Brooklyn - and of course the East Village itself. Being on the L line (subway) makes it very convenient to get anywhere within no time. Lots of nice restaurants and coffee shops and bars around. Katie provided quick responses to my questions. She was very helpful and accommodating when it came to the pick up of the keys (thanks again!!). The apartment was clean. Bedding and Towels were provided, so were bin bags, soap, toilet paper, washing up liquid. Great service! Note: no iron available, so bring one if you feel you'll need it. I would also recommend bringing some ear plugs if you are not used to the noise of a big city.
We spent two nights in Katie's apartment. It is a very nice place to stay and well-equipped and clean. We will come bach some time later.

A good apartment in a fun neighbourhood. A great base for exploring the east village. There's a great new ice cream shop across the road! 

We didn't meet Katie but she gave us all the info needed and arranged for us to collect the keys nearby.

My stay at Katie's was very nice. She was not able to meet me personally for the check-in (work reasons) but she made arrangements to have a friend prepare the apartment so the check-in was very quick and simple. Her studio in the lower east side is conveniently located near many popular restaurants and bars. Everything is within walking distance and if you needed to go somewhere farther, the 6 train is still within walking distance. If you ever do stay here, I can recommend a biscuit place which is literally right downstairs. Great food and it is open 24 hours. Overall, the apartment and neighborhood is great. The nightlife around there is nice but will not disturb you when you are sleeping. Great price for a 3day 2night stay. I will probably stay here again when I have another little weekend off. Thanks a lot Katie.

Very nice, simple place. Although I never met Katie, she was very responsive to questions and flexible about check-in/check-out times. The internet was decent, and the air conditioning was wonderful and crucial.

Slight downsides:
1) The fold-out bed is not very supportive of the back, especially with two people. But it was perfectly good for one night. 

2) The room was clean enough, but not as much as I'd expect for a $50 cleaning fee.

I had a great time for one night, but I wouldn't make it a base for a longer period.
It was okay
A good experience thank you for everything. The place was excellent.

Kastie's place is very well located. Subway was just around the corner which was really convenient. The room was exactly as described. The apartment can get pretty hot in summer time but the small air conditioner helps a lot ( although is a little bit noisy). Kitchen has everything you need. Perfect place for 2 people!
Great location, lots of kool cafés, restaurants and bars all walking distance. Katie was great, quick replies and organizing to get the keys was very easy. Would stay again.

Hola, hemos estado alojados en este apartamento una semana por nuestro viaje de novios. La verdad que nada mas llegar al portal tuvimos un percance con la llave y Katie nos lo resolvió al poco tiempo. El apartamento esta bien aunque se escucha todo de los vecinos, pero es perfecto para lo que queríamos que era dormir ya que para conocer la ciudad estábamos fuera todo el día.

Katie's place is located in a great area, lots of restaurants and shops right down stairs made it a wonderful place to stay. (I highly recommend eating at westville just across the street) the apartment is small but has used the space efficiently so you can easily move around and feel comfortable. It was quiet, which is rare for an apartment in NYC.

It wasn't as clean as it could have been, and is lacking in things like extra towels, paper towels, or many things you would need to cook or clean even simple meals.

Katie's apartment is in a great neighbourhood with lots of bars and restaurants all within walking distance. 5 min walked to the L line. Katie was flexible with check in and check in out times even with a last minute request for late checkout due to a delayed flight. The apartment is a good size for two people by New York standards, there is a certain knack to using the lock. My girlfriend and I had a great 1 month stay

Seva's place was nice and quaint, and what I was looking for. He was responsive and very respectful. The neighborhood is great, there's a lot of bars and restaurants around the area. Thanks for having me stay Seva.

Comme souvent, les photos sont trompeuses; le studio n'est pas aussi lumineux....
La cuisine est bien équipée mais... il n'y pas de table pour s'installer et manger correctement. Il n'y a qu'un bar avec une chaise haute (de bar) et une chaise basse... Une personne doit donc manger en restant debout !
Le canapé est inutile. Il n'est pas concevable que trois personnes séjournent dans cet espace avec deux chaises seulement et en plus dépareillées...
Point positif : pour faire réparer deux fois des fuites d'eau dans la salle de bain, puis l'air conditionné et enfin la télévision, Seva (le propriétaire) est intervenu très rapidement.
房间的地理位置交通便利,生活非常方便
It's very easy to bar hop on foot here so be prepared to experience some amazing places.

I really enjoyed my stay in Sevas cozy apartment in East Village. Everything was clean when we arrived and we felt very comfortable. The location is great, a lot of bars and nice shops are around, subway not even 5 minutes by foot away. Probably not the best apartment for families with children (it can get really loud in the night, especially on the floor because of the neighbors walking on the stairs) but it didn’t bother us to much. Seva always replied quickly and check on & out was totally easy. It was clean, nice location and everything you need for a nice trip to NY. Would definitely recommend this apartment! :)
Great place in the East Village. Seva is responsive to guest queries. The immediate neighbourhood around is great fun.
Super place. Quick, clear communications.

Gret place great location.
Pavel was very helpful.
No light in the kitchen area (must fix it).
Thanks and see you next time!
Mor

Pavel is a great Airbnb location in East Village. His place is located near great places to bar hop and explore in NYC. Pavel was a great communicator with me when I was visiting with 2 friends, the process was quick and easy. Pavel let us check out a hour later than slated and was easy to work with. If I travel to East Village in NYC again with friends I would not hesitate to book Pavel's place a second time.
Its a nice location and its a nice flat.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States

reviews.comments: Janice est une très bonne hôtesse,sejour à NY très agréable

El barrio es muy bueno, muy cerca del Central Park y de River side. Barrio tranquilo y muy bueno para caminar.
Janice nos dio datos de comida cercana y otros lugares para conocer.
El departamento era más pequeño de lo esperado y estaba con muchas cajas y maletas del anfitrión, lo que hacía muy difícil el acceso en el pasillo, incluso en la entrada. 
Al llegar, el basurero de la cocina estaba con basura y había loza sucia. El aseo no estaba muy bien hecho.
No me gustó que el anfitrión estuviera algunas horas en el departamento durante la entrega y además entrara cuando quisiera al departamento, utilizando sus llaves, sin golpear. Incluso un día que estábamos durmiendo.
War super. Vielen Dank!

Janice war eine gute Gastgeberin, sehr kommunikativ und hilfsbereit. Die Wohnung ist sehr klein, aber die Betten komfortabel, die Wohnung sauber. Die Wohnung selbst und die Umgebung sind sehr ruhig, sehr gute Anbindung an die öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel.
公寓的位置不错,门口一号线,BD线都很近,非常方便｡出门右侧就中央公园,晚饭后散步很舒服,和心爱的人一起散步更舒服｡值得推荐,就是房东是女生,两个卧室之间没门……
This apartment location is really good and safe. ans Janice was very kind!

Janice met us promptly and greeted us with keys, restaurant info, and new pillows for our beds!
Overall a good experience. It is a shared space, which i did not realize when i booked. the other guest was great and in her own room with a curtain divider. Not a problem, just my first time using airbnb.

Janice is very kind to us.  she told us many things about spending NYC, so we had a great time!! 
The apartment is near from train, about 5 minutes, and clean enough to spend very comfortable time! There are many kinds of restaurants around the apartment. Japanese, pizza, starbucks!!!

All in all a good experience. The bedroom is separated by a curtain so it's not 100% private, but still alright. I think it should be mentioned more clearly in the description since it's not really visable on the photos. Janice is a very kind hostess and helps out everywhere she can if you ask her. It's a good place to stay if you're spending the major time of the day outside in the city to see things and only be there to sleep. All in all a clean and warm apartment. It's located near to metro stations and next to the central park. There are some nice bars and places to grab some food around which is really good especially to grab some breakfast to go early in the morning.
New York is a wonderful city and i definitely had a superb time.

Janice is such a great host! She was willing to help me in every possible way. I had a great time at her place and my girlfriend and I thank her a lot! 

I'll definitely repeat with her, best choice in Manhattan
It was nice to be stay here. Nice location, reasonable price and all things are prepared well. Except just one thing that I should pass another guest's room to go out, it was good to stay.

Janice was a great host! Always present to help and advise us. The apartment is in a great location. Very close to public transport. Bathroom a bit small but functional. We were able to use the kitchen as we wanted, it's great! We'd like to spend more time in Janice's house for our next visit to NY. Thanks again!

Janice is very warm and her hospitality is impeccable. I had no issues with the space, and she checked in on me from time to time, but mostly left me to my own devices, which I prefer when traveling/on a work trip. It was easy to arrange pick up and return of the key. The space is small and shared, but perfect if you don't plan to spend a ton of time there (I used it mostly as a crash pad-was out most days and evenings).
Janice was a very great host! Gave us information about the city, places to visit, where to eat and did not let us miss anything. Me and my wife had a great time at Janice's apartment!
Nice and clean apartment. Good location

Le sejour s'est bien passé, malgré le fait que nous n'ayons pas compris qu'il s'agissait d'un appartement partagé  (où il est necessaire de passer par l'une des chambres avant d'arriver dans la seconde qui n'est séparée que d'un paravent...)
Janice est cependant très accueillante et est prête à nous aider pour le sejour se passe au mieux !

Great location, Janice was very helpful and considerate. We had a very nice stay, the price is very reasonable for the location. Janice also gave us great tips and information about the best places to go and things to do. Janice is a very good host and any query we had she dealt with quickly.

Även om det står att ni har eget boende så kan de innebära delat  boende. Det är mycket saker överallt, lådor och möbler. Trångt och mörkt i lägenheten. Läget är bra men boendet kunde vara mycket bättre om de fanns plats att röra sig utan att vara rädd för att riva ner någon låda.

Janice was the best ever host. She made extra efforts to accommodate our needs and provided lots of local tips. Our thanks and wishes for her future success . Only suggestion for future guests is to be sure to get the apartment number
a beautiful home to stay at! very close to central park!
Janice é uma anfitriã excelente. Passou todas as dicas do que fazer, museus, espetáculos, parques, onde comer, metrô, etc... muito gentil e atenciosa.
She is very kind, the appartment is no more or no less than what is shown, it's small but functional. The bed is not the best.

Janice is a warm and gracious host. She has good tips for making the most of the neighborhood, and the apartment is wonderfully located, a short walk to central park and just around the corner from Barney Greengrass for great deli!

Janice's place is a typical NYC railroad style apartment with a narrow corridor connecting the various rooms. The bathroom is narrow, but serviceable with a nice new showerhead.  The kitchen was spotless and fully equipped, the large table doubling as a convenient workspace. The bed was a futon and not altogether agreeable to one accustomed to a regular mattress -- but, soon to be replaced, I'm told.  Here's the astonishing thing: the place is extraordinarily quiet for Manhattan -- almost preternaturally quiet  -- a welcome respite from the din of the city and a boon for sleeping! The neighborhood is rife with restaurants and other amenities, and  not least of all,  Janice, the host, was a most congenial, helpful and a responsive communicator.
Eine kleine aber feine Wohnung. Gut gelegen. Bad ist nur sehr klein. Sonst war alles ok. War das zweite Mal dort, gern wieder.
Great host and great stay. Exactly as listed.
Great location but below average apartment
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Janiceさんは､とても親切で必要な情報はなんでも教えてくれました｡
また立地条件が最高で､どこに行くにもとても便利でした｡

name: Nice room in a super nice apartment
summary: Nice and cozy room in a big and clean apartment off Graham in Brooklyn. 15min from Union Square. The room has no window but the living room has a lot of natural light + terrasse w/ BBQ+ SUPER NICE rooftop w/ BBQ, awesome view!
description: Nice and cozy room in a big and clean apartment off Graham in Brooklyn. 15min from Union Square. The room has no window but the living room has a lot of natural light + terrasse w/ BBQ+ SUPER NICE rooftop w/ BBQ, awesome view!

reviews.comments: This apartment is in a great neighborhood for exploring Manhattan and Williamsburg since it´s only a few blocks from the L train which goes directly into the city. There's also a lot of grocery stores, bars, and restaurants within walking distance. I never got a chance to meet my host, Terry, but she was easy to reach when I was setting things up before I arrived. As Terry had mentioned, the room did not have a window - not ideal but not an issue if you're exploring the city, and the living room / patio are nice for hanging out. The AC motor for the apartment is in the room and is noisy, so not great for light sleepers. The roof is an amazing space with an incredible view of Manhattan.

The apartment was great and the room was clean! Terry was also good enough to leave us some closet space! The apartment is secure with a code and really close to the train and restaurants, shops and bars! Great experience, thanks for letting us stay!

name: Spacious one bedroom with en-suite
summary: Spacious room with a private bathroom. It is located in a modern apartment building in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn. It has a roof deck which offers spectacular views over the city.
