Very clean, the staff (and locals) at Hotel Moloka'i are some of the nicest, most helpful people I have ever met. The food at the restaurant was very good and the hotel is centrally located for tourism options. Would definitely stay here again.

Nice and clean, quiet hotel room with private entrance and patio. Keurig and assorted pods in the room. Good restaurant on the premises; we ate there every night. Not too far from town. Pool and laundry made it a great place to rest up and relax for a few days.
A clean, comfortable place and a real bargain. The grounds are lovely and hotel restaurant is excellent.

Look no further than Raymond’s place! This was the perfect spot for our weekend getaway. The location is central and very close to all food options. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. A/C was plenty cold and the amenities at the hotel such as the hammocks, pool, and restaurant were awesome. You cannot beat this place for the value.
This location is ideal for whatever you desire to do. There are lovely hammocks oceanfront, which are perfect for watching the sunset. I had a wonderful time and highly recommend staying here!
Cute quiet basic place
Really great place! Perfect location, great restaurant and bar at the hotel too! We had an amazing stay.
Raymond’s place is nice. The building is on the ocean and you can walk to the sandy beach from the place. Moloka’i is a beautiful island. Very close to the town center of Kaunakakai.
Really great location for all of the island and home to the best restaurant so what more do you need? Raymond was a great host and the room was lovely and the bed was super comfortable.

Ray is very quick to respond and very helpful. 
We really enjoyed our stay. 

Be aware to visit waterfalls in Halawa Valley you must pay to visit... we were quoted 2 different prices.. $90, $60. Then I went down to the valley and found a local, she told me you should not spend over $30 booking direct with family that run tours. Which must be pre-booked. 
We didn’t realise so ended up missing out on the biggest experience we came to do in Molokai 

Highly recommend having a rental car for full duration of stay. Beach in front of Molokai Hotel isn’t good for swimming.
Raymond's place was perfect and he gave wonderful food recommendations!
Super cool and sort of remote, no hustle and bustle and I loved it!

The room is in a good location, less than 2 miles from the town.  Heed the advice, and rent a car in advance!  Otherwise, your adventures will be severely limited.  There is intermittent bus service, no Uber/Lyft, and very few taxis.  The walk into town isn’t bad though.  There are bikes available to rent as well.  
The hotel has a restaurant, that’s open from lunch though dinner.  It’s right by the water, so beautiful views, and breezes.  The lunch prices are good.  Paddler’s Inn and the bakery in town, were also good choices. 
The room was just that, a hotel room, basically.  There’s a microwave, and a nice size small fridge.  It had a Keurig coffee maker, but I’d suggest bringing your own pods, as there was not much choice in what I was offered. There was a nice size tub/shower (low water pressure) separate from the sink area.  The sink drain was having issues draining.  
There’s a nice, small patio where you can relax.  It has a glass door that doesn’t lock, and a screen door that can be chained.  There is a tear in the screen right where you could unlock the chain.  
The room also has a nice tv, with cable.  Cell service isn’t readily available, but there’s a phone in the room that includes local & stateside coverage.  There’s WiFi, but it’s spotty at times. 
The room included 2 beach chairs, a sand mat, and beach towels.  
The pool has nice chairs, and there are hammocks with a great view.  The ocean there is very shallow, with a mud bottom.  Bring water shoes.   Perfect probably for kayaking or SUP, but wasn’t sure where to rent those.  The hotel does have an activities desk where you can sign up for tours.  You can also do that in town.  The hotel has a shuttle that you pay to use.  
I never saw Raymond, and communication with him wasn’t timely (other than him letting me know when the room was ready for me).
Raymond’s place was great to stay at. You have the amenities of the hotel but lower rate. Would stay again
Great location and the complex is very nice and pleasant.  The bed was really comfortable too!
A nice room very close to town with the amenities of a motel.
I had a last minute booking for one night and Ray set me up. Great location on Moloka’i real close to the beach. I’ll be back!
Raymond's place is outstanding! Very clean and good location. Relax vibe.

We really enjoyed our stay at Raymond’s place. 
The room is nice, clean and well furnished. 
You can also use all the amenities of the hotel. The restaurant and bar have a beautiful view of the ocean, perfect for catch the sunset!
We will for sure come back and stay there again!

name: 7 1/2 sunny in Rosemont with Jacuzi
summary: The rental is for the ground floor, the backyard with the terrasse, the Jacuzzi and the basement.
space: 7 1/2 sunny and spacious in Rosemont, Montreal, near the Promenade Masson where you will find the best restaurants and bars.
description: The rental is for the ground floor, the backyard with the terrasse, the Jacuzzi and the basement. 7 1/2 sunny and spacious in Rosemont, Montreal, near the Promenade Masson where you will find the best restaurants and bars. The rental is for the ground floor, the backyard with the terrasse, the Jacuzzi and the basement.
access: The rental is for the ground floor, the backyard with the terrasse, the Jacuzzi and the basement.

host.host_about: Hello!

name: Central Park 1BR Apt NYC Manhattan
summary: Your perfect home away from home in NYC. A 5 minute walk to Central Park, Columbus Circle and Lincoln Center. Steps away from NYC subways especially the 1, 2, A, B, C, and D. The Columbus Circle subway station is steps from the front door. Enjoy this quiet neighborhood conveniently located in the heart of Manhattan. Whole Foods, The Theater District, 5th Avenue shops, and the city's best restaurants are walking distance.
space: The apartment has a kitchen, living room/ dining room, enclosed bedroom and a full bathroom. The space has a Queen size bed in the bedroom and a comfortable pull out double sleeper in the living room.  WiFi is included and many parking garages nearby. Walking distance to 5th avenue, Lincoln center, Columbus circle, Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller center and all other midtown sights. Steps from all major subways. Central NYC location.
description: Your perfect home away from home in NYC. A 5 minute walk to Central Park, Columbus Circle and Lincoln Center. Steps away from NYC subways especially the 1, 2, A, B, C, and D. The Columbus Circle subway station is steps from the front door. Enjoy this quiet neighborhood conveniently located in the heart of Manhattan. Whole Foods, The Theater District, 5th Avenue shops, and the city's best restaurants are walking distance. The apartment has a kitchen, living room/ dining room, enclosed bedroom and a full bathroom. The space has a Queen size bed in the bedroom and a comfortable pull out double sleeper in the living room.  WiFi is included and many parking garages nearby. Walking distance to 5th avenue, Lincoln center, Columbus circle, Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller center and all other midtown sights. Steps from all major subways. Central NYC location.
house_rules: No smoking. No Partying/loud music. Please be respectful of my home, building and neighbors. Please make sure your profile is as complete as possible before inquiring. Thank you!

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States

reviews.comments: We stayed at Gill's place for 4 nights and had a great experience. Gill's girlfriend, Rhi, met us on the street and helped us with our luggage to the apartment. They were very accommodating and did everything to make us feel at home. Such a sweet couple! They left us tips of different restaurants and neighborhoods to explore. The apartment itself was very modern and extremely clean. Great size, incredibly big for NYC. It was the perfect size for two people in the bedroom and another on the pullout couch in the living room. The air conditioning was wonderful as our visit was during a hot week in August. The wifi was reliable which was helpful.  It was walking distance to Columbus Circle with many trains available. They were even flexible and let us check out at 4 PM and leave our bags while we enjoyed the City.  I would definitely recommend Gill's place!!

O apartamento é excelente! Todo renovado,  wifi, cozinha novinha e, para os padrões novaiorquinos, até grande (quarto, cozinha, sala grande com sofá que caberia mais uma pessoa e um bom banheiro. Além de closets). o ponto alto da acomodação é a localização. O apto fica pertinho do Central Park e da estação de metrô do Columbus Circle, que é o maior hub de subways da cidade. Perto do flat você encontra farmácias, restaurantes, shoppings, shops, supermercados, cias... tudo "walking distance".
Fomos muito bem recebidos pelo Gill e pela Rhi, que estavam lá para nosso check in e check out e se colocaram à disposição para quaisquer problemas que pudéssemos ter durante da nossa estadia.
O apartamento é equipado com um ar condicionado e, como fomos no verão (agosto, que é bem quente na cidade!) não tivemos problemas com o calor.
Certamente voltaríamos para nos hospedar aqui!!

Gill's apartment was perfect for my stay! Convenient to grocery stores and restaurants and of course the shopping at Columbis circle!! The apartment itself was beautiful - especially the kitchen and bathroom. Gill and his girlfriend were very responsive throughout my entire 10-day stay, which was really nice!!! Lots of space for everything and very comfortable - you can't go wrong!

Great place to stay, very clean and equipped with everything you would need. The location is wonderful , the subway two block away, very easy to get to all the sights . 
Gill was a great host ,very helpful and flexible with checkin time.
Thank you Gill.

We stayed at gills place for a week in October! The apartment was well sized for three people. Very modern and clean. Great wifi access which was very much appreciated. Location was great. We were able to to walk to most places very close to the park and shopping! Great food also located close to the apartment. The communication with gill went smoothly as we were delayed upon arrival he made sure we were able to check in easily despite the time! Gill was attentive and checked in with us throughout the week! Would highly recommend staying here!

I stayed in Gill's apartment during my five day stay in New York with my 18-year old daughter. It was perfect in all aspects, the location, the size of the apartment and the very friendly welcome from Gill. The apartment was very tidy and nicely furnished and had all the equipment we needed. It was very easy to get in contact with Gill at all times and on our return home he was very helpful with information on how to get to the airport by train. I will most definitely contact Gill again on my next visit to New York.

I stayed Gill's apartment for eight days. For me, everything was perfect. Gill is very nice and pleasant host. The location, transportation, cleanness, amenities, safety was all good. I regularly come to NYC for business and use airbnb a lot. I'd say this place was best. The apartment seems newly renovated and very clean. The bed was cozy. Gill provides essentials, wifi, and Netflix. I highly recommend and I myself wish to come back to use the house. I thank Gill.

We had a great stay in Gills apartment in NYC. It was very conveniently located close to Central Park and Columbus circle, and within easy walking distance to 5th avenue shops and attractions. Gill and his girlfriend Rhi were lovely and  most helpful in greeting us upon arrival and ensured that everything was going well during our stay. They left recommendations for popular attractions and places to eat whilst staying there. Apartment looked exactly like it did in the pictures and wifi and Netflix worked well. Would definitely Recommend gills apartment for anyone looking for a small clean and modern listing in a great spot in NYC!  Would return!

I have stayed at Gill's place for 10 days in late November. The apartment is very clean and very comfortable to stay in. The apartment was provided very clean, there was a substantial number of towels (both bath and hand), kitchen has all the necessary accessories (even an umbrella!), bed was very comfortable and building is in my favorite area - literally less than 5 mins waking from Columbus Circle, Time Warner and many of the amazing places NYC is known for. Gill was very welcoming as well as his girlfriend and I truly enjoyed my stay. Will definitely return and recommend to others!

It was a really nice spot to start our trip. My mom and I made the place our very own. We ended up spending most mornings cooking breakfast, having great coffee and watching abit of netflix before heading out into the hustle and bustle of thanksgiving and black Friday shopping in nyc. The apartment was close to the park and colombus circle which we used as a home base for shopping and exploring. It was safe to walk around alone and everyone in the neighborhood was friendly and helpful. The apartment was calm and quiet and really great to call home for the week.

Gill met me at a coffee shop across the street to help me check into the apartment. It was all very easy, and though the apartment is on the second floor, there's an elevator that makes carrying luggage much easier. It couldn't have been cleaner or better suited for a single person or a couple. I was traveling for business, and appreciated the large tv with netflix for nightly unwinding! The bed was comfortable, there was plenty of space (storage + large living area), the kitchen was quite nice and clean, and the neighborhood was convenient to midtown and transportation. Will definitely stay here again.

i went up to New York early December with a friend to see the holiday lights, go to the museum etc.  We were thrilled with the apt.  Gill was warm and helpful, very easy to communicate with.  The location is terrific and one morning I wandered down to the river and unexpectedly found a walking/bike path that was beautiful.   The apt itself is totally renovated, simple and immaculate.   I used uber and literally never waited more than a minute to be picked up. Everything was easily accessible.  The Greek kitchen next door was the icing on the cake.  I'd be happy to go back to Gill's place in the future.
un très chaleureux accueil de Gill. l'appartement est bien situé

This was our first Air BNB experience and it was fantastic.  The apartment was tastefully remodeled and very clean.  The location made it perfect for our long weekend in the city. Our host met us personally, left us recommendations around that part of town and there were several little amenities around the apartment making our stay easier and more enjoyable. I would without a doubt stay here again.

My fiancé and I stayed for 4 nights and the place was very clean and comfortable. Gil was great with communicating and making sure that we had everything we needed throughout our entire trip. Couldn't have picked a better place to stay both for the location and for the place itself. I would definitely recommend staying here if you travel to NYC. Looking forward to visiting in the summer and we will absolutely use this place again. Thanks Gil and Rhi!
Great apartment. Great location and modern renovation so near perfect. Good restaurant section of town as well. Gil is easy to deal with, on time and a good host. Thumbs up.

My daughter and I had a very comfortable stay here. The apartment is much larger than it looks in the photos, with lots of storage space. We also enjoyed the access to Netflix. Perfect location. Very friendly hosts who responded quickly to queries throughout our stay. I would definitely stay here again.  We also loved The Greek Kitchen nearby (which seemed to be one of the only restaurants open in all of Mahattan during Snowmaggedon 2016).
Perfect location , friendly host, clean and comfortable apartment. Thanks
Great location and a very cozy apartment.

Everything was great... the place is super spacious for NYC and beautifully updated.  You're two long blocks from Columbus Circle and Central Park, about a 8 min leisurely walk. The apartment was quiet, even with a party going on next door.  On check in you may have to pick the keys up first from a different location, which may delay you if you're on the clock.  Gill was also kind enough to let us have a little later check out due to a delayed flight. Would absolutely stay here again though!

Great place!  The location is near the subway station, you can find many great restaurants near Columbus Circle. The room is very clean and nice, the bed and sofa are very comfortable, the only thing is the door of the bedroom is made of glass, a little bit inconvenient for 3 people to live in. Gill helps me a lot! This is a great place to live in! Totally worth it!

Bonjour,
Troisième séjour à Manhattan, nous souhaitions une location dans le quartier de Colombus Circle.
L'appart de Gill est très bien, la chambre, coté arrrière de l'appartement était très calme.
Appartement très propre, très beau et bien sécurisé à 10 mn du métro.

Great stay. Apartment was just as described - well appointed, good amount of space (for Manhattan!) and great neighborhood convenient to Times Square, UWS, etc. 

Gill was super easy to communicate with - picked up the keys no problem, very responsive by text when I had a few questions. Would gladly stay here again!

Gil made sure to greet us on arrival with keys and lots of info to help orient us to the neighborhood.  Apt has comfortably sized rooms--bedroom, living room, kitchen, bathroom with good shower.  Hosts were always available for questions, and resolving anything that came up--really important in any city, especially nice in NYC.  Thank you for a pleasant stay!
The location is great: it is very close to Central Park, and walking distance to Times Square and 5-th Avenue. Gill is a very responsive host, and the apartment and the building are nice and clean.

Bon accueil de la part de Gill à notre arrivée.
Nous avons été ravis mon fils et moi de notre premier séjour a New York .C'était notre première expérience Airbnb 
L'appartement est spacieux ,mais les photos trompeuses car la chambre a vue sur un mur en brique et une petite cour . Elle est lumineuse mais le salon est très sombre .Bien pour un couple ,car la porte de séparation de la chambre est en verre.Le canapé transformable en lit a un  matelas très inconfortable.Le quartier manque de lieux pour sortir le soir , peu de choix de restaurants ou de bars proches . Supermarchés a proximité ce qui est bien . Cuisine et salle de bains spacieuses . Grands rangements pratiques .Immeuble rénové agréable. Un peu de nuisance sonore a cause de la climatisation du restaurant qui donne dans la cour .Gill donne une liste d'adresses pour se restaurer et faire ses courses,ainsi que ces contacts en cas de besoin . Globalement satisfaits par l'appartement ,mais quelques petits points à améliorer .

Gil's apartment was a lovely place to stay for a long weekend in NYC.  The pictures are accurate and the apartment is very cute, super clean and perfect for two or three people. The location is great- just a couple of blocks from Columbus Circle.  It's quiet, cozy and comfortable.  Key pick-up and drop-off were easy and Gil was helpful with restaurant and other recommendations.
The apartament was great, clean. The owner very kind

Fantastic accommodation! Great location in Hell's Kitchen area, walking distance to Central Park, Times Square etc. Apartment is lovely. Gill is readily available, friendly, helpful & offers good advice for local amenities etc. Thoroughly recommend both Gill & his apartment :)

Gill's place was a great base for a Manhattan vacation with my two kids.

The location is good--a seven minute walk to the Columbus Circle subway station.

The apartment is very nice.  The kitchen is particularly good, with nice, new appliances including a dishwasher.

Gill was helpful checking in.  We had no problems with the place.

A massive thank you to Gill for being such an accommodating host and ensuring our time in NYC was as enjoyable as it was! A perfect getaway - clean, comfortable and convenient. Gill had great recommendations and was always able to be reached. We could not recommend staying here more highly. We can't wait to return and continue exploring this amazing city.

Gill was an amazing host.  He met me at Starbucks across the street and then help me get my luggage into the apartment. Upon arrival, we had recommendations for local grocery stores and restaurants in the area. But you had already recommended gyms as well.   He was extremely helpful with any questions I had. The studio was adorable! I would love to stay there again in the future.
This was so much better than a hotel. I would recommend Gil's place to everybody. Perfect for a day, a week, or a month stay. You won't be disappointed.

The apartment was great! Very clean and organized, we found everything we needed for a week in NYC. The location was great too, we felt very close to every place we wanted to visit in the city. 
Thank you Gill!

Gill was a fantastic host! Check in was so smooth and she touched base through the stay to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. The accommodation was exactly as pictured. My friend and I stayed for 9 stays and it is perfect for two. For those who are wanting to stay in the city but just outside the main hub then this is it.

I love Gill's place. 2 long blocks from the subway, Central Park and Wholefood Market on Columbus Circle.  (Walking from the 10th to 8th). Gill's apartment is beautifully appointed, very clean and spacious by New York standard and can comfortably sleep 3-4 people. Kitchen and bathroom are well stocked with utensils and toiletries and paper and towels. Plenty of storage. And the apartment is not on the street side so it's quiet all day round. Thanks again for being a great host. We felt home away from home at your place.

Right in the heart of the action, Gill's place was a real gem. Surprisingly spacious for an inner city apartment and a modern lift, what's not to love? The kitchen was fully equipped with modern appliances and there was plenty of wardrobe space in the living room. The apartment is conveniently located on a busy main road but is situated at the back of the building so is relatively quiet. The apartment is a little dark perhaps but the living room gets some natural light from the bedroom which has glass doors, and the kitchen. An array of lamps help keep the living area warm and cozy. Gill and her family were readily available by phone and email to sort out the minor issues we had. We very much enjoyed our stay.

Gill's apartment was wonderful! My boyfriend and I stayed for the weekend, and it was everything that was described/shown in the pictures- no surprises. Very clean, excellent bathroom, comfortable bed, safe neighborhood- can't say enough good things :) we will definitely be staying here for future visits to the city.

Listing is very accurate.  Location is just the best.  Great for shopping, eating and sightseeing.  Right next to Central Park.  The apartment is located next to a side wall with no street so it is ever so quite.  Gill was fantastic, ever so helpful & accomodating.  Apartment is well maintained and has a full kitchen.  This surpassed our expectations and I highly recommended

It's a wonderful 1 bedroom with a nice kitchen and bathroom within 2 blocks of Columbus Circle's main transportation hub.  The apartment was very comfortable and the hosts are super nice and helpful. I'd recommend it for 1 person traveler or a couple.
Great location, exactly like on the pictures! We enjoyed staying there and would stay there again the next time! Communication with Gill was excellent.

Traveled with wife and daughter, stayed 5 nights, and was great for our needs (especially being close to Lincoln Center and Juilliard.) Layout, features and amenities as described. Fold out couch OK for daughter. Kitchen had all requisites. Well stocked bathroom. Good eateries nearby with a Whole Foods down the street and 2 blocks from the Columbus Circle subway center. Roughly equivalent in price to all 2 bed hotel rooms we could find, so reasonable value for us. Gill arranged an easy key pickup and allowed a late checkout (which was a breeze.) Grew up with steam heat, so the nuances of that heating method were understood and expected. Would stay here again.

We can recommend Gill's apartment for anyone traveling to NYC. The apartment was quiet, very clean and organized with a modern touch. The location was great too, we felt very close to every place we wanted to visit in the city. Gill was a great host. Thanks!

Stayed at Gills place for about 3 weeks for business.  Was nice and cozy and had a table I could work on.  The heater gets a little loud at night but you get over it as time passes.  Full kitchen and nice bathroom.  Would stay again

I visited the city with one other friend and we were so glad that we had found Gill's place! The apartment is modern, fancy and cozy. It's right in the middle of the city excitements; but the apartment itself, facing the back of the building, is well shielded from city noises. There are tons of great eateries and stores around (and one gets to appreciate it especially when trapped by a snow storm). Gill is a great host who arranges everything nicely and makes everything easy. Would love to stay at this place again!

El departamento es muy cómodo pero posee poca luz ya que es un contrafrente. Tiene una cocina a gas que no funciona por lo que no fue posible cocinar ciertas comidas debido a solo contar con 2 hornallas eléctricas, lo cual NO fue avisado ni tampoco solucionado a pesar de habernos comunicado con Gill. A pesar de solicitarlo nos entrego un solo juego de llaves. Cuando le preguntamos si el departamento contaba con lavadero dijo qué no ,cosa que no era cierto ya que se encontraba en el subsuelo, pero el no quería que los vecinos nos vieran ya que subalquilaba el departamento y eso NO esta permitido. Las dos veces que nos encontramos fue en una cafetería a media cuadra del edificio ya que aclaró que si alguien nos preguntaba éramos amigos suyos. Todo esto nos hace pensar que evidentemente en dicho edificio no permitían subalquilar  , y por ende se manejaron las situaciones de esa manera. Por todo lo expuesto no aconsejo alquilar el departamento de Gill ya que cuenta con muchas deficiencias. Agradeciendo este espacio para vertir la experiencia vivida, y para que a otros no les suceda lo mismo saluda atentamente María Teresa Méndez, madre de Sofía Raux.

Thanks to Gill for letting us stay in this wonderful apartment.
The location is great, literally minutes away from Columbus circle, Central park, endless restaurants and shops. The apartment is well-equipped and cosy, nice decor too. Also I loved the comfortable bed with lots and lots of pillows. Gill was very very helpful, responded immediately. Check-in was smooth and easy. Thanks again, Gill!

Hermoso departamento ubicado excelentemente. Cerca del metro, de dos supermercados, de restaurantes y cafes. Muy cómodo y mas grande de lo que se ve en las fotos! Baño y cama impecables. La cocina moderna (solo le falta algún que otro utensillo de cocina o fuente para poder darle provecho al horno). En general fue una experiencia muy buena. Gill es muy agradable persona. Estuvo super atento, siempre con intenciones de ayudarnos en cualquier duda que nos surgió. Gracias por todo! Lo volvería a elegir y lo recomiendo 100%.

Great location.10 min walk to subways and Central Park. 15 min walk to time square. Great eaterys all close by.
Great apartment.
Close to Columbus Circle and Central Park, the location couldn't have been better. The apartment was very comfortable and Gill made everything easy.

Gills place was in a fantastic location in the city and provided the perfect base for our visit to NYC. It is very easily accessible to most subway lines so getting around was very easy. The room itself was perfect for a couple to have a bit more space compared to a hotel for our longer stay in NYC.

Gill is a great communicator; he is fast, precise, and very friendly. His place is clean, arty/hip, quiet, very comfortable, with good air conditioning, surprisingly large for New York City, and close to the subway and Central Park. Way better than a hotel!

I'd go back with enthusiasm anytime.

We loved the location of Gill's condo.  The check in/check out process is easy.  The condo was safe and quiet.  Everything was as advertised.  Gill was easy to reach before, during and after the rental.  We would considering renting this condo again for a future trip to New York.

Gil and his girlfriend were super friendly and very helpful.  Apartment was exactly as described, clean and comfortable, with all the amenities necessary for our visit.  Best of all it was central to everything in NYC and we felt very safe in the neighborhood. Would recommend for anyone visiting NYC and I would absolutely rebook if ever we are in NYC for a few days.

Gil's place was perfect for us: clean, neat, comfortable and functional. The place just felt good and higher end. The location is awesome. Gil was excellent about accomodating us when we booked at the last minute. We would definitely stay again.

Tom and Libba

Clean, comfortable, cozy, and convenient place in the center of Manhattan. I truly enjoyed my 2 week stay in Gill's place in the summer. Gill is a very friendly host and is very responsive to my messages always. Recommend for those who plan to travel around NYC.
Super location for visiting Fordham or Lincoln center.
Great location, so close to everything.  Excellent bathroom and kitchen and larger than expected apartment.  Gill meet us for the check in and was so lovely and helpful.
Excellent location, apartment is beautiful and Gill was such a great host with his communication and details provided

Gill's place was great! Awesome location and very cute apartment. Great for 2 people, but a bit tight for more than that. But hey, it's NYC, so that's pretty normal. My only issues were with the uncomfortable sleeper sofa mattress and non-absorbent bath towels. (getting pretty picky there...!) Gill was so nice, fabulous to work with, and he communicated with me really well. I'd definitely recommend!

The apart is very functional and it is very well located. It is ideal for 2 or 3 people. It has a new kitchen and bathroom, which is really nice and give you a sense of cleanest. However, it has room for improvement. First,  in the decoration, which is very poor. Second, in the painting of the walls and ceilings ,which are not in good conditions. Third, since the apart is in a 2nd floor, there is not natural light coming from the outside. The apart needs more lights in all rooms and specially inside the closets, since they do not have light at all. 
I will definitely return to the apart if the owner decides to make this minor investments.

Das appartment von Gill hat eine ausgezeichnete Lage, um alle Sehenswürdigkeiten schnell u einfach zu erreichen. Es ist geschmackvoll eingerichtet-die Küche ist sehr gut ausgestattet. Die Kommunikation mit Gill war problemlos u schnell. Wir wurden sehr freundlich u herzlich empfangen u würden immer wieder bei Gill gerne logieren.
Spacious, very clean, fantastic location.  Gill was a great host and I highly recommend this apartment.  A tremendous value!

This apartment is very cosy, welcoming and, most importantly, it has a perfect location! It is in walking distance to Central Park, MoMa, Broadway, Times (Website hidden by Airbnb) I strongly recommend it especially for a short trip. We only had 2 days and the location saved us a lot of time. It was also very clean, it is big enough for 2 people, I think even 3, and, last but not least, Gill is a great host! We arrived around midnight and he greeted us at the apartment, he was available and communication was very easy throughout our stay. We liked both the apartment and the host very much, and would go back anytime.

Only ten mlinute walk to Lincoln Center and to Time Warner Center/ lots of subways/Central Park AND a busline on 10th st PLUS very good Greek rest. next door and Starbucks diagonally across the street.   All this plus an updated kitchen and bathroom ‘

The location is wonderful.  The listing says no Cable, but there is NO TV but Netflix, not even an antenna for local TV.  WiFi is very good.  The gas stove/oven is turned off, instead there is a two-burner electric hot plate.  There are very few dishes (only three dinner plates).  It's small, bare and spare, but so well located that the location compensates.  Gill is not always prompt at replying.
Very quiet cozy apt. Recommend for business travels.
Gill was a great host. Very responsive. Apartment was as described. Quiet and conveniently located.

I am very disappointed by Gill and the flat...

I booked the flat for my engagement night with my fiancé and asked my parents to collect the keys. Gill should meet them in a Starbucks but arrived 1h later without leaving any message and not answering his phone !

Secondly the address he provided is wrong ! he said it is the same address but it is just another building with another number on another street ! So when I wanted to check in I tried to call him and of course he did not answer during the first 30min, letting me wait outside with my fiancé...

Also their were dust in the flat (what the point of paying £150 for cleaning?) and the painting on the celling is if the paint is peeling or flaking. 

I was very disappointed and asked him to pay me back 30% of the booking which he agreed and of course I get no answer from him now.

I think Gill is not a good host and not an honest person. I know there are some good comments for this flat but except the location I really don't recommend this flat.
Gill's apt is in an awesome location, has everything you'll need and a great host - definitely come here!!!! We enjoyed our stay very very much :)

We enjoyed our stay at Gill's place.  The location is so very convenient to all that New York City has to offer.  The building is also very quiet and has lots of great food options just downstairs with a Starbuck's and two grocery store options only a short walk away.  The amenities at the apartment are perfect and were just what we needed.  Thanks for another great stay in the city Gill!
Very good overall. It was very warm outside and the small window unit couldn’t keep the place cool enough.

I do not recommend this place.  It is not the correct address which made me believe that it is not supposed to be an air bnb. He also told us to lie about it being an air bnb. The photos were misleading.

El departamento está ubicado en una zona muy linda y cómoda de NYC..es altamente recomendable parar allí.. queda muy cerca de Columbus Circle y de Central Park.. además de ser un barrio lindo, es seguro y tranquilo. Hay bares y restaurantes muy buenos. 
El departamento es cómodo .. bien equipado y muy limpio.. nos encantó parar en Hell’s Kitchen... gracias Gill !!!!

Appartement propre et très bien situé (à 2 blocs de Central Park).
Gill est très sympathique et nous a donné de bonnes adresses. Je recommande.

Gill is a great host! He responds very quickly and worked with us in accommodating our needs. His place is located in a prime location, close to a subway station and within walking distance to Central Park. Much of the apartment is newly renovated and is very clean and cozy.
Nice appartment in a good location

Terrific apartment in terrific, quieter part of Manhattan! Nearby everything you need and easy to get to all of the main attractions. Will definitely consider staying here again for our next trip back to NYC!

El departamento es muy cómodo mejor de lo que se ve en las fotos !
La ubicación es fantástica está muy cerca de la estación de metro y se un whole food Market espectacular para comer rico y saludable y a buen precio 

Yo volvería !!

This apartment is in the perfect location just a short walk to Columbus circle and the train.  there are plenty of grocery stores and markets, and for me who didn't have any luggage for 4 days, they were a God send along with bits and pieces others had left behind.  

The apartment was spotless, linen in good condition and nicely decorated with plenty of closest space.  As the apartment is at the side of the building, there was lots of privacy and minimal street noise (for New York).

I highly recommend this property, I stayed a week and it was perfect.

Great location near to Columbus Circle station, clean house, good price.

There are some essential kitchen appliances missing (kettle?) and the host is fairly aloof, but these are very minor issues.

I would certainly recommend staying at this place - it is an excellent launching pad from which to explore New York.
The place needs a bit of love. Change the bed frame, better towels. Check drawers for left items etc.
It is in a good location and is very fashionable.

This is a nice little apartment in a great location!  Just right for 1 or 2 people, it has everything you need for a visit to NYC being close to the subway, Columbus Circle, and Lincoln Center.  It is comfortable, spotlessly clean, and fairly quiet for NYC.
Cute place, perfect location, and awesome communication!

name: Big Downtown Victorian Apartment
summary: Spacious, charming, exceptionally bright and well located apartment on the top floor of an older 3 story building. Enjoy a quiet street steps away from most attractions and the metro/bus system. I have bikes available for guests to use free of charge
space: Excellent location downtown on a quiet hidden street. Spacious apartment on the top floor of a quiet and very charming triplex. Many original architectural details and features. Solid wood floors, doors and cabinetry. Plaster mouldings throughout. VERY bright with large windows that face South. Unbeatable location, 3 minutes from Metro Atwater, steps from St. Catherine Street, Alexis Nihon Shopping Mall, numerous grocery stores, and countless restaurants, bars and cafes. Walking distance from Crescent street, Peel street, the historic Lachine Canal, Atwater market, Windsor Station and other attractions. This apartment is located in the Shaugnessy Village, one of Montreal's oldest and densest neighbourhoods. Amenities include a free washer/dryer, full kitchen with gas stove, living room and seperate bedroom. There is free but limited parking on the street directly in front of the building. More available in the surrounding area making it rarely impossible to find a spot further than 5 m
description: Spacious, charming, exceptionally bright and well located apartment on the top floor of an older 3 story building. Enjoy a quiet street steps away from most attractions and the metro/bus system. I have bikes available for guests to use free of charge Excellent location downtown on a quiet hidden street. Spacious apartment on the top floor of a quiet and very charming triplex. Many original architectural details and features. Solid wood floors, doors and cabinetry. Plaster mouldings throughout. VERY bright with large windows that face South. Unbeatable location, 3 minutes from Metro Atwater, steps from St. Catherine Street, Alexis Nihon Shopping Mall, numerous grocery stores, and countless restaurants, bars and cafes. Walking distance from Crescent street, Peel street, the historic Lachine Canal, Atwater market, Windsor Station and other attractions. This apartment is located in the Shaugnessy Village, one of Montreal's oldest and densest neighbourhoods. Amenities include a free washer/
neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to all downtown attractions, lots of restaurants to accommodate all budgets, minutes away from a shopping mall, plenty of night life options and lots of historic architecture to appreciate.
transit: The apartment is located between two metro stations (orange and green line), 2 minutes from Atwater bus terminal and steps from a Bixi public bike station. There is free parking available on the street and surrounding area but it is limited. If you drive you can expect to be able to find parking, but only after circling the surrounding blocks and carefully reading the no parking signs.
access: The apartment is equipped with WFI, free laundry and cable (website hidden) supplies (spices, oil, coffee, tea) as well as light breakfast is included. I also have two bicycles and helmets available for use free of charge. Please mention at the time of booking if you will be requiring them. A minimum of 72 hours of notice is required in order to guarantee that they will be available.
interaction: I meet and greet, provide a tour, and do a personal key exchange. Your Privacy is assured at all times however if you require assistance I am only a phone call away. You may check out whenever you please as I have a secure box for leaving the keys on the day of departure.
house_rules: -No smoking, pets, excessive noise and disturbances to neighbors -No outside linen (to prevent bedbugs) -No storage of bicycles in the apartment or staircase leading up to it -Lost keys cost 40$ per set to replace Damage to the unit or leaving the unit in poor condition will result in charges being levied against the damage deposit withheld by Airbnb.  The following prices are in effect: Damage to Kitchen table set - Starts at 200$ Broken light fixtures and lamps - Min. from 75$ Broken Chair - 100$ and up Damaged sofa or futon - 200$ Damage to Fireplace - 250$ Holes in the wall - Minimum 100$, depending on size and location Damage to door handle - Minimum 50$ Broken interior doors - Minimum 300$ Damaged or missing toilet seat - Minimum 45$ Broken glass - Minimum 40$ Broken mirrors - Minimum 60$ Damage to patio sets - Minimum 250$ Stains on wall, ceiling or floor - Minimum 100$ Use of fire extinguisher - Minimum 60$ Dirty exterior - Minimum 75$ Furniture scratches - Minimum 75$ (dependi

host.host_about:
I'm born and raised in Montreal but have always loved exploring new cities and countries. I have a strong passion for the outdoors and study Environmental Sciences. Love meeting people from all sorts of different places and try and get out there as much as I can!

I try and treat every guest in my city in all the wonderful ways that I've been treated while travelling abroad. I hope that anyone who visits will come to appreciate why I choose to call this vibrant city home. Bienvenue à Montréal! 

Je parle francais aussi et je vous invite de corresponder en n'importe quelle langue! :)

reviews.comments:
Our stay at Karl's place could not have been any better. Great host, Great place.
Karl wrote back to us immediately and made booking his place super simple and quick.
He greeted us when we arrived and was an ideal host - with a smile despite us being 3 hrs delayed. He gave us all the info and touched base to make sure everything was ok.
His place looked exactly like it did in the pictures - is spacious, clean, has great light and loads of character. Everything you need.
We loved Montreal and staying at Karl's place made it all the better. Great location close to metro station and supermarket.
Would definitely recommend.
Thanks Karl

Karl was an excellent host for our first stay with Airbnb. He met us at the apartment to give us our key. The place was very clean and welcoming, and he even left out some snacks for us. He gave us his number if we had any questions and was very prompt to answer and very helpful! The location was perfect, just a couple minutes away from the metro and right by bus stops. We really enjoyed our stay in his beautiful apartment and recommend it to anyone!

My girlfriend and I moved to Montreal from Toronto and needed a place to stay while we searched for an apartment. Karl's apartment was our top choice, and for good reason!

Karl was personally very accommodating. We had to push our arrival date back a day, and Karl was flexible in this matter.

Upon arrival we were blown away with how beautiful the apartment was. The kitchen was fully stocked (Karl left us some food and a couple beers) and had a great gas stove.

My girlfriend and I would definitely recommend staying at Karl's place when you visit Montreal.

Karl is a friendly and considerate host, ensuring open communication, answering all our questions and even leaving a few beer for us. The apartment is fairly basic, but more than suffices as an excellent base to explore the city, being very close to both a metro station and a selection of shops & cafes (I highly recommend Cacao 70, specializing in all things chocolate!)  I'd definitely recommend Karl's place!

Karl was an excellent host, he was very accommodating, and communication was almost  instantaneous. The apartment was also wonderful, it had a very rustic and cozy vibe, and once we opened a bottle of wine we had a hard time leaving the place. Excellent location and apartment, would return in a heartbeat.
Karl was a great host. Our stay was short and very last minute but he was very accommodating. The place was clean and a good size for 2 people. Good location. Street parking was available.
Karl was a wonderful host and extremely accommodating due to the last minute nature of our trip. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Karl's and would do so again!

Karl was an excellent host and his place was wonderful. He was quick to respond to texts and emails; he made picking up and dropping off the keys a cinch; and he made himself available to help out if we had any problems. It was blisteringly cold in Montreal, but Karl's apartment was warm and cozy with an excellent vinyl collection and an N64 (MarioKart included!).

The only downsides were that free parking can be hard to find and the wifi was a little weak. I lucked out and, after circling the block a few times, was able to find parking just in front of the apartment, and I didn't really need the internet much anyway.

Great experience! Karl is an extraordinary host who takes care of every little detail to make sure his guests have all they need! Very helpful, friendly, informative. Great location : clean, bright, warm. Definitely recommend it! Thanks again!

Karl is a fantastic host who always replies promptly and is nearby to answer any questions. His place is centrally located and an easy walk to restaurants and two metro stations. Despite the snow and cold outside, the space stayed warm and cozy. I would highly recommend Karl to anyone looking to stay in Montreal.

Karl was a most gracious host … he was flexible and understanding. His apartment was charming and well prepped for our arrival …Karl was also very helpful with questions and enquiries … apartment is in great and convenient location …Thanks Karl!

Karl's apartment is well located near the Atwater Station of the Metro - easy for getting into the city centre. I know the area itself has lots too offer too, but my stay was too short and I was too busy to explore it properly. The apartment itself is very spacious, charming, and has all the amenities you may require. Karl is really friendly, very accommodating and prompt to reply to all questions. Overall, a good value for your stay in Montreal!

A fantastic experience!  

Karl was so nice, and accommodating, and very quick answering any questions we had.  We got in a little later than expected, and he helped us find a parking spot where we could stay for the entire weekend.  Being so close to the metro made getting around really easy, we parked the car and didn't look back.  There were bikes, locks and helmets to use, which were a plus, but we didn't end up using them.

The place is great.  We loved the record player, and the kitchen was perfect, small and stocked.  The greenery around the apartment was a nice touch too.

This was our first time using airbnb and Karl certainly raised the bar high.

Merci encors!

J'ai adoré mon séjour chez Karl! Une amie nous a accueillis à notre arrivée, et tout était super! Le quartier est formidable, près d'un métro, d'épiceries, de cafés, environ 30 minutes de marche du Quartier des spectacles! 

L'appartement était suffisamment spacieux pour deux personnes!
Great location and nice apartment, perfect for a long weekend in Montreal. Communication with Karl was easy and speedy, he was accomadating to our arrival and departure times.

My partner and I stayed in Karl's place for an extended period (6 weeks) when we first moved to Montréal and we found it to be a really good option. The neighbourhood is well-located, close to downtown but also the Lachine Canal and Atwater Market. It also has two metro stations (Atwater and Georges-Vanier, on the orange and green lines respectively) within walking distance and a bixi stand within a 2 minute walk of the apartment. The apartment itself is full of character and charm and is well-equipped with almost anything you could require during your stay in Montreal (a great record collection, to start with!). We found it to be very comfortable. The experience of dealing with Karl has been really great - he is very helpful and flexible (he let us extend our stay a few extra days) and always responsive to my messages / emails. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Karl's place to anyone looking for a place to stay during a visit to Montréal.
The reservation was canceled 30 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Karl was an excellent host. He provided some good recommendations for neighborhood shops and restaurants. The location is quite good--I was in Montreal for a conference at a downtown hotel, and it was a 15-minute walk away, or a very short metro ride. It's also a short walk to the bus to and from the airport, which made arrival and departure very convenient. Flexible arrival and departure times were helpful, and the apartment is spacious and quite comfortable. Thanks for a good stay!

This was my first airbnb experience for myself. It was very good. Although due to some timing issues we didn't get to meet our host in person, the apartment was great and the experience was awesome. I would recommend Karls place to anyone in need of a place to stay in Montreal.  the location is quite close to downtown without it being loud or noisy.  The facilities are well stocked and parking was much easier than I thought.   Karl was very communicative and gave lots of information for our stay and the surrounding area for entertainment.

Karl was a wonderful host. His apartment was clean and cozy, and provided a printout of fun hotspots and bars and any information we needed. I would definitely stay again and recommend his place to anyone visiting Montreal.

Karl was a very thoughtful host and provided us with all the information we needed which was really helpful as we were nervous about driving to Montreal. The apartment was very convenient to access from the highway. Karl was even so kind to arrange private parking for us as his street was under heavy construction. Even though he was out of the city he was quick to reply and arranged a smooth check in/out for us. The location was a great hub to explore the city by bus/subway. Friendly neighbours, fast and reliable wifi.. Thanks Karl!

Karl nous a super bien accueilli, son appartement était tel que décrit sur le site. Il était vraiment bien placé et avait beaucoup de charme. Nous avons passés un super moment a Montreal et en grande partie a cet appartement et cet hôte merveilleux. Milles merci Karl!
We definitely recommend Karl and his beautiful fat. We spent a great great time ;)

Although I did not actually meet Karl in person, he was very accommodating and gave me plenty of information about the apartment. His friend Sarah was there to oversee things and was lovely and helpful. The apartment itself was in the perfect location for me, and although it's right downtown the tiny street was fairly quiet. The building is very old and has a lot of character but could also use a bit of tlc, such as a paint touch up. A few things also seemed a bit jimmy-riged together. All and all it met my needs just fine.

My husband and I had a terrific honeymoon in Montreal, no small thanks to Karl! His place was cozy, spacious and within walking distance to several bars, shops and restaurants that we frequented. Karl even provided a list of recommendations, which came in handy since we are from the US. Karl was accommodating, and easy to work with. When we make it back to
Montreal, we would love to stay here again. Merci!!!

La reservation de l'appartement s'est fait la veille, et j'ai eu une réponse positive tres rapidement de Karl, ce qui est appréciable. Ce qui l'est davantage c'est son charmant appartement. Ensoleillé, lumineux et calme. j'y ai passé une tres agréable soirée, et journée le lendemain. C'etait une halte d'une nuit vraiment chouette, avant de partir pour Paris. J'ai pu rester dans la maison tout le lendemain avant mon vol du soir. Je recommande l'appartement de Karl vivement!

Karl is a great host; he is very responsive and left helpful maps to indicate areas where you can park. The apartment is right off Saint Catherine and is just minutes away from the metro. Reliable host, convenient location, and fantastic price!

Karl was a terrific host and accommodated our late arrival on the first night super graciously. The apartment itself was exactly what we needed: very close to my work and the metro, as well as cool neighborhoods to eat and go out. The place has a lot of charm, with unique, original architectural details and a very cute vintage kitchen. Overall the apartment had a very European feel and felt quite cozy (and quiet) despite the busy downtown location. Karl set out plenty of clean towels for us, as well as coffee. Both Robin and I enjoyed our stay.  Thanks Karl!  -Danica

We had a great stay at Karl's apartment. The place has so much character and is in a nice part of town. The metro is easily accessible, and there are lots of nice places to check out nearby. Karl is a great host as well with good communication before and during the trip. Highly recommend staying here when visiting Montreal!

The apartment was exactly how Karl described it; spacious, very bright and well located. We would love to stay here again as it is such a cozy home.
The metro is very close by so you have access to most of the city whilst being tucked away in a quiet spot. Saint Catherine Ouest is minutes away and is a great place to wander along.
Karl was great at keeping in touch and very flexible even though he seemed quite busy. He'd thought of everything from coffee to towels to make our stay a very comfortable one.

Karl was a great host and his home was a great base for all of our adventures in Montreal. Centrally located to St. Catherine Street and Old Montreal, it was perfect for seeing most of the city on foot while also being close to the metro station. We were happy to find many great restaurants and even a comedy club close by. :)

Karl provided a map to various eateries which was a big help when we first ventured out to find food. The parking guide that we were given was the biggest help in avoiding tickets in a city that is partially permit, free, and metered parking. Karl was very communicative during our stay and even checked in with us half way through the weekend. 

I would recommend anyone to stay in his home. It was clean, comfortable, and spacious for two people with lots of Victorian charm.

The apartment was wonderful, very clean and comfortable! Perfect location; a quiet side street within a few blocks of the more main areas. Karl was really helpful with finding parking nearby and coordinating getting the key. We didn't know our arrival time until the morning of but he was easy to get a hold of and figure out last minute details. 

Great place and host, highly recommend it!

My boyfriend and I had an absolutely lovely stay here.  Karl did a great job at making us feel at home.  He had great recommendations of things to do in the area.  He was also very prompt with communication.  The apartment was great, we had everything we needed and it felt very cozy.  Neighborhood was great too, just steps away from restaurants, shopping, and the metro.  We had a great stay in Montreal and we would totally recommend this place to a friend!

Had a great time. Apartment was cozy for a quick winter get away. Scoring parking right outside was a plus. Karl was super awesome and flexible. Excellent location. Really enjoyed the space, would stay again.

We had a great and stress free stay at Karl's place. He wasn't able to be there when we checked in, but he sent me a very detailed message about getting the keys, where to go, and how to get in. Once inside, there we're detailed printouts about the apt, parking and restaurants\bars in the area. The parking instructions greatly helped, as we don't know French and had no idea where we could and couldn't park. His place was simple and clean and provided just what we needed for a one night stay in Montreal. The heat was at a very comfortable level when we arrived and remained so throughout the night. The place is old, so be aware. That isn't a negative aspect necessarily, but don't expect hotel quality or the particulars of new or newly renovated bldg. AGAIN, there was nothing wrong with the place and we appreciated the charm of an old bldg. I would recommend staying here to anyone. We were able to walk to most of the areas dense with bars and restaurants within 15 minutes. In fact with a few minutes you can get to St. Catherine which literally has everything located on it.

Karl's place is in a great location, well equipped and comfortable. My husband spent well over two months in the apartment and it became our home away from home in Montreal. We got used to the few quirks in the place which can be attributed to the age of the building. Overall a nice place and a great host, thank you so much!

We stayed at Karl's place for just over a week and enjoyed every minute of it. The apartment is really bright and very cosy. It has a few quirks like creaky floors, but that just adds to the charm. The apartment was very clean and its well situated. Karl was a great host. He provided us with extra keys and checked up on us to make sure everything was ok. He was also really easy to contact and quick to reply.

Karl was a great host! We didn't get the chance to actually meet him but he provided lots of information about his place and Montreal before we even arrived. Key pick-up/drop-off was easy, the apartment was very clean (and charming!) and his parking diagrams were very much appreciated (especially since we were there on Victoria Day Long weekend). You couldn't ask for a better location either - the metro was a few minutes walk away and there were plenty of places to eat/shop nearby. If you're looking for a charming apartment that's right in the middle of all the action, his place is perfect.

Beautiful apartment in a fabulous location! Everything was as pictured, though some parts of the apartment seemed a little aged, such as the bed frame which was held up on blocks. Nonetheless, we had a wonderful four day stay. We used the kitchen only to keep ingredients for light breakfast (no stovetop use), but the fridge definitely came in handy. The living room receives a lot of light and eating breakfast at the table by the window (which actually has a quaint view overlooking a small playground) was a very nice amenity. Overall, an adequately clean, safe, comfortable apartment. The privacy was highly valued, as was the three-block proximity to the metro. A great value that I would highly recommend to other travelers!

We’ve had a wonderful time at Karl’s place. The host was kind enough to leave detailed instructions of nearby places to visit, so getting around is quite easy and, most importantly, there is a subway station at walking distance so you can get quickly wherever you want. The place is as described: spacious and with a very useful fully equipped kitchen (not only the basic hardware for show, but all kinds of spices and things a person really uses for cooking). There is an espresso machine and a turntable. Both were very useful, as I could enjoy some java while listening to calypso record I had just bought (many nice places for used vinyl in Montreal!). There are some quirks one might need to get used to: since it is an old house, the wooden floors are noisy, there is a steep stairway to get to the condo, and the doors or windows might get difficult to open or close; actually one of the external windows fell onto my friend finger as he was trying to deal with a jammed latch. It bleeded badly and hurt a lot, but thankfully there was a first aid kit well equipped to deal with the situation. I do not blame the host, since it was an accident, but it is certainly related to specific oddities to what is overall a charming place to stay.

Safe area, easy access from the 720, easy access to grocery stores and the metro, and walking distance to great restaurants and pubs. All in all, I wouldn't say this matched the description exactly...when we arrived, there was no AC and no wi-fi. However, when we called Karl to ask about the missing AC and wi-fi, he was accommodating -- he came to install a window-mounted AC unit on Day 2, and he did try to get us wi-fi, but unsuccessfully. The bedroom window gives onto a sort of alleyway where surrounding apartments have their balconies. On our first night, the neighbours had a party on their balcony that kept us up until about 2 am. It was impossible to block out the noise. The floors are very creaky, which makes it difficult to be quiet (i.e. if you're getting up at night, expect to wake up everyone else in the place).
Karl was a great host. His place really felt like home. He was very communicative and accommodating with checkin and checkout times.

Overall this was an ok experience, and the host was away but really attentive. But - the apartment's condition didn't meet our expectations based on the pictures & price point (we would say it was "fairly pricy" - not super cheap, but not super expensive based on other listings we looked at). Would definitely stay again at a cheaper price, or if it was more polished. More details: There were multiple nights when the neighbours were loud until very late - 2am, 3am. Though the kitchen has plates, some spices, some dishes (enough to cook ok), it was not easy to cook in because there was no light & no small spoons and some other small items were missing. The bathroom was clean, but pretty rickety. There was only men's soap & no shampoo (though we were told there would be toiletries). The AC was only available in the bedroom, so it got pretty hot in the kitchen sometimes. The good: great location, clean, really attentive host, pretty spacious, and had great amenities (washer, dryer, etc). Overall I think this listing would be worth the 'fairly pricy' price if things were more polished around the house - it has a great location, great vibe, a great host, and is pretty spacious.

we didn't get a chance to meet karl but check in was painless.
apartment is in super great location, easily walkable and real neat walk... some good restaurants along the way.
the apartment itself is old, furniture is tired, some of it is charming :)  we had no issues, once that air conditioner in the room started doing its magic it saved our lives.

Karl was a very accommodating host -- before our arrival, he provided detailed information about the location and parking instructions. He was friendly and responsive to our questions.

The location of the apartment is convenient, just 5 min walk away from the closest metro station and from shops and restaurants. 

We didn't spend too much time in the apartment itself but it is functional with all the essentials you would need!

We had a fantastic time in Montreal while staying at the apartment. The entire experience was seamless from the time we booked the space to the time we checked out. Karl made us feel very welcome and at ease as he made himself available if we ever had any questions or concerns.
 
The apartment was just as described with a little added personality, which made us feel like we were staying over at a friends place. The location of the apartment was perfect for us since it was so close to the metro. The two bikes which Karl made available for us to use was icing on the cake as we got to explore the city from a different perspective. Overall we were both very happy with our experience and would definitely recommend this listing to any of our family or friends. Thanks Karl!

Place was easy to find and was very large even for two people.  All the amenities were provided.  Place was in good condition.  Lots of apartment buildings nearby so at times you can her noise form the neighbours.

We had a wonderful stay at Karl's place. Although we never actually met in person, he was always very quick to answer our questions. We were there in September, and the window boxes were full of geraniums. This made it an absolutely lovely place to have our morning coffees. That living room gets so much sunlight! We were also particularly drawn to this place because of the available bikes, but everything we wanted to see and do was so close that we ended up walking everywhere instead. The only downside was that the bed is ever so slightly uneven so that both people end up sinking into the middle. This would be fine for a couple but maybe annoying for friends sharing a bed. Upshot: the big couch is divinely comfortable. All in all, it's bright, unique, and well located. We would definitely recommend it.

Our stay was thoroughly enjoyable at Karl's place. There were 3 of us (adults) staying there but this place could easily hold 4 people. The apartment was exactly as listed and was very tidy and clean. The location is very convenient as it's just steps away from the metro where you can catch the bus or train to take you anywhere. Karl was always available by text/phone whenever we had questions for him. We would definitely rent this place again next time we visit Montreal!

This apartment was exactly as it looks in the photos. We loved it as soon as we walked in. The big windows let in lots of sun and the whole thing was very spacious. We felt immediately welcome, because of Karl and because there were even a few things left in the fridge that we were free to take. Highly recommended and we'll be back!

Overall, our experience staying at Karl's place was great! He was very friendly and communicative during our stay. From checking in to navigating around the area, Karl was helpful through everything. The place itself was charming, spacious, private and thankfully in close proximity to some cool restaurants, markets and a metro station. Karl helped make our vacation run smoothly and he was an incredibly generous host. Thanks, Karl!
Karl was very easy to communicate with about check in and with any questions we had. The apartment was large, clean and in a great location.

Karl is a very kind and thoughtful host, his place was very clean and everything was in order.  The apartment was well equipped with everything that we needed and it was very convenient because of its close proximity to all the popular places in Montreal. Karl stayed in constant touch with us till the time we were there and he was very prompt in replying to our queries. I highly recommend his place!

Karl was extremely responsive throughout the booking and the stay. His apartment is great - the lighting is incredible and the old feel is very cozy. It's exactly as shown in the photos and maybe even a little larger. We were able to use his kitchen and supplies to cook, which was really nice. Karl made us feel super welcome and the apartment was the perfect getaway for the weekend - definitely recommend!
Karl was responsive and had some great suggestions for food. The apartment was as advertised and is close to a street full of great restaurants. Overall a positive experience in a great city.

Karl was super accommodating -- even going out of his way to tune up the bikes for us!

Great apartment in a convenient location. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks, Karl!

Karl was very responsive and made it easy for us to get access to the apartment. The unit was just as pictured and very clean. It included everything people coming to Montréal for the weekend might need. The location is excellent and we were able to park right in front of the house. A great experience.

Karl's place is wonderful. Located quite central, next to Atwater Metro you can reach all the interesting sites even within walking distance. The apartment is cozy and very quite. Karl is very welcoming and ready to answer any question. The handover was quick and relaxed. Thanks Karl!!!! :)

Karl was there to welcome us even though we only booked it day of and showed up early. His apartment was just as whimsical and homey as the pictures suggested and the neighbourhood was a perfect home base from which to adventure. He lent us a couple bikes as a bonus which made exploring the canal, Atwater market and old port a breeze. The kitchen was great for our brekky overlooking the playground outside where the neighbourhood kids play - great little residential pocket in the heart of downtown. The gas stove, cappuccino machine and tea assortment were a great touch. I would highly recommend Karl as a host to anyone looking for a peaceful space in a great location, him and his home are a pleasure.

We stayed at Karls apartment for a 3 day weekend. He was out of town at the time, but was very trusting and inviting towards us in his home. The apartment is perfectly located, a short walk to St-Catherines St. where you can find all kinds of restaurants and bars, grocerie stores, and close to the metro (subway). We really enjoyed our stay.  Karls apartment was very comfortable, clean, and had everything that we could of needed. There was always street parking during our stay, and there is even a cute little park right across the street from the apartment. Karl was kind enough to send us a message over the weekend to make sure that everything was going well. We would definitively recommend staying at his home for your stay in Montreal.
The place was great, a nice little neighborhood, close to everything, spacious, the host was very quick to respond to questions and everything went very smoothly

Karl was a great host. He answered all my questions in a timely manner via text message and phone. His place is in a great location. Its walking distance to At Catherine's. One main factor was the free parking near Karl's apartment.  I would recommend staying at his place.

We had a great time in Montreal, and having a host like Karl made it all easier and more home like. Beautiful apartment and super comfortable. Great location also, which made it easier to get in to town and mont royal. Definitely recommend this apartment and host.
Great apartment thanks so much Karl!

The apartment is very old and has a lot of character. Very bright location with lots of shops/restaurants nearby. It's also extremely close to the metro! Karl checked up on us and we really enjoyed our stay in this cozy apartment.

Our trip to Montreal and our stay at Karl's was great!
He was very communicative and helped us even before we arrived. He provided guidance about parking, tips about the city and was very helpful in all regards. We are actually sad we didn't get to meet him in person.
The apartment itself is very cute, clean and great location. Super close to metro stations, etc...floors are a little bit squeaky, but hey, that's part of the charm of staying at an old victorian building.

This was my first time booking an Airbnb, and Karl was a great host!  He provided detailed instructions for check in and parking, making the process smooth.  The apartment was cute, clean, and great for our needs.  Location is walking distance to restaurants and close to the metro for easy access to all of the landmarks and sights of Montreal!

Our stay at Karl’s was fantastic. We felt welcomed in his home, and not just because in the cute park across the street was a Fa Lun Da Fa marching band performance that put a little spring in our step. The front door key was a bit sticky to open at first, but after the first couple times we’d mastered it and it became a point of pride for us. His home was nice and cozy, with nice architectural details like stained glass windows and a lovely fireplace. We specifically loved using the espresso machine every morning as a special vacation treat. Karl was also nice enough to loan us his bikes, which made getting around cheap and way more fun than being stuck underground on a nice day. We feel like we saw so much because we were able to get around this way! If two wheels aren’t for you, the city is very walkable and his home is just a short walk from the train station. Overall, Karl was friendly and communicative, even recommending bike routes for us to take. We would be happy to stay at his home again!

We had a great stay at Karl's apartment. The location was great: a couple of blocks from the metro, within walking distance of a good number of shops and restaurants (including the best ramen I've ever had), and free parking that wasn't too difficult to come by in a quiet neighborhood. 

Karl was generous with his amenities, welcoming us to use anything we found in the kitchen and making check-in and check-out super easy. The apartment wasn't anything fancy, but it was cozy and just what we needed. 

As a host, Karl is clearly concerned with his guests' experience. He gave me a bunch of recommendations for things to do in the area and checked in several times via text/email even though he wasn't in the area at the time of our stay.

This listing was perfect for a quick 3 day weekend trip. Karl set us up with instructions for check in and we had no problems getting in and set up early in the day.  Parking was great we got lucky and found a great spot around the corner where we were able to leave the car from Friday when we arrived till Sunday when we left.  A big selling point for us was that bikes were included we had a great time riding around the city and not having to worry about where we would park the our car.  Overall we had a great stay and enjoyed experiencing a new area of Montreal

Karl was very gracious and always available to answer any questions we had during our stay. The home was very clean and comfortable, the location was absolutely perfect for exploring the city and we felt very safe.  Not one complaint.

This was a delightful apartment.  The location was great. We could walk to Old Montreal and the Latin Quarter in about 40 minutes, and approximately the same to Mont Royal (I can't quite remember the exact timings).  Very close to restaurants on Ste Catherine and also Crescent St.  
Karl was very helpful.  We didn't meet him but he sent instructions as to how to get in the apartment and also very helpful and detailed parking instructions/tips.
The air conditioning was great especially on such a hot weekend. We didn't really use the kitchen at all except to store a few things in the fridge, so I can't comment on the kitchen really, but overall this was a good choice to stay at in Montreal.  Thanks for letting us stay there Karl! ☺
Nice place to stay. Easy to get around and close to lots of shops and restaurants. Karl answered all our questions and was extremely easy to get in touch with.

While Karl's place was clean and centrally located, it definitely had a deep bachelor vibe; personal touches like the plants and some of the artwork shown in photos of the apartment were absent, leaving the place feeling a little Spartan. Also not accurately depicted was the somewhat ripped and shabby furniture in the living room. Ok, so maybe not the best place for a thirty something married couple, but for those seeking an affordable spot in Montreal, this was hard to beat. What to expect: The pros: A great location, walkable to tons of restaurants downtown, and a fifteen minute walk to Atwater Market and a couple of metro stations. Also close by was a little park, which screens movies on some summer evenings. A well equipped kitchen - being in Montreal will make you want to binge on good food. With the markets so close, you may want to prepare your own meal (we just gorged on bread and cheese, mainly, but a fridge and toaster made this easy). A charming old building - lots of nice architectural touches like plaster molding, big windows and high ceilings gave the apartment an airy feel. It was clean (mostly) - the floors felt freshly cleaned, the linens were crisp and there were a couple of freshly washed towels. While there was still some trash and recycling from the previous guest, none of it was stinky, so not too bad. The cons: Parking - while Karl have ample direction in what the parking was like in the area, it was still a bit of a pain; when no street parking was available, we had to park at a meter overnight and be up and back at the car by 7am to either move it or pay. As this is a densely populated area, parking gripes come with the territory, but if you don't have to drive, you will have one less thing to think about. Transients - while I don't mind telling a guy "I'm not interested" when he's trying to sell me wine or stolen nail polish out of his backpack, some people might. Again, it's downtown, and this isn't the Ritz. Communication: As not everyone traveling to Canada internationally has the ability to text freely, it might be good to get instructions on how to get into the apartment in advance. While I told Karl of our travel plans, and when we expected to get there, he told me that there would be a lockbox with a key, but not the location of the lockbox or the combination, so we had to stand on the porch with our bags for a little while while we texted Karl for the rest of the necessary information we needed to gain access. He responded within a few moments, but having the info in advance would have been cooler. Bottom line - if you are looking for affordable access to Montreal and don't mind hanging out on dorm-quality furniture, this place is tops. 22-year-old...

Karl was a very helpful host and staying in his apartment was a blast. if there was ever anything we needed he would offer to help and was very good at communicating with us the entire stay. We couldn't have picked a better location with the metro station and shops all at our doorstep. his apartment has so much character and we would stay there again. cheers Karl!

Karl's place was absolutely perfect! The location can't be beat - so close to the Metro and tons of amazing restaurants - and such a perfect size for exactly what I needed. Karl was incredibly helpful and quick to respond to any questions I asked, and I had such an amazing time. I would 100% recommend this place. Merci!!

Karl was very welcoming and communicative throughout my stay. The apartment is a cozy one-bedroom, and everything is old but charming. Relics like the little gas stove and the freestanding tub/shower combo were interesting but not inconvenient.
