My favorite part was the bicycles (Karl has like 5 of different sizes and styles) that made it really easy to get around more comfortably than Montreal's Bixi system. It was also nice to be greeted by the landlord's huge fluffy samoyed and the neighbor's Persian cat.

We didn't meet Karl, but his check in system worked good for us. Like other said, this is an old apartment and the lock is a little sticky (Tip: turn left to open the door and right to lock it). My wife and I like the feel to live in the antique atmosphere.  This is a perfect location to explore Montreal and there are plenty good restaurants within 5 minutes walk. The parking spots are very popular, but we can always find a spot (Tip: read the sign carefully).

We had an amazing time. Karl was easy to contact any day. The location was great! Super close to all the shopping you can imagine. Old town was easy to get to and we were able to use Karl's bikes but also took a long walk on another day. We also realized right before we left just how close we were to Mount Royal and hiked there from Karl's place.
great appartment in a nice area. parking space hunting is really time consuming though...

Had a great stay in Karl's place. Depends on what you are looking for but it's well located and close to the more commercial side of Montreal, shopping, bars and nightlife. Also a highlight is having the bike(s) at your disposal. Parc Royal lookout is only ride away and definitely recommended at sunset or in the morning. Karl was super helpful and communicative.

The area has some characters and the apartment does have a certain student vibe but for the price and location as a solo traveler or a couple I would definitely recommend.

Karl was excellent host, although I did not meet him in person he was available 24h and very helpful, and also provided help with parking and other issues. His apartment is very close to metro station and that is great advantage.

Karl made excellent arragements for our arrival and even though he did not have the chance to meet us in person he communicated well throughout the stay, checking in with us to make sure that everything was alright. The bikes were a nice touch as well, this is a perfect hub for exploring Montreal.

Karl's place is a comfortable apartment that is conveniently located close to anything you may want to do during your time in Montreal! Just a short walk from night life, the movie theater, an arcade, the grocery store, plenty of restaurants, lots of shopping, and many more. He was a great host and the apartment was exactly as described in the listing. Would stay here again!

The location was perfect for us, Karl was really helpful, got us bikes, everything was smooth. This is a short description because our 4-day staying in Montreal was very busy and we couldn't enjoy the apartment's facilities. Hopefully next time.
Great place and Karl was a good communicator.

The apartment was in a great location, just outside of the core downtown so things were very walkable. The apartment was spacious and the host was good with communication. Would recommend staying here and we would stay here again.

Karls apartment was just as the pictures and we really enjoyed our stay there! There were some misunderstandings upon arrival but Karl was very quick to resolve them and all in all we had a really good impression of Karl. I would absolutely recommend his apartment if you want a cozy and spacious place, and the location is great. Really close to the Saint Cathrine street in downtown (and to one of the best breakfast spots!), walkable distance to Mount Royal and to Old Montreal. When we missed our train from Montreal, Karl was super nice and let us stay in the apartment after check out! Thanks!

Karl's place is just as pictured. Nice, lots of light, and close to public transit and shops.

Free street parking is a plus as we drove in from quebec city.  

Karl is welcoming and generous in his offerings. Would recommend the stay.

My boyfriend and I took a weekend trip to Montreal and Karl's place was in a really good location for us (a block or so away from the metro). Also very close to shops and food! Parking was a bit confusing to figure out (definitely ask beforehand for a map or something if you don't get service in Cananda). The place was nice and charming, and Karl helped us book a reservation for a restaurant when we didn't have phone service. He communicates very quickly!

Karl's place is perfect in terms of location. It is definitely old,but has a character.Karl seems to be a nice person.We did not see him in person,but he was reachable and answered back promptly. The only negative thing was cleanliness. The place definitely needs some cleaning.

We had a great time at Karl's place! It is in a fantastic location and was very comfortable. Karl was very easy to get a hold of and was great about giving us early check-in/check-out times. I would definitely stay here again!
Good place to stay. Close to many interest points downtown
This apartment is in a great location and easy to walk to restaurants and the art museum. We would recommend Karl as a great host who was very responsive me helpful!

Описание жилья очень подробное и четкое, именно то, что вы увидите. Прекрасное расположение: недалеко от метро, но до центра вполне можно дойти пешком, рядом есть велостанция. Продуктовые магазины и кафе недалеко от дома. Само жилье чистое, теплое, красивое, в приятном районе. 
Мы не разу не видели хозяина лично, но Карл очень быстро помогал нам с решением всех вопросов. В списке рекомендуемых к посещению мест нашли интересные для себя, поход в Comedy Nest был отличным! :)
Спасибо прекрасному хозяину! Это отличное место, чтобы остановиться в Монреале.
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour. L'appartement est très agréable, bien équipé et idéalement situé.

Karl's place is close to shops and restaurants. It was convenient to walk out and find ourselves in the middle of action. We stayed during Montreal's 375th birthday and parades happened just a block away from Kyle's place. 
We had a great time. Thanks Kyle for hosting!
Karl was very helpful! He sent us awesome info so we could figure out parking. The location is great! Lots of great things really close by. The place was very charming!

Just stayed at Karl's for 3 nights and had a great time! Karl was very helpful and easy to reach. His place has a lot of charming details and feels very cosy. The location was perfect! I would definitely stay at his place again

We were very happy with our stay. The apartment had all the amenities we could need, it was near great restaurants, and was very easy. It was near a subway, but it's a bit far from most of the key spots if you're visiting for a few days. Parking on the street was great if you can find a spot in a free zone and keep it there, but it was difficult to figure out where to put it during the one-hour street sweeping. The wifi worked well, the area was quiet enough to sleep well, and the air conditioning was nice. The only real downside for us was that the apartment is really not for tall people. The bed is very short with a footboard that made it so my husband had to sleep on the pull out couch (not comfy!). His head also stuck out of the shower. Other than that, it was a great apartment for our needs and we recommend it.
Logement bien placé, proche centre et commodités (métro, supermarché, centre ville), flexibilité des horaires de la part de Karl.

Karl's apartment was in a great location and great size! Though parking on the street might seem challenging because of required resident stickers, we were able to easily find parking using Karl's detailed map. The location was right near a metro stop, and a couple blocks from St. Catherine street! There was a grocery store not too far either. The walk to the old city was maybe 25-30 minutes, we enjoyed being able to go many places from this location! We weren't able to use the bikes because it was raining but it was nice to know they were able to be used! Karl was accommodating with forms of communication, given that we did not have data to use and could only use Wifi infrequently! Thanks for a wonderful stay Karl!

Жилье Карла чем-то напомнило нам питерский старый фонд. Квартира эта с характером и особенной атмосферой. В ней ей все необходимое, она просторная и очень солнечная. Магазины, рестораны и остановки общественного транспорта находятся в шаговой доступности. 
Из минусов: здание старое, в нем нет лифта и чтобы подняться на второй этаж, вам придется преодолеть два достаточно крутых и узких лестничных пролета. В соседнем здании в данный момент ведутся строительные работы, которые иногда начинаются в 7 утра. В спальне имеется кондиционер, тоже далеко не бесшумный, но со своей работой справляется.

Really charming little apartment in a very good location. Karl was very helpful in sorting out everything from the door-locking techniques to the wifi. 
Walking distance to plenty of good restaurants and into downtown. Not too far if you fancy a walk up the mountain too.
Karl was a great host and was quick to respond to any queries we had. The property itself was very charming and has everything we needed for a comfortable stay.
Karl is extremely communicative and accommodating. The apartment has charming Victorian details and is centrally located (especially near good restaurants and a market).
Great location! Only a 5 minute walk to the metro station and many restaurants and grocery stores. The apartment was cozy and has everything you would need for a weekend getaway.

Would highly recommend Karl's place. Karl himself was very helpful at answering questions considering this was our first time using airbnb. Location is excellent. It's a very short walk to Rue Ste Catherine which has a bunch of very good restaurants (I would highly recommend SamCha to anyone who likes Asian food -- it blew me away.) Also a short walk to the metro. Would definitely stay here again if we make another trip to Montreal.
This place was very cute and had everything we needed. We were able to borrow bikes which was great. The espresso machine is also awesome. Close to the subway and a commercial stretch.

My wife and I spent a weekend at Karl's place. The location is great. We were able to easily find parking in front of the apartment several times over the weekend.

We never actually met Karl, but that was not a problem at all. Karl was great communicating with is and were able to easily get into the apartment without him there.

The apartment is represented accurately and we would definitely recommend staying there.

My girlfriend and I wanted to go to Montreal for a week trip. Found Karl's place and it checked all the boxes. 
 
Location: It's centrally-located near the metro(s) which are the best way to get around the city.  Also within walking distance of Mount Royal which was very welcome as that was on our destination list. There's also a mall nearby so if you need a pharmacy or anything it's easily-found. Timmy HoHo's is nearby as well if you want your caffeine fix. 
 
Cleanliness: Very clean and well-kept. Had no issues with the condition of the apartment. 
 
Style: high-ceilings and very similar to a pre-war place in NYC if you're familiar with it. Very much liked it and the price for what we got. 
 
Note on parking: We drove up and threw my car in a nearby lot for $52 (CAD) for 4 days ($13/day). Was easier than dealing with moving my car and the street cleaning.  The parking in the area does require placards for certain times and free parking isn't necessarily in the immediate area. Karl said he could provide info on the parking, but I didn't ask about it and just decided to leave my car in a lot. 
 
Overall, I liked the place and was very happy with the trip. Karl's a great host and kept in contact throughout the trip.

Very close to St. Catherine's street. Parking is tough, it's limited. We got lucky twice and not so lucky one other time where we had to pay. Karl is great at communicating and answered our messages very fast.

Karl's place is really charming and looks just like on the pictures. There was a problem in the apartment once and Karl came the same day to fix it. Communication was really easy and relaxed. It's close to the metro and just a few minutes walking distance from St. Catherine's street.

My girlfriend and I had a wonderful two weeks staying at Karl's while in Montreal! The apartment is very large, spacious, and classic Montreal style with cool wooden floors and a big claw foot tub. The apartment was very comfortable and had everything we need! Check in and out was very easy as Karl provided clear instructions and we had great communication with him whenever we needed anything. 
The apartment is in an ideal location- you can walk absolutely everywhere, from Atwater market (10 mins) to the metro (<5 mins), to great grocery stores steps away, a couple of Tim Hortons for epic Canadian coffee, and all major downtown areas like St. Catherines, Quartier de Spectacles, le Village, St Denis, St Laurent, Little Burgundy, St Henri, etc., Really it's ideal! It's also a very quiet area so we were never disturbed, and had lots of privacy. 
We actually booked this apartment because we had booked another property months ago, and the host suddenly cancelled - we were really stressed when it happened but are now so happy it did because we were able to stay in this apartment instead, and it's much more our style. I loved it, and would definitely stay here again next time I'm in Montreal.

Quel appartement plein de charme! des boiseries anciennes partout, des vitraux, une déco rétro... et quand même un lit bien confortable! L'appartement est exactement comme montré sur les photos, et j'y ai passé un excellent séjour... 
What a charming flat!! Old wood everywhere, colored glass windows, vintage decoration... and still a really comfortable bed! The flat is exactly as shown on the pictures, and I've had an excellent stay. I didn't meet Karl in person, but he was very responsive during my stay, and left precise instructions for check-in and check-out. An added bonus was that I could use his bike to get around... Overall, I'll happily come back next year!

Clean, easy check in, good communication. We got lucky with a parking spot right out side the apartment. Apartment is located 2 blocks from St Catherine's street and only a few minute walk from downtown. Also close to a metro station although we walked almost everywhere to experience the city. Would absolutely stay again.
Great location and a great host! Thank you for a wonderful stay Karl!

Karl's place is THE Montreal experience. Having lived in Montreal the first 25 years of my live it was just like being home. The location is right downtown and walk-able to everywhere I wanted to be. The apartment itself was clean, uncluttered and cozy. I loved the fireplace and stained glass windows. My friend and I both agreed we'd move back to Montreal if we could get an apartment like Karl's!

Notre séjour chez Karl s’est très bien passé. L’appartement est agréable, en particulier quand il y a du soleil car il est très bien exposé. La déco d’epoque et le plancher donnent beaucoup de cachet au lieu. Il y a un côté un peu « bancal » dû à l’anciennete de l’appartement mais c’est ce qui fait son charme ! En plein centre-ville c’est un excellent rapport qualité-prix ! On est près de tout et notamment de la rue Ste Catherine pratique pour trouver des restos. La communication avec Karl a toujours été très simple et rapide. Nous ne l’avons pas rencontré mais il y avait un Check in par boîtier qui nous a permis d’arriver quand on pouvait.

This was by far the best place I have stayed at in Montreal and I’ve been a few times. You can’t beat the location. The beautiful old style apartment is a short walk from St Catherine and Crescent. Concordia is in walking distance as well. Karl was very helpful with giving tips on which gyms were nearby etc. The bikes were a big plus for us too. I hope to stay here again next time I’m in Montreal! Thanks again Karl

A lovely apartment in a great location. Really perfect for my 10-day work visit to Montreal. Having access to a washer/dryer made it easy for me to travel light. And I appreciated the small touches like providing an HDMI cable for the TV, which allowed me to watch my favorite trashy TV shows on my Netflix account.
Great location. Close to the metro. We never got to meet Karl since he was at work when we got in but his communication was great and we had no problem finding the place. Highly recommend.

Karl's place is great! It's a cozy apartment on a quiet side street, yet so close to everything. Karl is a great host and made our stay very easy, including plenty of information with timely responses. He let us use his bikes which was amazing! Almost anywhere you want to go in a 25 minute ride or less. Thanks Karl!

Great space! Went during a heat wave and the air conditioning in the bedroom was a life-saver, especially in an old victorian home (which retains heat a lot). Pretty central to downtown and Karl was very quick to respond to any of our questions.
Multiple Bixi locations in the surrounding area and right near two Metro stations.
Great place.  Great location.  Perfect base to explore Montreal from.

Appartement confortable et très bien situé pour métro, bus et commerces. Lit très confortable. Par contre le canapé-lit est peu confortable. Dommage...Merci pour réponse rapide pour une location de dernière minute. Natalie

Best part of the place is its location, which is close to the metro, bus stops, and within walking distance to St. Catherine. Parking is relatively simple, you can park on the street (read signs carefully though) and some parking garages not too far away.  

Overall, I thought that the airbnb was worth its value. The place might be a little tight for four people, which Karl mentioned, but we made it work. I'd suggest bringing your own shower essentials though.

The photos of the apartment are accurate.  The location is just on the outskirts of what is officially "downtown" (aka Centre-Ville), a block from Atwater Avenue, a big neighborhood border of sorts.  It suited me because I could walk to classes I was taking downtown, and because, courtesy of the bicycle that came with the apartment, could easily access the trails around the Lachine Canal, take advantage of the great farmers market plus known as the Atwater market, and explore neighborhoods west (like Westmount, etc.).  When you first arrive you might think, oh, the entry stairs look a little shabby, etc.. but otherwise the apartment is great inside, and the neighborhood is good, if perhaps a little off-beat.   A block or two in either direction are gorgeous looking row houses, etc, that would probably cost twice as much, if they were available, so I consider this an EXCELLENT value overall.   AC worked (important for the summer), laundry facilities in the bathroom (excellent for my two week stay, etc.).

The location was convenient for the event I was attending, given the many bike lanes in the area, and the apartment was comfortable and had most amenities including good wifi. It was great that it had A/C in the bedroom and a fan in the front room. We liked the green bike that was  included and used it to get around.  The apartment block had lots of colorful characters, though the children's playground directly opposite kept things sweeter. All in all, a good trip & experience.

My stay at Karl's apartment was just fantastic! Karl is an amazing host and the checking-in process could not have been better.  The location of Karl's beautiful apartment is perfect for a stay in Montreal: close to the metro, beautiful parks, down-town.  And the apartment itself is homely and gorgeous: what a great way to visit a city when feeling immediately at home, and that is exactly how I felt in Karl's great apartment.  Will cross fingers that - whenever I am back in Montreal - Karl's apartment will be available! Don't want to stay anywhere else. Thank you, Karl, for being such a great host. Sofia

I was excited to stay at this place after reading some positive reviews, but to be completely honest myself, and guest were disappointed.

My biggest complaint was this apartment was in desperate need of a deep clean. It was clear this has not happened for a long time,  if ever. At one point, I looked beneath the couch where I was sleeping, and there was at least 2 inches of caked filth, dirt and dust. Then I began to notice is all over the house. The shower was dirty and shower curtain was stained, like it had not been changed for some time. Both of the doors are hard to lock, the front door and door to the apartment (not Karl's fault, but just a warning). When you walk into the hallway of the building your hit with a stench of natural gas (Karl said that the owner of the building is decommissioning some of the old gas pipes, so there might be a residual odor). I understand that this is an old apartment, but even more reason to try to clean it better and remove some of the junk. The house is really cluttered with all kinds of stuff.

To top it off the neighbors had a big party on Saturday night until 4 or 5 in the morning. Kept me up most of the night playing techno and yelling outside. Obviously this is not Karl's fault, but I get the feeling this happens somewhat often as the building and neighbors had a frat vibe. It was amusing that the "house rules" say not to have parties, well maybe thats because you can just join the one next door.

On a positve note Karl was a nice and responsive, but I don't feel that makes up for the condition of the house and lack of cleanliness.

Karl’s apartment was perfect for our week stay in Montreal. We didn’t get to meet Karl as he was away but his communication and check in/our process was impressive. He was very diligent. And, the bikes were an extra plus. 
It’s close to everything you need and the size of the apartment was very decent for Montreal. We were very happy!
Karl's place is great - easily accessible from the airport, close to shops and restaurants, and very homey!

Nice apartment to spend a few days in Montreal. Although we did not get to know Karl, the check in was really comfortable even though we arrived late to the apartment. It is well located, close to a metro stop and many restaurants as well as in a quiet zone.
Honneteté et respect sont essentielles dans une location, Karl néanmoins me semble sympatique mais je ne recommande pas son appartement sans une bonne réhabilitation .

Karl's place was so perfect for us! It's a great set up, easy location, incredibly comfortable and cozy. We will definitely stay again if we return to Montreal and I recommend it to anyone! Merci Karl!
We loved this quaint, authentic " Montrealesque" apartment..In a quiet location but close to everything..Had a wonderful time.

Karl’s apartment was a warm and welcoming haven from some chilly days in Montreal! The space itself is cozy but roomy. It has some beautiful trim and other historic details, including a gorgeous stained glass window in the bedroom and a lovely mantle in the living room. It is centrally located within walking distance of scores of excellent restaurants and bars on vibrant Saint Catherine’s Street and also within walking distance of a lovely neighborhood strip of shops to the south, near the canal. It’s a longish walk or a quick drive from the old port, and only 15 minutes from the airport. Karl gave clear directions, was available and responsive, and overall an excellent host.

If you're looking for Victorian charm in Montreal for a great price, Karl's apartment is the place for you. We especially enjoyed the beautiful fireplace, cozy kitchen, stained glass and big claw foot tub - tres charmant! The apartment is also near to lots of amenities and great places to eat. Checking in and out were a breeze and we were especially grateful for all the info Karl provided on nearby parking. We will definitely try to stay here next time we are in the city!
Charming Victorian apartment in an awesome location with an awesome host.
lovely little place with a great bath tub, nice warm lighting, and a comfy bed

name: Private bedroom in Bushwick BK
summary: Large roomy private bedroom in Bushwick Brooklyn.  Furnished with a full size bed, fresh linens, TV, desk and sitting area.
space: The apartment is located in a two-family home and we occupy the entire top floor. The room is approx. 25'x25' with eastern and southern facing windows that allow for a great amount of natural light. Bedrooms are on opposite sides of the apartment so the room is relatively removed from most of the noise happening throughout the space.
description: Large roomy private bedroom in Bushwick Brooklyn.  Furnished with a full size bed, fresh linens, TV, desk and sitting area. The apartment is located in a two-family home and we occupy the entire top floor. The room is approx. 25'x25' with eastern and southern facing windows that allow for a great amount of natural light. Bedrooms are on opposite sides of the apartment so the room is relatively removed from most of the noise happening throughout the space. Guests will share the bathroom and kitchen with myself and my roommate Athena.  Feel free to use any spices or condiments you need. You will be sharing the space with myself and my roommate Athena.  I'm originally from California and have been living in NYC for 13 years now.  I currently work as a retail manager in Williamsburg Brooklyn.   My roommate Athena is also from California and has been in NYC for over 4 years now. She works in Accounting for an advertising agency.  We have known each other since we were kids so she's very muc
neighborhood_overview: We're located in the heart of Bushwick Brooklyn.  Bushwick has been regarded by many publications as one of the most up-and-coming neighborhoods in NYC right now.  You'll have access to many great bars, restaurants, clubs, and galleries all within walking distance.
transit: We're located within steps of the J/M/Z subway lines that will get you into lower Manhattan within 20min.  If you need any other info about getting to any specific destinations, feel free to ask!
access: Guests will share the bathroom and kitchen with myself and my roommate Athena.  Feel free to use any spices or condiments you need.
interaction: You will be sharing the space with myself and my roommate Athena.  I'm originally from California and have been living in NYC for 13 years now.  I currently work as a retail manager in Williamsburg Brooklyn.   My roommate Athena is also from California and has been in NYC for over 4 years now. She works in Accounting for an advertising agency.  We have known each other since we were kids so she's very much like family to me.  We're both easy going and love to meet new people.  We'll be more than happy to provide any suggestions or answer any questions about the area or NYC in general to make you're experience here most enjoyable.
house_rules: We ask if you smoke to step outside.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: Cali raised creative living in NYC for almost 14 yrs. Laid back with an appreciation for good food, good music, and meeting great people.

name: Perfectly Located Apartment With View
summary: Stylishly modern, clean & comfortable apartment in a character filled Art Deco building overlooking cosmopolitan Potts Point, with its cafes, bars, restaurants & supermarkets, just minutes from central Sydney & close to all transport. It's the perfect base to explore this vibrant city.
space: Welcome to our gorgeous apartment in the heart of Sydney's most stylish neighbourhood, Potts Point.  The apartment is located on the second floor of a secure charmingly older Art Deco building typical of the area. The building is currently under renovation to bring it back to its former glory, however the apartment is newly decorated and includes some stunning mid-century furnishings and polished timber floors. A large sunny outlook with views of the famous Al Alamein fountain and square in front are magic to wake up to in the morning.  Our apartment comfortably fits two people with a real double bed, but can easily accommodate a 3rd guest with our inflatable mattress.
description: Stylishly modern, clean & comfortable apartment in a character filled Art Deco building overlooking cosmopolitan Potts Point, with its cafes, bars, restaurants & supermarkets, just minutes from central Sydney & close to all transport. It's the perfect base to explore this vibrant city. Welcome to our gorgeous apartment in the heart of Sydney's most stylish neighbourhood, Potts Point.  The apartment is located on the second floor of a secure charmingly older Art Deco building typical of the area. The building is currently under renovation to bring it back to its former glory, however the apartment is newly decorated and includes some stunning mid-century furnishings and polished timber floors. A large sunny outlook with views of the famous Al Alamein fountain and square in front are magic to wake up to in the morning.  Our apartment comfortably fits two people with a real double bed, but can easily accommodate a 3rd guest with our inflatable mattress. Guests will have access to the enti
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is centrally located in Sydney's very own slice of Manhattan, the village-like Potts Point, and regally overlooks Fitzroy Gardens on tree-lined Macleay Street , with all the conveniences at your door step. There is no better place to stay and you will have the best of Sydney at your finger tips. There are three supermarkets within a 2 minute walk so it's easy to stock up on groceries for your stay, as well as laundromats and dry cleaners a few doors down, and the Post Office is located in the square in front of the apartment.  It is close enough to all the action and nightlife Kings Cross has to offer, as well as being a tranquil haven overlooking the square and gardens, and is just walking distance to the harbour. The area is at the forefront of the Sydney food scene with some of the best restaurants the city has to offer as well as some of the best coffee, pastries, and local produce, literally at your door step.  We will supply our "insider tips and recommendations" on
notes: This is inner-city living at its best, if you are a light sleeper, please note the apartment is located on the main street of bustling Potts Point which can get noisy particularly on weekends. The apartment is located on the second floor affording a great view over the neighbourhood and leafy square. There is no lift and 2 flights of stairs, and located in a characteristic older Art Deco building (what it lacks in modernity it makes up for in buckets of charm). The bathroom is original but has been updated with a new basin, mirror & shower.
transit: It's conveniently located to all transport with Kings Cross Station a 2 minute walk down the road (one train stop to the CBD). There is also a bus stop right out the front of the building that has regular buses to the hip enclaves of Darlinghurst and Surry Hills, and picture-perfect Circular Quay. The Sydney sightseeing tour bus also has a handy stop right out front of the apartment on Macleay Street where you can hop on or off. On foot, the city centre is a direct 15 min walk, or a leisurely 20 min walk along the harbour. For some lovely green space, you are a 5-10 min walk to Rushcutters Bay Park and the harbour, or the famous Botanical Gardens are  just a 15 min walk along the waterside area of Wolloomooloo. It is very easy to get to and from the airport via taxi (20-30 min), airport shuttle, or train.
access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment - a 1 bedroom apartment + study, featuring a double-sized bed, a compact bathroom with shower & large bath, separate fully equipped kitchen with stove, oven & fridge/freezer, study/office space, walk-in wardrobe , ample built-in storage, and a well designed, spacious living room with dining area, digital TV and wi-fi, as well as our amazing collection of books ranging from design, fashion and architecture coffee-table books to craft, cooking and travel guides. You will also be provided with clean linen and a set of towels. Wendy, our wonderful cleaner, will be happy to provide extra towels for longer stays.  *There is an extra single blow-up bed (with additional pillow/linen/bedding) for a 3rd guest.
interaction: You will enjoy the place entirely to yourself - and we won't bother you at all. If you do need help, we just live down the road and are contactable via email or phone. Early check-in and/or late check-out available by request, additional fees may apply.
house_rules: Please treat our apartment as you would your own home. No pets, no parties, and no smoking please.

host.host_about:
Hello from Luke and Paul in Sydney, Australia. 

We both work in the creative industries and love to travel whenever we can. Having also lived overseas (in Japan and Italy respectively), Luke and I have travelled through much of Europe, the US and Asia. Our favourite cities include New York, Paris, Rome (I know predictable)... and when it comes to Italy, we can never decide on just one favourite spot...

We love to fully experience a city/country, and immerse ourselves in the culture, eat the local food, and mingle with the locals for a genuine travel experience.

We have stayed at some great Airbnb places on our travels, and decided to take the plunge and do the hosting. Sydney is a great city and we would love to welcome you to all it has to offer. & we look forward to connecting with people the world over on our travels.

Talk soon,
Luke & Paul

reviews.comments: Fantastic, stylish apartment, in a top, easily accessible location. The photos say it all; everything was to a very high standard, super comfortable bed, we also used the deluxe air mattress (think I'll buy one myself). Paul was extremely accommodating, met us at the door and showed us around the apartment. Loved the guest guide with many suggestions that we followed, including shopping, walks, the best spot to get a coffee and amazing restaurants. Luke and Paul really know the best of Potts Point. They have certainly created a wonderful oasis for all to stay in. We'll certainly be staying there again.

What a delightful home - I was going to say 'property', but the thoughtful touches like a waiting bottle of red wine and fluffy white bath towels really did feel like luxury. The apartment is impeccable in every way, and the hosts extremely helpful and flexible. The location couldn't be better - set in a classic art deco building on an elegant shopping street in a friendly neighbourhood, just footsteps from transport and walking distance to all the sights. I highly recommend the apartment, and thank the hosts for a lovely stay.
This place is gorgeous and Paul was a terrific host. All you need for a short stay in Sydney!

Beautifully renovated one bedroom apartment in the gentrified Potts Point area in a classic old building. Close to fantastic cafes and food outlets and transport. Very convenient.  Will definitely be back!

Absolutely fabulous apartment, fabulous location and a fabulous place for the Sydney experience.  Beautifully appointed apartment.  Very comfortable and everything catered for. Looked after extremely well by Luke

This was our first time using Air BnB and we couldn't have wished for a better experience.   The apartment was all that was promised, small but beautifully appointed and there was plenty of room for the three of us.  The location was fabulous, we just walked out the door and hopped on a bus to the city or Chinatown.  The train was only a short stroll away.  We had no trouble getting around.  Not that you needed to go far.....there were plenty of delicious places to eat and wonderful farmer's markets directly opposite on Saturday morning.   The best treat was lying in the very comfortable bed, snuggled under the feather doona and just melting with the aromas of freshly baking bread wafting up from the French patisserie below....heaven.  Paul was a most gracious host...friendly, informative and everything was super organised.  We had a fabulous time and will most definitely stay again. Thanks, Paul!

the apartmet is really cute, and Paul very kind and taking care to any detail: he has left even a little present for we guests, unforgettable!
We strongly recommend this flat: 15 minutes by feet from The Opera House, a really good asutrain (Asutria, not Australia) restaurant for meat just in the square downstairs, the tube is at 5 minutes..
The flat is delicious!

Fabulous location. Kings Cross station just around the corner, so easy access to most places and the airport. One small default is that if you have a low tolerance of noise while sleep, nightlife of Kings Cross on weekends may be a little bit annoy. This is great apartment near to shopping grocery store and cafe, beside very clean this apartment had everything inside, very complete. We had 3 adults and the apartment fit us fine. Very personally decorated with great collection of books. Paul communicated very well and check in & out was smooth & easy.  They made a guide book with almost all information we needed to enjoy the local life, including iconic restaurants, local groceries. Would  recommend to a friend!
Great place to stay
Paul was very nice and helpful, providing us all the information we needed to know. We loved staying in the apartment, especially the location, and its interior. We would definitely stay there again!
Beautifully decorated and trendy designed house. The royal botanic garden located in walking distance. Everything is okay and convenient. Thanks Paul.

Paul was very welcoming and helpful.
Description was spot on. Its in right in the heart of Potts Point and Kings Cross. Very cute area, bit noisy on a Friday night but you can walk to the city, beach, through the beautiful streets of Potts point.
Paul was super friendly and the flat was great in an awesome location and he met us and made it easy to get in with a great packet for us with tons of info about the flat and neighborhood.
Lovely apartment. Very neat and clean. Good location
A tidy, professionally run airbnb. Perfect for 1 or 2 people. Fantastic location. Great restaurants and within striking distance of the city. Highly recommended.
Paul was very friendly and helpful.  The apartment was lovely, very neat and clean with the added bonus of being located conveniently to public transport and amenities.
Perfect location!Clean and beautiful (Website hidden by Airbnb) you for the great apartment!

We really enjoyed our stay in Sydney. Paul and Luke were great hosts - helpful, informative and responded to queries in a timely manner. The apartment in Potts Point was clean, tastefully furnished, and convenient located close to shops, cafes and public transport. Would love to stay here again. Thanks guys

The apartment was well located. The bed room needed alot more sound and light proofing from the road, an iron and board would be great, had a few cocroach visitors as well, the kitchen was well equipped for what we wanted. Maybe a small coffee table in living room. A small side table for the bed room corner to charge phones on would be nice. 
All in all a good apartment but really need to sort out some large heavy noise and light blocking curtains.
Thanks alot for the stay

Charming and large one bedroom apartment with cute separate study. It was thoughtfully prepared with visitor information. The apartment is very conveniently located with much choice for public transport. Our hosts were very welcoming, responsive and helpful. Things to consider prior to booking: the area where the apartment is located is mixed with trendy shops and cafes on the one hand but there are also a number of misfits in the area; the apartment doesn't have a lift but it's only two flights of stairs; apartment is on a busy street with single window glazing; no fan or air conditioning.

I booked the apartment for my parents whilst they were visiting us in Sydney. The flat is a great size for 2 people, and the small study with lots of storage and hanging space was a plus too. Kitchen is small (or about average if you live in a similar period block!) but has everything needed for cooking simple meals. Beautifully furnished and a great place to relax, plus amazing location. Only thing parents struggled with was traffic noise from the street, but some ear plugs and a weeks acclimatising to city life sorted that. Would highly recommend. Thanks Paul you were a great host!

Luke gave us a very warm welcome at the apartment, and went out of his way to accommodate an early arrival from the US.  The apartment was just as it appears in the photos: tastefully decorated and well-organized,  with beautiful tree-filled views out the front windows onto square below.   We loved the Potts Point neighborhood, and after spending five days there, we could imagine living there.  It's filled with great restaurants and cafes, is out of the way of the crowds of tourists but also has easy access to anything you'd like to see or do.

My partner and I spent two nights in Paul and Luke's lovely apartment. This place is a gorgeous little base for exploring Sydney! Paul and Luke have provided a wonderful guide for the Pott's Point area and we thoroughly enjoyed exploring their recommendations (mostly the food ones!). The bakery downstairs is a real winner! Really glad we chose to spend our long weekend here, it made for such a cosy retreat. Thanks guys!

Stylish apartment in trendy, convenient location with everything you need. There's a huge variety of dining and nightlife options on the doorstep. Great value for money. Paul and Luke were fantastic to deal with; extremely flexible and hospitable hosts!

We loved Paul's apartment! It's right in the middle of Potts Point and is about 5 minutes away from Kings Cross rail station. There's Woolie's a fee minutes away and coffee places all over! Room 10, which is right next door from the back served amazing coffee!

The apartment was very clean and has a lot of character. It certainly felt like we were staying at someone's home and not just a random hotel. We especially loved the book collection!

Overall, it was an awesome experience and we would definitely stay here again if we come back to Sydney.
We really enjoyed our stay in Paul's apartment. Very hospitable even though we didn't actually meet! Great location, perfect for a short stay in Sydney.

This is my second stay at this amazing apartment in Potts Point and I will most certainly be staying here every time that I am in Sydney.  Paul and Luke are excellent hosts and very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. The apartment is beautifully decorated and the book collection is 'to die for'. Is very clean and the linen is beautiful.  Perfect location for that get away in the heart of Sydney. I highly recommend that this is the best destination for your Sydney stay.

Thank you for the place. Everything was good - the location, the apartment, the greenery out of the windows, the neighborhood etc. It would be perfect if there is a coffee table and a hair dryer in the apartment though. But all is still good!!

Luke and Paul's flat listing caught my eye instantly, and we eagerly booked it as soon as we found that our desired dates were free. 
The flat looks exactly as it is pictured, and Paul was very responsive to our queries. 
While the neighborhood is quite close to the Kings Cross area (which we were told to be careful of), the Potts Point area where the flat is located is safe, and has a few good restaurants for a quick bite or a full meal. 
Paul had several restaurant recommendations which we tried, and we were not disappointed. 
While it is not entirely Paul's fault nor his liking, the apartment building does not have a lift, which made it hard for us to transfer our heavy luggage. However, the space of the flat itself is just right for three travelers, and we had a comfortable stay. I liked how the kitchen is well equipped as well. There extra towels and linens were a plus too. We stayed over the weekend and was able to catch the weekend market just across the street. We enjoyed that as well. We would definitely stay in Paul's flat again if given the chance.

Paul made me feel very welcome at his apartment and even arranged for an ironing board and iron.  The location is very central and has great access to really good food spots.  Easy walk to the Kings Cross Station.

Paul's place in Sydney was fantastic! Exactly like the pictures. Less than five min walk to king's cross train station. Just what we needed for a few days. The check in was a piece of cake and after traveling far that's always appreciated. We also (embarrassingly) locked our keys in the flat and Paul was very nice about it and accommodating about it.
It was very nice at Pauls appartment! So central with a lovely facility! We enjoyed our Weekend. Thanks! :-)

Paul's place is very nice, well situated near all the shops, restaurants, sites and bay on Macleay street. Easy to get to from the airport. Good bed and kitchen, nice cooking facilities. Thanks again Paul.
David
Such a lovely stay - perfect location with a delicious bakery right below the apartment ;) Very clean with chic decorations, we felt very welcomed and comfortable!
Paul's apartment is super cute and in a lovely neighborhood. Clean and quiet, had everything we needed. Check in was a breeze and we had a lovely time!

Paul's apartment was absolutely beautiful! The location was amazing. A 3 minute walk from the Kings Cross station and is near really great restaurants and establishments. A great location if you love to walk as well. A Weekend Market pops up on Saturdays & Sundays right outside the apartment. The place was very clean, orderly, and well decorated. Nothing bad to say about this apartment! Thanks Paul for the help and for returning the stuff I had left. Will stay here when I visit Sydney again for sure!
We had a fantastic time at luke and paul's. The apartment is very clean and well located, in a very vibrant area a short walk away from the rocks. It's stylish but cozy, it felt like being at home!

Paul and Luke were very responsive host's and the apartment is in a very handy location with so many great cafes and restaurants nearby.  The Kings Cross train station is only a few minutes walk away and its an easy walk to Hyde Park and the city.

The apartment is very stylish and comfortable. It is very conveniently located, close to King's Cross underground station and with many attractions accessible on foot. Paul was very helpful over arrangements with our arrival time.

Paul made us feel very welcome even though he was out-of-town.  Paul gave us great info regarding getting to his apartment and Wendy was very helpful as well.    Fantastic location and apartment was lovely and cosy and met our needs.
Everything was great at Paul and Luke's. We had a fantastic base to explore Sydney and enjoyed the cozy apartment. We'd return to the Pott's Point base in a heartbeat.
Apartment was very well appointed as described. Neighbourhood busy but not too noisy.

Amazing experience in Sydney, with so many things to do and enjoy. The apartment is located in a nice area to get to the center and to the airport and other parts. It's very cozy and beautiful. 

It was very sunny these days but there is a fan to solve it. It's a noisy street but you can close the windows. And don't worry about strange people walking around, they don't cause problems
Stylish flat in a central location - perfect for exploring the city centre and getting out to Bondi beach.

We stayed in Paul's place for six nights and had a wonderful time. The flat is compact, comfortable, and stylish. There is a bathroom with bath and shower as well as WC. there is a kitchen with a gas cooker, a dining table which can seat four, and a dressing room with good storage space. It is perfect for one or two. The location is in potts point, just three minutes walk from kings cross station. You can walk into the centre of sydney in 20 minutes. There are big supermarkets within ten minutes walk of the apartment.
Small apartment in a central, noisy location. Good for exploring the city. Good communication.
It was a great cosy place to leave at King Cross area. Train station was in walking distance. Area is close to plenty interesting cafes. Room is clean.

Great location to stay in Sydney. A few minutes walk to Kings Cross Station which is just 2 stops away from Bondi Junction and Town Hall. Lots of food options around the area. Paul was very prompt and polite to us.

Paul's place is furnished beautifully, clean and looks exactly like in the pictures. And although, we couldn't meet Paul in person, he was a pleasure to interact with over the phone. He was accommodative of our late check out and had a well curated brochure explaining the basics and more of the house and a bit of Sydney.
Located quite ideally to look around Sydney, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely come again.

The apartment could not have been better...stylishly decorated and perfectly located. Additionally, the hosts were always available to answer questions and did so quickly. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Sydney!

We had a wonderful stay! The apartment was exactly how it was shown and perfectly located in beautiful Potts Point. Our hosts we extremely friendly, professional and easy to communicate with. I would and will recommend them to everyone we talk to about our amazing trip! Thank you so much !!!
Really nice place, very clean. even left us some fresh coffee!!

Paul was extremely easy to get in touch with, flexible, and kind.

The apartment was just as described, and the neighborhood was incredible. Public transit in the area was easy for bus or train access as well. 

Overall, we had a perfect stay and would absolutely return to this spot!

The place was clean and stylish and conveniently located for us - although it is in the 'red light' district, it didn't bother us - and if you turn out left of the apartment you get to some really lovely shops, restaurants and bars. Walkable to the botanical gardens, Opera House and the CBD.
Paul's apartment is conveniently located. It is cosy and overlooks a small park. Paul is readily contactable and accommodating.

Lovely little spot in Potts Point. Right amongst all the best it has to offer, Paul was very accomodating with an early check in and catered for our little family just perfectly, would definitely stay here again when in Sydney. The convenience was second to none.
Great centrally locate apartment, with a super yummy patisserie at the bottom and loads at cafes and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Host Paul was very accommodating.
Lovely place to stay, beautiful clean flat, and a short walk to the botanical gardens and harbour

What a delight it was to stay in this very cute apartment. The location is an ideal place to launch daily adventures all over Sydney. Immaculately clean, comfortable, and convenient. Also, Wendy who cleans the place helped us with our bag drop and getting the keys. She is a total gem!
The apartment was exactly like it was shown on the picture. Very nice and clean. It was easy to find and is well located.
Lovely apartment easy to find and was exactly what you need for a couple of days getaway to Sydney! Hopefully get the chance to stay here again at some point. Thank you for hosting us!
Our family had a lovely stay at Paul's apartment, which was comfortable and in a great location.
We had the best stay in Potts Point. Such a cute apartment, had everything we needed and the BEST location. Easy communication, looking forward to staying again.
Hi! It has been an awesome stay in Paul's place. There was a lot of recommendations by them and we certainly felt at home with their hospitality

Stayed for 5 nights. If you bring a lot of luggage with you, don't bother to stay here, because there is no lift, only stairs and the unit is on the 2nd floor. I bring 4 luggage so its a bad experience from the start. 
The bed was ok, but the blanket was filthy, under the bed its even worse. There was a very thick dust, like its never been cleaned for months. And there was a dead cockroach in the wardrobe. 
When I was asked for new floor mat for bathroom on 3rd night because its wet, the cleaner told me to just use the new towel as the floor mat. Literally the worst experience ever and not going to try any airbnb in the future after this.
Great experience with Paul's apartment. Everything is nice, available, ready and fit for use. Very good location and easy to access. Highly recommend!

Paul is a great host which always attend to all our queries in a positive manner. He even reminded us when the check in time was near. 
The place is artistic and you can feel a designer touch in the house. The hot water run well and the kitchen is fully equipped.
The kings cross train station is just around the corner makes you travel easily around the city. Special appreciation to the shopkeeper inside the station that help us buying our first opal card.
Special thanks to the cleaner that enthusiastic welcome us and help with the trash bin.

Overall, this was a great space for our quick three night stay in Sydney.  The location was terrific for getting around the city either by train or on foot and the binder left by Paul gave some great suggestions of nearby places.  There were a few finer details missing that would have made the place feel more homey, but it was a terrific base to see Sydney from.  Thanks!!

Very beautiful, stylish and comfortable apartment. Everything you need is here and the location is very convenient. 
Host very responsive and helpful. 
If you like to sleep in a dark, quiet room, I advise you to have an eye mask and ear plugs. It is light outside and the blinds don't quite shut it all out.
Listing accurate. Location superb. Greeted by Wendy the cleaning lady who made us very welcome and went out of her way to allow us drop bags early.

Luke and paul's apartment is fantastically central, literally a stone's throw from a number of hip cafes and restaurants, and Kings Cross station. Very stylish. The corridors and staircases are charmingly old world...
Wicked location, great place to crash for a couple of nights to explore Sydney!

Paul es un excelente anfitrión. Se retrasó el vuelo y nos dejaron las llaves en un comercio abajo y un vino en la nevera. 
El apartamento está impecable y en una zona muy ambientada. Súper cómodo para visitar Sydney.
El único pero es el edificio, un poco viejo lleno de moqueta y sin ascensor. Toca subir la maleta a pulso. Por lo demás, perfecto!
Great little spot. Paul was super helpful with places to see and things to do. Very well located, cool apartment.

Great stay at Paul's - super convenient location right next to the excellent weekend market and plenty of good cafes and restaurants. Paul was a pleasure to deal with and made it easy to get in/out etc. Located close to the hectic Kings Cross but remarkably, once you turn the corner towards the park and the apartment, it becomes quieter and lovely!
The apartment is well-maintained, conveniently located near the Kings Cross station and has plenty of restaurants/shops nearby.

I had a great time staying at Paul's cozy apartment. The location is great, plenty of nice bars and restaurants to choose from and about a 15min walk to the ferries at circular quay. Apartment layout is efficient, space is compact. Lot of daylight on the street side; it is on a fairly busy street, but I slept really well. Enjoyed my stay and hope to come back soon.
Paul was very quick to get back to me even though he wasn't in the country. His apartment was perfectly clean and well presented.
Fantastic apartment in a great area. Close to good food & short distance from the city. Nice, clean apartment. Great communication. Really enjoyed our stay.

I didn't meet Paul as he was travelling at the ti me, but he was super helpful and responsive. I came in to Sydney off a 15 hour overnight flight, and Paul was generous enough to accommodate an early check-in so I could freshen up and drop my bags off before a day in the office. The place is perfectly located in the heart of the Cross, and well appointed inside.
Had a great stay in this clean and charming little place that is in the perfect location. A short walk to the city and Sydney Harbour ...surrounded by things to do and great places to eat/drink.

This is a clean, conveniently located apartment surrounded by an excellent selection of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants. It is just a few minutes walk from the train station (subway) and about a 20-minute walk from the CBD. The host, Paul, was very pro-active with email communications and very helpfully arranged for us to drop our bags off in the morning before the apartment had been cleaned, allowing us to spend the day in the city luggage-free.

Paul's flat is located in Potts Point where there are many nice cozy, fancy shops nearby. Also walking distance to Opera House, Botanical Garden so it was nice to walk around. 

However, it is also close to Kings Cross station and it could be little dangerous at night. I saw many drug addicts on the street and felt insecure. 

I am not expecting 5 star hotel when choosing Airbnb but I would expect more when I am still paying quite amount for the service. My biggest concern was the bathroom, not about the size but level of hygiene in it. I could see black mould from ceiling and wall, shower curtain was small and it kept sticking onto me when taking a shower and bathroom drain was rusty. I originally booked 6 nights but was provided 3 towels and no extra. It could be nice if extra towels can be provided for longer term stay. 

It would be also nice if the cleaner can clean the flat more thoroughly. I still saw the hairs here and there on the floor (of course) and on the couch, not to mention underneath the bed, couch..

Understand that there are bars, lounges nearby but the noises were quite disturbing as there were no proper soundproof. I was up until 2-3am for outside to be quiet enough so I could fully rest. 

Despite its great advantage of its location, I could not stand the bathroom and dusts in the house, I decided to move out on Sunday which basically I stayed for 2 nights only. This may be suitable for a single, couple, friends or family without child.

Fantastic location with super easy access to public transport (we travelled via Kings Cross station every day). Communal areas on interior of building in need of brightening but sort of adds to the charm as is. Apt is small but comfortably accommodated 2 adults and our daughter on a blow up mattress and had everything we needed. Stairs are a but of a hike with heavy suitcases but nothing we haven't encountered frequently in our travels o/s. Paul and Mary (house cleaner) were very responsive to any communication and kindly accommodated us when we needed to checkin early and to store luggage before departure flight. Night crowd outside a little loud at times but it didnt stop us sleeping. Colourful and cool area - would definitely stay again.  (Recommend Beer & Dumplings for take away, pastry shop below for delicious treats, and weekend market for great healthy interesting food)
The host canceled this reservation 143 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I have to say i am a little baffled at how positive the reviews are for the place we arrived at, and I completely agree with Binna's review below mine. I didn't see any 'drug addicts' around the apartment areas and the area has all the shops and takeaways you could need. We also felt safe in the area, and didn't run into any problems. However, On arrival, We were met by the cleaner who showed us to our apartment. The apartment itself is in a dilapidated building with marks, chips and wallpaper coming off which obviously isn't advertised. It seriously needs renovating as it's in a bad state. 

For £550 over a week, and the fact that the cleaner had asked us to come back in 30 minutes when she had finished cleaning (after check in time), the floor was still covered in dust which we found attached to the suitcases as we had to put them in the lounge area due to no room for them in the bedroom, and the couch is also pretty stained (also not in the pictures). I advise you to not look under the couch... as it needs a clean before anyone does... and finally the bathroom is covered in Mould (also not in the pictures). Bath also needs a good clean, as neither myself or my parter were interested in one. Could also do with sorting out the rusty drains in the bathroom too.

You will also need to bring earplugs as an essential item, it took us 3 nights to get an 'ok' sleep due to the noise, over the weekdays too as the walls are paper thin. We live on a busy main road at home, but I can't emphasis enough that the road outside the apartment is seriously loud, don't underestimate it as it does sound like you are outside. I had to buy -85 decibel silicon earplugs for my partner just so she could sleep.

The guide to the area was good and the amenities were too, except for the towels, as we were given 2 towels between the 2 of us for a week's stay. The shower was powerful enough and didn't run out of hot water which was great. 

I also contacted Paul and asked about the internet issue on arrival, as the wifi is particularly slow. I understand Australia doesn't have the greatest network, but 2mbps isn't usable, so bring a 4G data package with you for your mobile. 

I understand that I could of emailed Paul and complained about the bathroom, towels, noise, internet, cleanliness, etc.. But I have never had to do this before or do I really feel I should need to. Previous places I have stayed have been great with air bnb, but there is a difference when unsatisfied and paying £550 for a week for the above. Believe me, I am usually pretty chilled out with accommodations, but this one really needs a thorough clean and some sound proofing.

A stylish and comfortable apartment in an excellent location for our two-night stay in Sydney. Paul was super-responsive, provided excellent restaurant recommendations (we tried three of them) and had we had more time we might have even made it the end of Macleay St without getting distracted by another cute coffee shop. Bed was excellent, as was shower. Be warned that if you are a light sleeper this is in an older building in a lively neighbourhood - so it was pretty noisy out there on Saturday night. Thanks Paul and Luke (and Wendy who let us in as the hosts were travelling themselves).

Amazing place to stay if you are visiting Sydney, the location was amazing and easily accessible. The place was really clean and well taken care of. The host was really friendly and welcoming and attends to your needs

Stayed for 5 nights at Paul's, was very friendly from the beginning. Apartment is at a perfect location, close to the train station and a walking distance to Sydney's Botanic Gardens. Lots of shops and places to eat around aswell, a supermarket just a few minutes down the road was also comfortable. The apartment is at quite an old building but is kept up and clean. The climb to the second store with the luggage was a challenge but manageable. The place itself was perfect for us and had all the things we needed. Overall great value for money, perfect location and great communication.

This home in Potts Point was an amazing place to stay! It is especially close to the city and only a short walk to the Botanical Park! The apartment is very cute too and the main bedroom looks over the busy street of Darlinghurt and the public garden! 
It was additionally easy to get in contact with Paul and he always replied back to any questions I had super quickly! 
I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to experience Sydney and all its quirks!
Quite simply, a perfect place to stay for a Sydney weekend getaway. A wonderful little apartment in a great location, close to everything. Would certainly be first choice if staying in Sydney again.

Perfect location for a short stay in Sydney - this apartment is within walking distance to everything important and 3mins walk from the Kings Cross Train Station. This apartment has all the amenities that you would expect. As mentioned in other posts, there is traffic noise, but we felt it was all part of the experience of staying in this area.  Thanks Paul!

Kleine gemütliche Wohnung in Sydney. Restaurants, Supermärkte, Bus- und Bahnstation sind in 5 Minuten zu Fuß zu erreichen. Wir haben uns in der Unterkunft sowie in der Umgebung sehr wohl und trotz Nähe zum Rotlichtviertel auch sicher gefühlt. Leider sind die Häuser in Australien nicht gut gedämmt, deshalb ist es im Schlafzimmer durch den Straßenverkehr auch sehr laut. Vielen Dank an Wendy für den netten Empfang.
It's good to stay at Paul's place.

A perfect place to stay while in Sydney. It was a cozy and comfortable spot to rest and see the sights. The listing was accurate to what we found and they were the best to work with when it comes to arrival. I would highly recommend staying here.

We loved staying at Paul's place! He was very responsive and it is obvious that a lot of thought and care has been put into making the apartment feel airy and liveable. The location could not be more central and we had two excellent dinners at some of the many restaurants in easy walking distance. Thanks again, Paul.
Thanks for allowing us to drop our luggage early and begin our vacation. Bring earplugs if staying on the weekend as the bedroom window does nothing to muffle the street noise.

Paul's place in Potts Point was perfect for our two week stay in Sydney. Location wise it was spot on with the station just a couple of minutes away, buses on our doorstep and just walks away restaurants, coffee shops and more. Paul was an absolute pleasure to liaise with. He would respond so quickly, answering any questions we had. We can't thank him enough for letting us stay in his lovely apartment. 
If I had to choose one con, it would be the noise from the street below. We struggled with it one night out of our 12 so it wasn't too bad for us but if you're a lightsleeper, you may need earplugs.
Really great location and Paul was very helpful throughout our trip. As mentioned in other quite noisy out front so bring earplugs
Great apartment.  Great location.  I would highly recommend staying here.

Paul's place is super close to the train station and easily accessible to uber and taxi pick ups. Parking is a struggle so wouldn't recommend taking your car. It's a cozy place perfect for 2. Nice small kitchen to prepare meals. Dining table, lounge and study spaces available. Noisy street with trucks at times so may not be good for couples with children or light sleepers. Overall we rated this place very highly! Service was professional and so helpful. Thanks Paul for a great weekend
Paul's apartment was in a great location, short walk to train station and surrounded by many shops and cafes. Communication was great and the space was well equipped for our stay, thankyou!

We absolutely loved our stay at Paul's place. Great location opposite the park and weekend markets. Delicious pizza joint called Pizza Boccone around the corner. We found it within walking distance of most places, or ease of access to public transport. Very clean and well presented apartment. Building is older but has character. Thanks again Paul for being a great host and for the ease of communication and check-in process.

Luke and Paul's lovery apartment felt like a home away from home, making our stay warmly welcomed.  A comfortable bed to sleep on, a view of rush green, a smell of freshly baked goodies, a sound of vital city (Website hidden by Airbnb) was all so perfect:). We would love to return again!

Paul's place is right in the heart of the action in Potts Point, just down the road from King's Cross. It's a great central location for exploring inner Sydney. Communication was great and checkin was easy. While it's technically one bedroom, our four year old was very happy on a mattress in the study nook which has its own door and effectively becomes a small second bedroom.
Paul was an amazing host! He was so easy to communicate with and super accommodating, one of the best hosts I've ever come across. The place is super cute and in a perfect location

Paul was fantastic to deal with and got back to us really quickly with our queries. The apart. is in such a central location- walking distance to beautiful Rushcutters Bay and only 10 min (dependant on traffic) to Circular Quay ferry terminal. And fabulous eateries literally on your doorstep.

Appartement très bien situé et bien agencé. Accueil attentionné. Chambre sur rue bruyante 
Globalement très bon séjour
Nice place to be in Sidney
Great and convenient place to stay! Highly recommend the location :)

The place was perfect for what we needed! Close to spots to go out, we walked to the botanic gardens and the opera house, and an overall lovely stay. Communication ahead of time was timely and check is was a breeze. Thanks again!
Muy buen alojamiento, cumple con todo lo que se necesita para una buena estadía en Sydney e inmejorable ubicación.

Nice and clean apartment, tastefully furnished in a very lively and interesting neighbourhood, and easy to reach with public transportation. Paul was an excellent and helpful host - very quick with communication when we needed it. Due to a delayed flight we had to check-in 15 hours later than planned, and Paul still made it possible, that was a real life saver - thank you, Paul! The bedroom window is not too far away from the street, so guests should not be too sensitive about acoustics from traffic driving by - but no problem with the crowd from Kings Cross which keeps a block away around the corner.
Great, stylish appartment in Kings Cross. Paul was really great with communication and his cleaner Wendy was very attentive. Definitely recommend but probably best for couples
Un departamento hermoso, tiene todo para pasar unas buenas vacaciones. La ubicación es muy buena ya que está a metros del metro. Súper recomendable, pasamos unos días soñados en sydney .

Great. Beautiful apartment at a second floor (no elevator) in a excellent location, near a train station and in a zone full of places to go.
Paul was great responding very quickly our questions. 
No complains, we would stay there again.
Paul's place was great and very clean. Their help was highly appreciated. We would recommend their place to anyone visiting the area!
Wonderfully done, great place to stay and waking up to the smell of fresh pastries from the French Patisserie.
Very nice apartment, close to everything. Would stay here again
Paul's place is well designed, cosy and in an excellent location.  We would stay here again
perfect and awesome place

Luke and Paul's place was perfect for my mum who was visiting from Queensland. It's location is amazing, right in the heart for foodie heaven Potts Point with easy access to transport (at the front door) and all the goodies that this inner city suburb has to offer. The apartment was clean, cosy and well stocked. We'd highly recommend this awesome place for anyone visiting Sydney.

A cozy place in an old building located in a transitioning neighbourhood. Lots of new hip food and drink venues. Excellent communication and flexibility of hosts. A nice touch point to roam the city from.

We loved the Potts Point neighborhood and this apartment. Perfect for the two of us, and my niece stayed with us one night so the air mattress and extra bedding was perfect for her. Hot water shower. Foodie area, with visits to the bakery, coffee shop a few doors down, and Saturday farmers market right across the street. Buses and cabs are right in front, convenience store across the street. Hosts were out of town but extremely responsive, and Wendy who cares for the apartment was fantastic - friendly, prompt, and flexible. We would visit again and recommend!
Great little apartment. Super convenient.

Impressive apartment that is very conveniently located. Royal gardens, Opera house and CBD might be easily reached on foot (30 minutes to Opera House) and by public transport (Kings Cross train station is  very close to the apt). The hosts are friendly and accomodating, they arranged a very convenient arrival for us, though it was quite early in the morning. Another thing to mention is that we were charmed by the musician living in one of the nearby apartments, whose playing added to the awesome atmosphere of the place. Still, if you are a light sleeper, you need to consider the fact that you can hear things through the walls. 
P.S. The croissants in the patisserie near the entrance to the house are delicious!
It was all good, very easy access. Thank you!
Great location. Great market across the street on the weekends  with lots of great food and drinks. Would highly recommend

A great place to experience Potts Point. The flat was. comfortable and stylish. A great restaurant to one side of the front and a patisserie to the other. The bedroom looks out into the tree canopy. Noise no great problem.

We loved staying here! Perfect location + the flat was a great for a girls weekend away. The host Paul was very good with communication and there was lots of information about what to do in Sydney which was super helpful. The cleaner/host Wendy who checked us in was lovely & both her and Paul were wonderful about a later check in time due to a late flight. The flat itself is great. Thank you!
Great location. But the cleansiness was absolutely not up to par.

We had a great stay in Paul's place. It's in a very convenient location for exploring the city and surroundings. The road directly outside the building is quite busy. If you are a light sleeper this might not be the best option for you, but we were mostly undisturbed. 
Paul was easy to communicate with and was flexible about check in, which I appreciated. I would recommend Paul's place to others who want a convenient base for exploring Sydney.
Excellent location
Awesome place and easy access to everywhere
The apart so clean, and no charge if you add person. Because we carry big luggage, we have a trouble to make that luggage to the apart, but we love the apart. Thanks paul and wendy for your support,

Great place, ideal location for exploring Sydney. Excellent saturday market and local coffee shop. Plenty of choice for restaurants and cafes. We were lucky enough to be in Sydney for Vivid festival which was amazing. The building corridors etc could do with a spruce up and the apartment wasn't as clean as it could be but nothing major. One slight gripe was we were hoping that the spare bed would be a single blow up not a double as it would have fitted in the little dressing room and given that guest a bit of privacy and we did have to move some furniture to place the air bed in an area where we wouldn't trip over it when getting up in the night. Overall really pleased with our choice, thank you Paul. Communication and check in was very smooth

The previous reviews this location are mostly accurate but we did want to point out a few details. Pros: The location of the apartment is excellent. Easy access to the train, taxis, as well as the ability to walk to just about anywhere in town. We had a lovely stroll from the apartment to the Sydney Bridge, Darling Harbour, and Circular Quay. There are many local restaurants and pubs to visit, we did not go hungry! The house manual has many wonderful suggestions. Cons: We recognize that these may be exclusive to our experience only. While communication with Paul and Luke was great, we did have some hiccups. As international travelers, we had been using WiFi wherever available so as to not incur any additional charges. We set up a time for Wendy (the housekeeper), to meet us to drop off the key. We waited 20 minutes until having to turn on our phones to try to sort out where Wendy was. After texting Wendy 3 times, she responded that she had left he key with a local business owner. It was frustrating that the plan had changed, that we weren’t notified immediately, and that we had to find this out after having to incur international phone charges. The apartment itself is as advertised. Cozy, lovely style, mostly well maintained. The double bed is a bit lumpy for our taste. The washroom/toilet is a bit dated, and could use a deep clean. The tub is rounded at the bottom so you could never stand with flat feet, it was quite slippery. While the tub is large, note that the shower is rather small and the shower head does not move. You are restricted to a small, rather tight area, as the shower curtain only encloses a small circular space around the shower head. Neither of us could close the curtain fully around us. The water pressure and hot water is outstanding. As pointed out, the street in which the apartment is located is quite noisy with bright street lights gleaming in that the blinds don’t fully block out, so lite sleepers beware, but that is a part of the city experience. Also note that the building is older. The entrance way is dark and has a musty smell. There were plenty of stairs to walk up, so if you have heavy luggage, beware. Online, the check-out time states 10am, though the manual at the apartment states 11am. Having thought the checkout time was at 11am, we were finishing packing and showering when Wendy, knocked at a bit past 10am. She was extremely abrupt, to the point of being rude. She insisted that the check out time was 10am, and suggested twice that we should have ‘checked our email’. She also brought a tradesman with her and was wanting to come in with him to start cleaning. I told her that my husband was in the shower and I did not feel comfortable having her and another person inside the apartment...
한국 게스트들에게 꼭 도움이 되었으면 합니다! 우선 인테리어 부분은 사진과 동일하였으나 곳곳에 거미줄, 다른사람의 머리카락 등 청결부분에 문제가 있었습니다 ㅜ 라면을 먹고싶어서 주전자를 사용하려 했는데 물때가 심각하여 결국 포기했고 창문을 닫고 자려고 손잡이를 잡았더니 부러지더라구요; 전 다시 시드니 간다면 절대 이용 안할겁니다

Great location in a very old building. The apartment has been renovated but has some problems... The building itself is very old and not nice. And the shower is a bit disappointing... Overall a good stay.

This little apartment is lovey inside, though the building it's in is a little creepy. Everything went smoothly, although this apartment is right on a busy street with many loud cars and people passing by at night. Other than that though, this is in a prime spot. Literally right in front of a BigBug tour stop if that's your thing.

The area is more suitable for a group of friends and light travelers as you will have to climb two flight of stairs to the second floor.  The area is quite unique where you have a nice weekend market just opposite at the Fitzroy garden, supermarkets within walkable distance and a fantastic Japanese restaurant just downstairs the accommodation. The noise wasn't that bad but the bed is not for someone who is looking for good quality sleep. Wendy responses quick to my enquiries :)

Paul was an excellent host who communicated well with us. Unfortunately he is not based in Australia and his local contact Wendy, the cleaner, was unhelpful and caused us to lose the first day of our holiday. The lock on the front door broke on the first afternoon and she originally said she couldn't get someone until after 6pm the following day. Thus we had to babysit the flat all afternoon and evening as we couldn't lock the door. We eventually got in contact with Paul who agreed to call an emergency locksmith.
