The locksmith didn't arrive until around 7.30pm, and it took until almost 8pm to fix the problem which Wendy was alerted to before 1.30pm. 

Additionally, Wendy agreed to watch the flat for us when the problem first occurred so we could get lunch. We picked up takeaway so as to return quickly but found her walking down the street two blocks away on our way back. The flat had been left unattended, unlocked, and with the door slightly ajar. This was completely unacceptable after having promised to stay and watch our belongings and Paul's flat. 

Overall, the apartment was decent. It is in an excellent location with just a 30 minute walk to the Opera House through the beautiful botanic gardens, and lots of cool cafes and restaurants on the street and nearby. The apartment has the potential to be great however it is not currently being maintained adequately, with some broken window locks, burnt out lights, and mould in the shower. Having had a bad experience with Wendy we did not contact her again during our stay and instead put up with these issues. Again, Paul was very helpful and did everything he could to help us. We did love staying in the area and would do so again, and hope that Paul is able to get a better cleaner/local contact in the future.
Handy location for travelling the city. Paul was efficient with communication and always willing to help solve the problem! Good stay!
The place is lovely and really closed to the public transport through which you can go to most of the attractions.

Paul's apartment is really a cozy nice place and located at an ideal area where is just 5 mins walking from Kings Cross station. I stayed 2 nights with my parents, the house keeper Wendy is nice and easy to communicate. For deep sleepers, it's not noisy at all. The only thing is I saw a cockroach in the smaller room and killed it. Overall is quite nice!
Great property and a great host

Very Nice location and apartment. Great base location to visit sydney from, but plenty of amazing food and other things to visit nearby.

Pauls knowledge of the area shows through the area guidebook that was amazing for introducing us to the good food and other sights of the area
The place was perfect! It is centrally located and a short walk to the park to the opera house and the bridge.
Excellent location!! I will definitely come back!
Thanks for a great stay. We had a really great time and it was so convenient for walking around Sydney or getting the metro about.  Loved the appt - we cooked a few times which was great.
Nice apartment, good location close to kings cross tube station. Good wifi. Excellent Japanese restaurant just down stairs. Flexible with check in time and good communication. Thanks Paul!
很棒的公寓,去哪里都很方便｡房东很热心｡

Location is good. Very close to King Cross station. Host very responsive. A lot of restaurants nearby. Bedroom is facing the road though and might be a little too noisy at night. Not for light sleepers. But overall a very good and comfortable stay.

Great location - 3 mins walk to King Cross station and $10-15 uber to anywhere in the city. 
Lots of fast food options - Mcdonalds, Oporto, Coffee Places, Great Croissant shop just below, Halal options etc
Kitchen has all the necessary cutlery and appliances 
Apartment is clean and cozy
Communication was fast and easy.

Paul's place is as good as how he described it. The unit is in a very good location. We were able to walk around the neighbourhood as well as commute to other parts of Sydney by bus or train with ease. It was an added bonus that when we requested Paul if we could have another heater (there were 3 of us) since one was not enough for both the bedroom and living room, he readily provided. Though we were out most of the time, we appreciated the fact that Paul's unit is a very beautiful and well-appointed one. It was nice going back to the unit after a long day of going out and seeing the sights. We highly recommend this place to anyone travelling to Sydney. Lastly, although Paul was away on a trip, he was very accommodating in terms of communicating with us during our stay and it certainly made it easier for us to get settled in and get the most of our stay in Sydney.
Had a great stay in Paul's apartment. It was perfect for our stay and in a great location. Excellent value, will recommend to anyone coming to Sydney
Was a lovely place, cosy and very comfortable.  There are lots of stairs  but it's good exercise  overall would stay again
Fantastic apartment, perfectly positioned. Loved kings cross and the great market on the weekend across the road.

Very cute, but small place.  Paul was very quick to respond when i had a question.  Keep in mind that you must climb 2 sets of stairs to get to the apartment and the shower was very tiny.  It was still comfortable and i loved the bakery downstairs.

Paul's place overall was great. It was located in a great place with enough privacy. It was just enough room for the 3 of us. The only thing I can say we weren't the happiest about was that we were using the blow up mattress and there were two fitted sheets (single) that didn't fit the queen single.

Great location of this art deco apt building close to transit trains and buses patisserie market on Saturday right across the street But there was an odour and dirty in the foyer and stairwell of the common areas of the building While we were there the apt had 3 cockroaches and there was a sign to say the exterminators were scheduled for the building The apt towels and linens were great And the apt was clean and tidy except for dust in the corners A small fridge but very functional Thanks Luke and Paul we enjoyed many evenings at your well situated apt

Communication with Paul was great. He was very flexible with check-in/out. We arrived late in the night and was checked in by Wendy. Communication with Wendy was great too. She is responsive and friendly. Location of the apartment is fantastic - 5 minutes walk to King Cross station, 30 minutes walk to the Royal Botanic Gardens and lots of food option around the apartment. The only issue we had was the cleanliness of the apartment.
A really good spot, close to Potts Point nightlife with excellent transport links to the rest of Sydney. Well furnished with a nice kitchen too.

Great location with plenty of cafes and public transport within walking distance. Apartment was clean and had everything we needed for a 2 night stay. Paul was a pleasure to deal with and checkin was very simple. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Easy checkin, and great communication from Paul.   Cute apartment in a great location.  Only letdown was the place needed a solid clean.
Nicely styled apartment in a central location for our activities. Enjoyed the leafy views from the bedroom window and weekend markets over the road. Excellent communication. Thanks for having us!

My friends and I had a lovely mid-week trip up to Sydney in Paul's apartment. It was so conveniently located to the rest of Sydney and easy to get to from the train station. The apartment had so much charm and everything you needed. The communication was excellent and I had a wonderful time. I will definitely be staying here again when I return, would definitely recommend!
Wir waren für 3 Nächte in Pauls Apartment und sie war perfekt für uns, um die Stadt zu erkunden.
Really nice stay, the apartment is close to everything that you'll need and Paul is more than willing to help.

We’ve enjoyed our stay at Paul’s place. Wendy has been great too and we had no problem checking into the apartment. 

The location is good and within short walking distance to Kings Cross station, and there are plenty of nearby eateries as well. Highly recommended.

We stayed at Paul’s place for 3 nights. The location is great, a 20-minute walk from the opera, surrounded by shops and restaurants. The flat was clean and very pleasant to stay in. I would totally highly recommend it for a stay in Sydney !

Paul’s space was cute, and the location could not have been more perfect. I was able to take the train(very safe and clean) to and from the airport and towards Bondi Junction. The walk to the harbor takes 20-30 minutes through the Botanical Gardens and was one of my favorite parts of the stay. Potts Point also has some lovely restaurants that I wish I was able to explore. Paul is so responsive and has some great advice for visitors to the area. Just one little watch out—don’t pack too much since there are two flights of stairs to climb.
apartment styling enpointe for the building era and area very welcoming and relaxing feel whilst in the centre of the city thank you
Great stay!

We loved staying here for the weekend! Something to note, the apartment doesn’t have AC and there is only one fan so it can get quite hot in the rooms. 
The location was just close enough to easily get to and from all the Sydney hotspots!

Fantastic location, efficient communication, lovely leafy outlook over Fitzroy square, many eating, supermarket options nearby and public transport availability was very good. Good ventilation cross flow negated the need for the provided fan, bed comfortable and high quality linen and towels. Basic necessities all provided, great wi-fi, hot water good and amazing collection of books. A really enjoyable Air BnB experience.

Nice little apartment very easy to get about. It felt a lot more like New York than Sydney.
The Saturday market has fantastic food, it’s only across the road. 
Only downfall is it’s a touch loud. I’d bring earplugs (but I am from the country and are used to silence)
Perfect comms amazing location. We'll be back for sure on are next trip over... What's more to say..!!
Great location, nice and cozy flat. Perfect for 2 people, not really for 3.
The apartment is in an unbeatable location - close to the action and public transport. Communication with Paul was prompt and easy.

Paul’s place in Potts Point is an excellent location. The restaurants around the area are excellent and it has perfect proximity to the Kings Cross Station. The only issue would be the road noise on the street. I would recommend the flat for a couple only as it is a bit small for more than two.
Great place to stay in Sydney at Kings Cross

We loved our stay in Paul's apartment and found it a great base to explore the galleries of Sydney. The apartment is just as described and the neighbourhood is perfect if u enjoy great food and interesting people. We would definitely book in again!
It was very clean nice location and easy to find would recommend this place to anyone thank you

El apartamente de Paul es muy bonito y bien situado para conocer la ciudad.
Quizás en mas fotografías se ve más cuidad y parece mucho más grande y luminoso. Estaba un poco descuidado, sobre todo a nivel limpieza profunda y comparándolo con las fotografías mostradas.
El trato de Paul perfecto! Amable, atento y servicial.
Great little home nice, neat and cozy. Wendy the cleaner was an absolute gem! Thank you for letting us call your home ours for the 5days Paul! Cheers

This is a lovely space! Stylish, not too big or too small. We would even have had room for a 3rd visitor, if our plans had not changed. We could hear the fountain across the street flowing all night, which acted as white noise to help us sleep. The location is perfect, a short walk to the train station. If you're in the mood for a slightly longer walk, you could walk all the way to the Australian Museum, which is what my boyfriend & I did after a lovely breakfast at Marcelle (just next door). :)

Central location right next to King’s Cross. Apartment has all the basics. Building was a bit more run down than expected which didn’t give the best first impression but the apartment itself is in better shape. Definitely quite noisy at night which was mentioned in the post so I would recommend bringing earplugs to sleep. Overall a good apartment considering the price.

Great location for access to all sorts of transport, eateries, coffee spots, etc. Though Macleay Street is busy, we found it was only a daytime phenomenon. Nice sleeping sat night in a comfy bed. Very pleased with our choice.
great location. not family friendly. weird damp smell in the building. quite a number of flights of stairs. very small also
The apartment is very close to the city, very convenient place, which also means quite noisy. Besides that, everything is fine.

Good communication from Paul before and during the visit. Apartment is cozy, comfortable and accurate to photos. Excellent neighborhood. Plenty to do and see nearby, and easy access to elsewhere in Sydney via nearby public transit or even a solid walk. Although, light sleepers should be aware that the bedroom faces a fairly busy street.

This is a great spot to stay, super centrally located with easy access to all you could need on holidays. Host Paul is great at communicating and keeping in touch, and we would definitely stay here again.

Great location and so close to train station. Paul left a folder full of useful and helpful information. We love the cafe and patisserie downstairs. Everything was so conveniently located and my toddler enjoyed her stay there!

Great place in a very handy spot. 
Paul made things very easy in terms of checking in etc. 
I’d recommend this place to a friend.
The apartment was nice however the main building is in need of some serious maintenance.

Great location, near to Rail station and with plenty of shops and cafes.    The shared area in the block is very dilapidated, but Paul’s apartment is stylish and well appointed.   Arrangements for arrival were perfect.   Yes, the road is a little noisy, but it didn’t stop me sleeping.   The flat had everything I needed for a week in Sydney.  Thank you.

We had an amazing stay at Paul’s place in Potts Point. The apartment was centrally located, and overlooked a beautiful pot with a fountain. The best part about this place is we were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go, and Kings Cross station was so very close for our farther exploration trips.  Paul’s place had everything we needed for our stay, and more, including a small desk work space! Everything was just as pictured. The full kitchen had everything we could ask for, and we were able to save a few dollars by cooking in - although the nearby amazing restaurants and cafes definitely drew us in!!! As some others mentioned, the street is a bit noisy, but it honestly did not affect our sleep at all! We were comfortable and thankful for such a beautiful recharging spot before our days exploring Sydney. Thank you, Paul!
Perfect location and nice character to the building.  We stayed for 2 days in Sydney and the apartment was a great base to go out and explore Potts point and the rest of the city
Comfortable apartment with a good location :)
Clean trendy apartment, great location with amazing local tips on local eateries and attractions. Hosts are very quick to respond and more than accommodating.

Incredible location, cute little unit. Perfect for our needs for the evening and a close walk to the best restaurants. Waking up to see the markets across the road was a highlight. Be warned though, the mattress is a double only so if there are two you’ll be close!

We had a lovely stay. Apartment is modern and tastefully decorated, and in a secure locked building. The hosts supplied plenty of bedding, linen and kitchen supplies, even a little inflated bed for our child. The location is very convenient, a short stroll to the water, close to the train station, with many high quality cafes and restaurants and supermarkets close by- we even walked into Sydney one sunny day. I see others have commented on the street noise, we only found this noticeable on weekend nights but it was not such an issue. The hosts provided a booklet on the local area. Thank again such a great stay!

I would highly reccomended this place. Prime location, cute cosy apartment, nice and clean and very affordable . The hosts are soo helpful and get back to you very promptly.  The cleaning lady is lovley and does a excellent job. Sheil make you feel very welcome. I would highly reccomended this place to stay whilst your time in Sydney. Close to everything.  I would stay here again 100%
There are pros and cons but everything about the apartment is written clearly so it's up to you to decide, no regrets about it.
Fabulous host, great loacation, smaller and much older than appears in photos but otherwise fantastic!

Location is phenomenal, tons of cute restaurants, things to do and close to the train station! Paul and Susan were very nice and accommodating, we got in late (10pm) and they accommodated a late checkout request as well. The building is a bit old and shabby, but the unit itself is done well. Lots of dust (if you're allergic like me), hair on the floors/rug and the shower is a bit small.  Great for a quick stay when your primary concern is location!
The host canceled this reservation 13 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Really loved the place, warm and cosy and close to king cross station. Great place for a few days in Sydney! Value for money in the CBD area.:)

Apartment was as described, good location within easy walking distance to kings cross station. Also, heard about how the Kings cross area is supposedly a red light district, but the whole area really wasn’t as shady as how people generally made it out to be online. And while the building may seem a little dodgy when you first enter, the apartment itself was stylishly decorated and comfortable. Great value and stay for me!

This cozy apartment is conveniently located near the train (Kings Cross Station) and the weekend market in the park. 
WiFi is strong and lots of hangers! Nice to have travel books and maps available also. 
Excellent and a good price.

Amazing find on airbnb! Close to public transport, food, woolworths, a few bars! Perfect size for two people and the apartment was very neat with a stylish touch! I loved every bit about staying in this apartment!! Thankyou :)
Very cute apartment that’s extremely close to an array of shops and transit. A great place to stay while visiting Sydney!
Great place to stay and Paul is amazing to communicate with.
A fab little apartment in the heart of everything - definitely can’t fault the location!

Location is incredible and the apartment is cosy but well laid out. Bed is super comfortable and on a Saturday you can cross the road for the markets and listen to some live music with a coffee. Nothing I wouldn't recommend about this place!
Fantastic place to stay, great location and very close to Kings Cross station.

Essentially its Kings Cross, a suburb that bears no resemblance to the one of my youth. 
Paul & Lukes apartment is centrally located in a inner suburb that is blessed by trees, exceptional Thai Takeaway and great restaurants. Walking is a breeze. Close to the city. Probably not a great place for light sleepers, with Macleay Street never sleeps. A great classic 1930’s period apartment in character filled neighbourhood
Cozy apartment in a great location - thanks Paul for hosting me
Great apartment! Paul is a great host, super easy to communicate with and easy going. Would recommend for anyone looking for a great stay in the heart of Sydney

Beautiful little apartment, well kept and exactly what you need without being too much! Location is prime, Paul and Luke have gone out of their way to ensure travellers are equipped with all the information they might need to experience Sydney.

Great location, central to many great places, restaurants and suburbs. Cozy and comfy apartment. Clean and many amenities provided. Great service from Paul and the cleaner, very kind and polite. Can get a bit loud at night from the street and the lobby has a funny smell but those things kind of grow on you. Paul’s apartment is a nice little place to come back to after a night out!

The location is awesome, very close to the subway station.There is also a convenient store across the street, a super market a block away, where you can buy some groceries ! Even more, the ice-cream shop and the pie shop beside the apartment serve excellent food!The last but not least thanks for the warm welcome from Susan!

Thank you for reply quickly.
l enjoyed art and fashion book:)

Very nice place.

Our stay at Paul’s place was really great. The location is great to spend time in Darlinghurst or near Circular Quay, and still amazing if you don’t mind a bit of a walk to Darling Harbour and Barangaroo. His book of local recommendations was a life saver, and he was great with communication overall. The place is basic but stylish and contains everything you need.

The location is just perfect, very close to the old town, Sydney opera and botanic garden. Paul left in the flat some traveler books that are really useful :) 
The flat is all conform to the pictures. Arrival and departure very easy as no timetable.

Paul's apartment was totally fabulous.  From the tasteful deco decorating to the fantastic location. It was our cosy home for 4 nights and we loved it - we will be booking with you again no doubt about that ! Thank you
Centrally located and within walking distance of all the major attractions. Transport is close at hand if you wish to venture further afield.
Stylish decor and good location but have to expect noise from streets during sleep especially weekend

We really enjoyed our stay at Paul’s apartment! The space is very clean with a comfortable bed - exactly what we needed after long days of sightseeing in Sydney. It was very easy to access public transportation from Paul’s place, but if you’re up for a walk, it’s not far from downtown. Potts Point is a fun neighborhood and we’re glad we stayed here. We highly recommend Paul’s place if you’re traveling through Sydney!

Nice location, nice property, supermarket, local market, transport, restaurants, you name it. Very very nice and cozy stay, awesome detailing of the place, warm and welcoming. Hope to come back sometime soon!
Fantastic value for the money. A stylish spot in a nice area, close to many restaurants and cafes. A good spot for a solo Traveller.

What can I say.. This was our home for 2 weeks! The apartment is tastefully decorated, clean, spacious and had all the amenities we needed. It is the perfect space for two people. The location is ideal,  in the hustle and bustle of Potts Point. Despite being a busy area we managed to slept through every night without any disruption (maybe we are deep sleepers). Everything we needed was in walking distance, including Kings Cross station which has fantastic links to all the key attractions Sydney has to offer.  

To anyone looking at staying in Sydney, we highly recommend Paul's apartment!
This place was amazing! Such a central location, able to walk everywhere that was around the city. Paul was super nice and easy to message, also the little booklets in the apartment were helpful too!
Great little place! Good spot to explore Sydney from. Paul’s communication was great, and he was very helpful. Would recommend!
Easy to go anywhere in Sydney. Lots of resturants near.

A very cozy place at a convenient location. Host is very responsive and considerate. We were allowed to check in early and there are helpful tips and travel books in the apartment for guests that are here for sightseeing.

The only thing we struggled a bit was the noise from the main road which could be challenging for light sleepers like myself.

Overall we had a good stay and would like to thank Paul for hosting us.
Simple apartment with everything you need.
Great location, nicely decorated. Very responsive host. Thank you Paul!
Paul's place was absolutely fantastic! perfect for a few days exploring the city and so easy to get everywhere from. Was met by Susan their cleaner who was absolutely fantastic and so helpful!
Great location,  lovely place

The location is absolutely incredible! We were able to walk to a number of coffee shops and eateries right below the apartment and hop on the train just two minutes away to get anywhere else! The apartment was exactly what we were hoping for as far as location! The apartment is old and it's in the (Website hidden by Airbnb) it's a bit dirty and loud at night! All in all, it was exactly what we were looking for, just didn't expect to be woken up so often throughout the night! :)

Really awesome location in the city and super convenient to get everywhere from (it’s minutes walk from Kings Cross Station). There was some noise from construction but as we were out all day it didn’t bother us. Would definitely recommend!
Neat spot with cute aesthetics.

This apartment is perfectly located. We had such a great time and Paul is a wonderful host. We got quite attached to our little home away from home for the week we were there. Would definitely recommend and would definitely stay again.
Great location and weekend market in. park across the road is great on Saturdays
Always stay here when I am in Sydney. Fabulous location, very stylish apartment, fantastic host and everything you need for a very comfortable stay.

This little apartment is really well situated. There are great coffee shops and restaurants within walking distance. It is also close to transport and the French café around the corner has some amazing pastries. 

You will need to bring ear plugs and a sleeping mask, as sometimes the light from the outside street light it quite bright. 

It is a really well laid out apartment with enough room for everything you need. 

We will be back.
Booked this apartment for friends  visiting from Paris.  Perfect location, clean apartment and great communication.  Highly recommended.
Fantastic location. Great access to trains, supermarket and gorgeous cafes.

This is such a great place and ideally located in the ‘nicer’ part of the neighbourhood. 

I found it incredibly peaceful even with the hustle and bustle of the area and noise outside. This is helped by the bedroom view of the trees of the square opposite together with the sound of the water fountain. 

The place is easily accessible to lots of places and all the shops and restaurants nearby are classy and funky. 

I stayed in this area last time and this place is in a better location. 

The flat is cutely designed and a great size for a City break. I didn’t want to leave so soon! 

Great hosts. Friendly and helpful cleaner!

An extremely well located place. Has all that you need. 

It would be helped by having AC so front window could be closed to minimise night noise from bedroom. 
We did get used to it but disrupted sleep was still normal.

I have to say it was tough to be in the apartment with only a small fan during this heat, but perhaps the apartment would be quite comfortable for guests during other seasons. Some areas of the apartment don’t match the current photos anymore, such as the bathroom and the living room. Unfortunately, we also had to deal with several cockroaches (live and dead) in the apartment during our one week stay here. That being said, I thank the host(s) for being accommodating with our late check in request for the first night. Also, the location of the apartment is great, with close walking distance to king’s cross station which can conveniently get you anywhere. Cute brunch spots on the next street. Thanks.
L'appartement est bien situé, dans une rue commerçante et proche du métro, à seulement 2 stations du centre. Il est propre et bien équipé.

Paul’s place is fantastic. The apartment is stylish and spacious, it has everything you need and the location is perfect. I always got a very fast reply if I had any questions and the check in and out times were flexible. The place was surprisingly cool without aircon even during the hot days. I really don’t have anything bad to say, we had a wonderful stay and would recommend it to everyone!

The apartment is located in a great area that’s quite during the night but very convenient for us to explore Sydney. However, as we were three people we used the air mattress but it got flat quite easily and wasn’t so comfortable. Would highly recommend this apartment for two or single travelers!

The absolute best location in Potts Point. Super convenient. 
Cute art deco building.

If you’re visiting Sydney, Paul’s place is a wonderful place to still be a tourist and play a local at the same time. It’s situated in a great location - availability to food options, walking distance to the train which was so great and neighborhood feels so safe. 


It’s comfortable for two, maybe three if your other guest is not picky with the sleeping arrangements and Paul covers everything that you’d need. If not, their cleaner Susan is available to help you should you need. Everything that Paul notes in his description is extremely accurate so we appreciated that. 

We definitely enjoyed our stay and trust you will too!

We spent 10 days in this lovely space while at at Mardi Gras and could not have been happier.  Very short walk to hop on train, amazing neighborhood with great cafes, Saturday market in the park across the street on weekends.  12 minute walk to Oxford Street.  Loved it!

name: Spacious,Private, jungle retreat...close to lava.
summary: This spot is breezy, peaceful, colorful and full of birds chirping. perfect for someone wanting to retreat, meditate or relax. a high end rustic experience on a sustainable organic farm near to the most beautiful black sand beach. We are a close drive to the current flowing lava. Inquire for more info about that and tours. Great neighborhood for walks, ocean sunsets,dolphin and turtle watching... the best snorkeling on the island and the world famous geothermal hot springs. Lots of Aloha ...
space: IT is open and bright with lots of air flow. You feel like your in nature but you have all the luxuries of a high end experience. We live here in the seaview estates farm lots. It is the best of all the worlds! We live near to kalani retreat center and world famous geothermal hot ponds.
description: This spot is breezy, peaceful, colorful and full of birds chirping. perfect for someone wanting to retreat, meditate or relax. a high end rustic experience on a sustainable organic farm near to the most beautiful black sand beach. We are a close drive to the current flowing lava. Inquire for more info about that and tours. Great neighborhood for walks, ocean sunsets,dolphin and turtle watching... the best snorkeling on the island and the world famous geothermal hot springs. Lots of Aloha ... IT is open and bright with lots of air flow. You feel like your in nature but you have all the luxuries of a high end experience. We live here in the seaview estates farm lots. It is the best of all the worlds! We live near to kalani retreat center and world famous geothermal hot ponds. We have about 1 acre of organic farm land and you are welcome to explore the gardens. You will have access to your own private outdoor shower and toilet. we live in the main house next door so feel free to ask if yo
access: We have about 1 acre of organic farm land and you are welcome to explore the gardens. You will have access to your own private outdoor shower and toilet.
interaction: we live in the main house next door so feel free to ask if you need anything at all. aaron my husband was born and raised on island so he knows all the ins and outs of the (Website hidden by Airbnb) sure to ask him about the best spots to visit!
house_rules: Please be quiet after 9pm we have young children. No smoking cigarettes on property! Please pick up after yourself and leave the space as you found it. Please be respectful to the space and neighborhood. Please don't pick fruit unless you ask first...Please don't throw toilet paper in toilet use rubbish bin next to toilet.

host.host_about: I am a traveler at heart who is highly motivated, active and inspired by people, places and most importantly, nature! I love meeting new people going new places and experiencing new situations! I am a yoga addict, runner,gardener, who knits, draws and travels a lot and believes in travel=education and wisdom! I love anything fermented. I am a big time foodie of anything healthy, organic, and high quality! I love adventures, sailing and having a lot of great laughs! I am very laid back, but like things tidy and organized. Low maintenance kinda person.

reviews.comments:
Awesome place in the rainforest! The hosts were super friendly and we loved playing with the dog. They gave us fresh coconuts for our trip to Volcano National Park which was a new experience for us. 
All in all a great place to stay!

We had the pleasure of staying with Lana last night and it was soooooo wonderful. The wind rocks you to sleep at night; along with the jungle sounds around you. I enjoyed the outdoor shower and we even made eggs! Great place. Don't hesitate. :)

This is a really cute and roomy cabin.

There's plenty of jungle sounds at night which I thought was really cozy. Falling asleep to the sounds of frogs and crickets and waking up to bird sounds was wonderful. But something to keep in mind if you are sensitive to noise.

We also really liked the outdoor shower and the hammock that hung diagonally across the room. That combined with the screen doors made it feel almost like sleeping outdoors, but with all the conveniences of actually being inside.

We had ended up in a bit of a pinch since we had made a late reservation closer to Hilo but where the host didn't get back to us in time. However Lana and her husband were able to answer really quickly and were able to meet us and and show us in even though we arrived quite late. So super big thanks for that.

The hosts also directed us to an awesome breakfast place in nearby Pahoa which really made our morning.

It's also very close to some tide-pools that were really awesome to snorkel in! If you stay here check out the Waiopai tide-pools!

Lana and her family were great. We didn't arrive until a little late because we had hiked to see a fresh lava flow around sunset but they were still available to meet us. The cabin was perfect surrounded by green and with plenty of soothing noise. Sad we couldn't stay a little longer. Highly recommend staying there if your in the area :)

The family an the apartment it was incredible and marvelous, like our home, but more beautiful. The couple and their children they've a good people, and very attended with us. They have a lot of services for the guests.
The best Airbnb just now for us.

This jungle bungalow is a magical place. 
We loved the openness, outdoor shower and bird songs. We saw more stars in the night sky than any other place we have visited. The stripe of the milky way is visible from INSIDE this cabin…incredible! 
It was a perfect spot for us for a night— we think it would have been too camp-style/minimalist for longer. The kitchen is a camp stove, a mini fridge and there is a single power strip for the cabin. Lana has done an amazing job making this place beautiful and well designed. The beds were comfy, the space is breezy and the yoga mats were so appreciated.
These are things to keep in mind: Be sure to arrive well before dark! This neighborhood is off the beaten path and there are no street lights. 
Upon our arrival we learned that there’s no cell phone reception (Verizon) and the wifi didn’t work for us. Unfortunately, our host had a family emergency and we weren’t able to contact her (without reception or wifi) to ask about wifi, drinking water, lighters, matches or flashlights.
Lana also gave us great dinner recommendations and even offered to show us the local lava flows!

Lana and Aaron welcomed us with overflowing Aloha and warmth. Our family of four felt right at home. The open plan cabin had the most exquisite view of the stars at night and falling asleep to singing frogs was magical. Lana and Aaron gave us wonderful tips to best enjoy the area, from best beach coves, the Tin Shack, the Wednesday night local market festival, to ideal lava viewing sights. We only wish we could have stayed longer.

Lana and her husband were great hosts. This place is magically and conveniently located in a beautiful setting. The space is very comfortable! My kids especially loved the loft and hammock.

For those who are not accustomed to the coqui frog, however, be warned that they are very noisy. This didn't bother us, but it could bother some. But I'll take natural sound over industrial noise any day.

The stars are amazing! We were able to witness shooting stars while lying in bed looking through the window screen.

We would definitely like to return again and highly recommend this space to anyone who loves nature.

Aaron immediately greeted us upon arriving and walked is through his and Lana's awesome Kalapana abode. It is really easy to get to the access road for lava viewing from there and just a cool home to stay in! Would definitely recommend to a friend. Thanks guys!

Yes all as was advertised,  there was daily contact with the family and neighbors. Good instructions about the place and surrounding area. A little difficult to find upon first arrivalin the dark but in a beautiful star filled sky, because of the community request for minimum light after dark
Lana was awesome!!!! Very easygoing family. She was helpful with pointing out local spots to checkout. Also, her pad is amazing and unique. We loved our stay.
We had a great time and loved this bungalow!

My sisters and I had a lovely overnight stay at Lana's charming ohana. It was the perfect place to stay during our adventure to view the Kalapana lava flow. Lana met us at check in, gave us a tour of the property, and even loaned us a couple of headlamps for our hike in the dark. She gave us great tips on Puna beaches to check out the following morning. We especially loved the warm pools!

The space was perfect for our short stay. The beds were comfortable and the outdoor shower was a real treat. 

Mahalo, Lana for the hospitality!

Lana and Aaron were wonderful hosts! This remote spot could be difficult to find in the dark, but we had no problems with Lana's seamless communication. She even went out of her way to meet us with a flashlight on the street to help guide us into the cabin. This place was perfect and I wish we had time to stay longer!

As we turned into a quaint and established neighborhood and pulled into this driveway, all we could think of was Wow!  Aloha and Welcome!!   What a fun, charming and sweet place!  The cabin is spacious, light, airy and super clean with 3 comfortable beds and a hammock.  We were totally impressed, loved how clean it was and how easy everything was.  Lana and her husband Aaron and their adorable family are super friendly, knowledgeable and enthusiastic hosts, they went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed and even shared some of their amazing garden produce with us.  The property is basically one big garden with tons of fruit trees and neat little flora and fauna.  We were treated to a neat coconut demonstration and loved playing with the friendly dog.  
 It is not your typical house, the shower and toilet are outside the main room, but private and clean, and just around the door (you don't have to walk far).  The water is on a catchment system and fresh drinking water is provided by the hosts. There is a small fridge and a two burner gas camping stove.  Simplicity at its finest and it works here, really well. We felt like we were a part of the jungle but safely enclosed from all the pests that come with the jungle, you just walk in and feel transported.    
    We felt safe, comfortable and really enjoyed staying here.  The coqui frogs sing all night as the stars dance in the dark night sky (hardly any excess light around here, I believe there is a light ordinance).  It was neat watching shooting stars from the 2 loft beds.  There were 2 twin lofts, a full bed and a hammock all which were comfortable and clean as well as a couch.   
Perfect jungle retreat, eco-conscious and worthy of your attention.  We will definitely be coming back and staying here next time we have family or friends visiting to see the current lava flow as the location is perfect and just the thought of this sweet place has us wanting to move in next door.

Lana was kind and welcoming.  She was very flexible in working with us with the weather (there were 2 hurricanes headed towards Big Island when we booked our trip).  The place was breezy and comfortable and had everything we needed for a quick weekend trip from Oahu to see the lava.  Lana gave us lots of information about the area and her children brought us fruit from their garden in the mornings.  We were even blessed to swim with the local pod of spinner dolphins at the nearby beach she told us about.  I would absolutely recommend her place.

Lana and Aaron were lovely hosts. They gave me a lot of space and privacy, yet they were available for anything I needed. The cabin was very comfortable. I loved the hammock in the middle. I would definitely recommend.
Same comments as above. I loved it so much, I booked another couple nights.

Lana was very welcoming and helpful, suggested nearby activities, and even brought us fruit grown on the property in the morning.  Beautiful place and perfect spot to experience the East side of Hawaii outside of Hilo.
Lovely place! Lana is very helpful in terms of travel info and you get to taste fresh fruit from her garden!!
Very clean, beautiful space! Lana is a very kind, warm person.

Accueil excellent, l'hôtesse est charmante.
Logement très rustique, mais ça fonctionne.
Une très bonne expérience pour vivre dans la nature et à son rythme.
Très bonne situation sur la côte est de l'île ( lava flow, etc)

첫 airbnb 이용이었는데 정말 실망스러웠습니다. 호스트는 만나기로 한시간에도 집에 없었으며 구글로 검색한 집은 다른 사람이 살고있었습니다. 설상가상으로 그 지역은 데이터 전화 모두 안터지는 지역이라 연락할 방법 또한 없었으며... 집앞에는 검정 큰 개 한마리가 우리 차를 보고 짖어대고 있었습니다. 사람있는지 소리 지르고 외쳐봤지만 아무도 없었으며, 결국 차를 돌려 그냥 다른 집을 알아보려고 하는 찰나에 지나가는 이웃 주민의 도움으로 같이 집을 찾아보며 다른 이웃주민 도움을 요청했습니다. 
우리가 예약 한 집은 구글 집옆에있는 잘보이지 않는 허름한 오두막이었고 전구도 없어서 조그마한 촛불로 밤을 지새웠습니다.. 호스트는 그다음날 자기가 가족 나들이가 있었다며 즐거운 여행이길 바란다는 말을 남겼고, 저는 지난밤 겪었던 불안함과 난감함 그리고 만나기로 한 시간에 나오지않아서 무슨일있었는지물어봤지만 대답도 없었습니다. 너무 실망스러운 호스트였습니다...

Perfect hosts! They were an incredily nice and welcoming family. The area was quiet and the living space was clean and open! It had everything you would need for an overnight or weeklong stay. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone interested.
Great place for a get away!  Loved being unplugged for the night :)  Recommend writing directions down because there is spotty cell phone service on the way there.
L'endroit est très bien, calme et relaxant. Nous avons beaucoup aimer être proche des gens locaux.

We loved our stay at Lana's place!! She and her family were incredibly welcoming and kind. The cabin is adorable, definitely a jungle retreat! It was so close to Kalapana where we biked out to see the lava and close to the beach park where we took a boat tour to view the lava flowing into the ocean, so if you're looking for lava viewing, this is the area to be! I would definitely come back again.
What a lovely and magical place.  It is a beautiful rustic retreat off the beaten track, near the beach and lava flows in a quiet corner of the Big Island.  Enjoy!

Lana and Aaron and their family were really nice and easy to talk to, they made me feel very comfortable. I stayed in their guest house for only 1 night by myself and it was such a nice space to be in- clean, comfy and creative, I really enjoyed the way the room was designed. It felt really open but somehow there were a million perspectives you could take; sit in the hammock, on the couch, on the bed, the porch, a stool at the counter, yoga mat on the floor or 1 of 2 little loft beds. They have a binder in the room with info and recommendations for the neighborhood that I found really helpful and a million stars at night. Overall my stay was very peaceful and happy.

ALSO: the neighborhood was central to all the good stuff and the kitchen and bathroom/shower were clean and nice.

Lana met us in the middle of the night when we arrived (I don't event know how she knew we were arriving she must be pretty intuitive!) just to make sure we were welcomed and told us all about the cabin. My 11 year old daughter liked it so much she asked my husband to build her a cabin just like it when she was ready to 'leave the house', I thought that was cute! It was a special place, very clean and quiet.

Me and my friends absolutely loved Lana's 'Jungle Retreat'. Very comfortable and cozy cottage. 4 of us fit there perfectly. Host herself was very sweet and accomodating. Offered us some fresh local fruit in the morning. Place itself has everything you need. Wish we could've  stayed there longer this time around and already planning to come back :)
It is perfect location of you are here to see the lava flow. Lana provided us with some flash lights for a night hike to see the lava since we showed up unprpepeared :P
Very nice quiet neighborhood with spectacular views to the ocean.

Thanks so much to Lana for having us at her place. It was lovely meeting her family and getting to know them. The room was very unique with candles and a lamp for light and an ourdoor shower. The toilet is outside but functional and private. 
She gave us some suggestions for the cantina 10 min drive away which had an amazing veg/vegan stall called Karuna foods and also the lava walking/bike tours near her place. 
We would suggest the place to travellers with similar interests in nature,adventure, and relaxing off grid.
We had a wonderful time. Lana and her family are lovely people.

I stayed with my boyfriend and both of our mothers, and this was the perfect space to enjoy our 1st night on the island. Lana was sweet and helpful, the property was amazing and the outdoor shower was awesome! Highly recommended.
Very secluded very close to volcano viewing trail. An hour from Hilo. The garden is absolutely beautiful and the decor is very spiritual

Aloha! Simple description: It was an awesome, inspiring, nature rustic retreat. It's roughing it with amenities, immersed in jungle nightlife with coqui frogs. It's great for seasoned campers/travelers and those seeking an adventurous "roughing it," jungle kind of experience, i.e., people who want to unplug, get off the grid, and connect with nature. It's secluded, but close to the ocean, nature parks, & volcanic activity. Lana and her family were super nice and community-oriented. They greeted us every morning with fresh coconuts – what a welcome surprise – and offered tropical fruit from her garden. She also lent us snorkeling gear. The space includes a stove, mini fridge, and running non-potable water. It's best to pick up groceries in town before arriving since it's secluded. Before we arrived, she emailed us a list of local attractions and information as well as provided a binder after we arrived. We chose the space because we sought to camp in Hawaii, but since we're from the mainland, we didn't have any camping gear with us. This was the next best thing. We got a unique, outstanding Hawaiian jungle experience we'll never forget. We LOVED staying there and would LOVE to stay there again.
We stayed at Lana's because we wanted a few days on the Big Island to see Hawaii Volcanoes National Park. In addition to the park, we went snorkeling with sea turtles at Black Sand Beach, witnessed an active lava volcano (Mauna Loa), swam in geothermal ponds, hiked in lava tube & on a caldera, ate lunch in Lava Tree State Park, and dined at the "southernmost restaurant in the US" with the best macademia nut pie ever. Mahalo, Lana & fam!

This was our second stay with Lana and Aaron. Again, a very special experience and we look forward to more stays with them in the future. Fantastic location and a peaceful place to stay to enjoy this part of the island.

If your coming over to explore the Puna district I would definitely recommend staying a few nights at Lana and Aaron's place. Adorable private cabin with a lovely atmosphere. Super clean, and genuine nice people.
Great location to get around to visit the sights of Kalapana and Kapoho. 
Just left and feeling so relaxed and happy :)
Beautiful and inspiring! Wish we could have stayed longer.

We are a family of three who stayed here for two weeks quite comfortably. It is a cabin experience (ie, rustic, feels open to night noises yet is screened in for protection) basic amenities, (but just ask if there is something you need, also the basicness is what makes this place charming), with private outside bathroom and shower. At night we lit tea lamps, which lana provides. It is situated on their property which they are working into a permaculture and there are a couple of other friendly people who camp on the land who are working the property. Lana and aarron and their two kids are wonderful people and it was so lovely to be around a family that is consience of the land. They are very welcoming relaxed people who are interested in sharing their love of hawaii yet also give you lots of privacy too. If you are arriving at night make sure you have all directions as the first time can be hard to find. There is a very friendly dog who barks at first but after that she doesnt, and cat. Also Lana was really great to email us a list of stores in hilo or pahoa for shopping before you arrive. This area is so interesting, tide pools, night market, lava, clothing optional black sand beach, yummy thai restaurant, rugged coast. It felt like an authentic hawaii experience for anyone who is not interested in resorts or just wants to meet varied and interesting people. Thank you for a great place to stay :) mahalo

Lana's family welcomed us with open arms. They provided great hospitality and tips on where to go and eat. From lending us snorkels to giving us fresh organic coconuts in the morning. You will fall in love with their dog Coco Lunar :)! My friends and I have never felt so connected with nature. Thank you Lana for making letting us stay at your beautiful Airbnb.

The cabin is adorable and very clean and Lana's family is very kind and welcoming. If you have a car, the location is perfect for going to see the lava entry into the ocean, taking a dip in the Ahalanui warm pool, and to go snorkelling at the kapoho tide pools (all activities that I strongly recommend!) Lana's cabin is a peaceful oasis in the forest, not too far from the ocean, and in an area I could only describe as hippy/hipster. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who has a car that's looking to discover the south side of the island.
Lana and Aaron as well as their children were great hosts. We enjoyed our stay at this very unique place. We felt like being part of their family. Thank you so much!!

This is a great getaway location! You are close to lava, close to amazing local gems, and you can have some quiet as well. Lana and her family are great for recommendations and also very welcoming. Would very much recommend.

Lana and Aaron are wonderful people, and their farm is a beautiful escape close to the lava flow. Very clean and comfortable, and our hosts were very kind and considerate. Would love to visit again. This place is a perfect getaway for people who enjoy being outdoors and sustainable conscious living.

We were greeted by this very kind and sweet family and their dog Coco Luna and made to feel welcome. Had a great sleep in the very comfortable and immaculate cottage. Got some good information about a bike ride to view lava, unfortunately my husbands bad knee was acting up. A great experience. Thank you Lana & Aaron!

My sister and I stayed at Lana and Aaron's place this past week and are already missing it! The cottage is such an amazing space and makes you feel like a kid again :) Pahoa is my favourite place to stay in Puna - the community is so open and makes you feel super welcome. I highly recommend staying here!

This place was like no other I've been to. Slightly off the beaten path and surrounded by nature. Coming from a big city, it was pretty cool to be surrounded by the sounds of birds, insects and to look up at the sky and see the stars. 
Lana was a great host with two beautiful children. Both the dog and the cat are very friendly. 

My only suggestion is to arrive before sunset, at least on the first day. It was a bit of a challenge to find the place in the dark.
The place was great

Lana's cabin was amazing and exactly as described. It feels like such a special place! It is not for you if you prefer air conditioning and proximity to shops and restaurants. But if you would enjoy falling asleep to the sounds of nature in a lovely secluded cabin, give it a try! Lana was helpful and very warm.  I would absolutely stay here again.

The cabin is lovely, we especially enjoyed the hammock. You can only hear noises from birds and frogs, all day all night; and be prepared for the partially outdoor/open shower.  The location is close to the lovely black sand beach and the hiking trail to see the lava flow to the sea; or you can take the lava boat tour at a nearby beach park. You should not miss Uncle Robert's night market on Wednesday nights; excellent food sold by different vendors.  Be sure to check-in the cabin during day time.  We checked-in after dinner at night and was very lost in the dark.  Otherwise, its a unique & lovely expereience to stay there.

The location was prefect and my favorite area on the big island. Pahoa is magical. While I loved this place, it may not be for eveyeone since it’s a bit exposed to the elements. The hosts were very kind checking on us at night durring an abnormally strong rain storm which was really loud and you felt as if you were in the storm. Our beds were not wet so for me it was an expreinemce I will never forget but may scare others. I had one of the best showers of my life at night on the property with the stars above and the frogs all around. I would recommend a frying pan a long lighter to lite the stove. Overall I really enjoyed my stay here!
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Great location! Perfect launchpad for exploring Puna area & lava 
Great local gem-hole-in-the-wall eating spots 
Highly recommended for couple with 1-2 kids. 
Will return!

It was very open and spiritual stay at Lana's place.
With ants and lizards shared with our room and going outside open air shower in dark was challenging.
But we have enjoyed new experience.

Very close to Lava walking and warm pool, about one and 1/4 hours drive to Volcano crater and 50 mints drive to Hilo down town.
We have only met Aaron at the first day, been told baby was sleeping so we were not sure when and how to contact them after, so we can not say much about Lana and her family.

Also, WiFi was not working at all.
And someone was mentioning before that better checking in day time. Very hard place to find.

If you are looking for very natural, open air, spiritual place with in budget cost.
You will enjoy Lana's place

Place is somewhat hard to find especially at night. Close to the end of kalapana/new Kaimu Beach where the night market is on wednesdays. they do have a very nice and well behaved doggie and a cat as well that will come out and play with you. nice change of pace from City Life.

While we had a poor experience due to the prolonged use, by the host's husband, of power tools during our stay, this is probably not typical of a stay here. The spacious independent unit provides privacy, is in good shape, with a useful kitchen area, great outside shower, nice garden surroundings, good location and Lana is a genuinely friendly and helpful host.
Peaceful and calm. It’s away from civilization, but amazing.

Lana's Hale is in the Kalapana Seaview Estates, which is a great neighborhood, and perfect jumping off point for lava hikes, Uncle's, Kehana beach, the Kapoho tide pools, and other great east shore explorations.  The space itself is sweet and funky, with a great island vibe. The outdoor shower was nice and warm, and playing with Cocoluna (the friendly house dog) was awesome. While this space may not be for every traveler, for those looking for a more off grid, authentically Puna experience, this was great. Mahalo!
Excellent time in the area. The space was airy and sweet. Highly Recommend ❤️
Wifi wasnt turned on when host said she would turn it on.  Fresh fruit from Lana's place was shared with (Website hidden by Airbnb) much we had to return some so it wouldnt go to waste.

A comfy cabin in the sweet, quiet Seaview neighborhood. Aloha vibes all around! Lots of fun stuff to do in the area. If you are not comfortable with the natural world maybe stay in the nearest hotel. We loved falling asleep to the peaceful jungle sounds, showering under the stars and being close to the ocean. Lana and Aaron were great hosts, and we had an awesome time during our month-long stay!

Lana's place captures the essence of the pahoa/puna region with warm hospitality and a great vibe that represents the region to its fullest extent. Please look up pahoa before you travel to this area, its one of the most unique regions of Hawaii and the United States and we are glad to have experienced this corner of Hawaii

Lana and her familly were very welcoming. They were generous and helpfull also toughtfull of every detail. The lodging tough simple was charming and clean whit all basic ameties ( gas stove, shower ). All surrounded by tropical garden. We sampled the best coconut and avocado. We highly recomend this place !
Very clean place and a lot of space!

Lana and family welcomed me with open arms and paws and hearts to their home. Really, what more could you ask for as a guest on the sacred land of Hawaii.  Each time I come to Puna, I leave a bit of my heart- and I look forward to sharing space with Lana and the family and the community again.
Quaint open air loft cabin in the rainforest. Great for a rustic stay. Expect amazing and loud night sounds from all the critters and rain.
Wonderful hospitality and a very lovely place. Our kids enjoyed it very much as well. The owners gave us fresh cherries and coffee. Very nice touches.
Lana her brautiful family was so kind an helpful, we really had the Hawaii Jungle experience

Lana's place is a fantastic space to unwind and plug in to life on the Big Island. It's located just a five minute drive (less really) from beautiful Kehena Beach and you're just another seven minutes or so to one of the coolest places in the area - Uncle Robert's. It's an open air kind of marketplace with a fantastic smoothie place, food, a bar, and one night a week it transforms into one of the greatest and chillest parties I've ever experienced with countless food and artisan vendors, a ten or so piece Hawaiian band, full bar, and tons of cool locals. Anyway, the location of Lana's place is great, and only about 25 minutes to Pahoa. The shower is SWEET and hot- and outdoors to boot. Toilet has a bidet which is a nice extra. Lana wasn't there during our stay, so we had the whole property to ourselves. She has a guy help out with anything you may need while she's away and we felt well taken care of. The grounds around the bungalow are landscaped beautifully and you'd have plenty of privacy even if Lana were at home in her house nearby. She responded quickly to all of our communications and helped us add nights to our stay. The space itself is a cool split level with additional sleeping in a little loft and there's a comfy hammock. It's an open air place with screens so as long as you're not expecting a sealed house, you'll do great. We used bug spray to keep mosquitos and no see-um's away and had a fantastic time chilling out here. Everything you need is in the kitchen as well. My girlfriend and I were super stoked to stay here, thanks again, Lana!

This is a great place for nature lovers. You are staying in a jungle-like garden and you can learn everything about all the plants from Lana. We got fresh coconuts, bananas and passionsfruits - it was like paradise. It’s close to different lava fields on which you can hike and marvel about this special part of Big Island. The place is remote, basic and comfy - the hammock in the hut  ist great! Lana and her family are lovely, open hearted people, who had been very helpful in every way. We enjoyed our time at Lana‘s very much and send lots of love to Lana, Aaron, kids and cat :-)

We had a very warm welcome with Lana and her Family. Our kids had a funny time with the kids of them, they played very well together. Additionally we received some attentions like dry banana slides, coconut and some herbs and a walk through the garden - they are so friendly - it was so nice to stay there - thank you Lana

It was such a blast staying in this WUNDERFUL! place. It was magical, clean and we simply had a very good time there! Lana and Aaron are great and kind people, who are sharing a piece of heaven with others with a true aloha spirit. One of the best accomodations I had so for on all of my bookings with air bnb.
as you may have read: recommended.

Aaron, Lana, and family are such warm, welcoming, and accommodating hosts. Cocoluna and Tangelo were a delight to meet and spend a little time with as well. 

Aaron and Lana were so kind to show us around their farm and answer my many questions about their way of life. What a real treat to experience hand-made chocolate, kimchi and teas, and the fresh-picked/prepared treats from their farm that their beaming children brought to us each day.

There were breakfast, lunch, and dinner menu options that guests have the option to peruse and pre-order from for reasonable prices. We had stocked up on a few groceries before we arrived so unfortunately for us, (because it all looked so good!), we didn't order anything :(.

Sleeping in the 'jungle' with the night birds and little frogs singing through the night was something I hope to never forget and reminded me of home. You won't really get to know this unique heart of Hawai'i without experiencing a stay here with Aaron, Lana, and their family.

Don’t know what to say other than Lana’s place was the most chill place out of the five places we stayed in Hawaii. The location is great; close to the ocean, very quiet and you can really see the stars. Lana makes excellent food and they grow lots of tasty fruits. Would definitely recommend if you’re staying on the big island.
A delightful getaway with an incredible view of the stars!  Lana and her husband were so hospitable, offering tips on local events and scenery.  Thanks for a great stay!

Lana and her family are very friendly and great hosts. We felt us very welcome. It was a new experience for us to live, because the toilet and shower was outside. But we liked it. We had everything what we needed. And such a great time. I can only recommend this accommodation. This is a place where you feel free and connected with the nature. Thank you for this beautiful time.

Excellent hospitality and very cute, convenient, clean lodging in an off grid paradise! Lana and her family are very down to earth and so welcoming. She makes amazing, healthy treats and totally embodies the aloha spirit.  The place includes a lot of friendly botanical / natural touches and the space feels very safe.  I’d stay at her place again in a heartbeat & would recommend it to anyone interested in similar lodging / location.  Thanks for everything!

name: Habitacion N#5  con baño privado
summary: La habitacion dispone  de baño privado, aire acondicionado caliente y frió, minibar , tv, Internet, armarios. Possible tres camas, una matrimonio y una soltero. LLuego hay un salon con una cocina y un living room para leer o relajarse en un sofa, o usar internet gratis.
space: Estamos muy cerca de la playa de Bogatell, unos 3 minutos caminando. Hay tambien la Rambla de Poblenou que esta a la vuelta de la calle, donde hay supermercados, cafes, tiendas, farmacias, fruterias biologicas etc
description: La habitacion dispone  de baño privado, aire acondicionado caliente y frió, minibar , tv, Internet, armarios. Possible tres camas, una matrimonio y una soltero. LLuego hay un salon con una cocina y un living room para leer o relajarse en un sofa, o usar internet gratis. Estamos muy cerca de la playa de Bogatell, unos 3 minutos caminando. Hay tambien la Rambla de Poblenou que esta a la vuelta de la calle, donde hay supermercados, cafes, tiendas, farmacias, fruterias biologicas etc Los huespedes pueden disfrutar de su habitacion privada con baño y despues un living room y cocina que son compartidos. Vivimos en el mismo edifico y estamos disponibles todo el dia para cualquier problema como por ejemplo olvidar las llaves de la puerta principal, o olvidarse el codigo de la puerta de su habitacion,o alguna informacion turistica, autobuses, precios etc. todo lo que necesite el huespede. El barrio Poblenou es fantastico, hay mucha vida, es un barrio familiar, cerca de la playa con muy buenos r
neighborhood_overview: El barrio Poblenou es fantastico, hay mucha vida, es un barrio familiar, cerca de la playa con muy buenos restaurantes, bares ,cafeterias,supermercados, farmacia, etc todo lo que un viajero pueda necesitar, es como si estubieran en casa.
notes: ningun aspecto que pueda afectar los clientes a la llegada, estamos siempre pendientes de la llegada del cliente para el check-in
transit: Hay lineas de autobuses ( H16 que va plaza Catalunya) y Metro linea amarilla, es muy facil
access: Los huespedes pueden disfrutar de su habitacion privada con baño y despues un living room y cocina que son compartidos.
interaction: Vivimos en el mismo edifico y estamos disponibles todo el dia para cualquier problema como por ejemplo olvidar las llaves de la puerta principal, o olvidarse el codigo de la puerta de su habitacion,o alguna informacion turistica, autobuses, precios etc. todo lo que necesite el huespede.

host.host_about: Soy divertido,hablador,tengo muchos amigos,trabajo mucho para lograr mis objetivos en la vida, estoy casado tengo 4 hijos, he viajado a muchos países,(Japón y Canadá y EUA me han encantado). Me gustan las películas de acción, la Música Popular Brasileña .

reviews.comments: The place was exactly as described by Paulo. We had a great time staying there. It is literally 2 minutes walk from the beach. We had good sleep there compared to other places we stayed in the city center where noise was normal until very late at night and very early in the morning. Paulo and his wife did all what they could to help us during our stay at their place.
It is good for company of friends. Perfect location . It is close to Marbella beach and nude place .

We enjoyed our stay at Paulo's place for 2 nights. Before arriving we had agreed upon 1:00 PM as the check-in and check-out time. When we arrived at the apartment, we were greeted by Paulo's wife, who showed us around the apartment and our room. On the last morning of our stay, Paulo's wife knocked on our door at 10:30 AM and said she had forgotten to tell us we needed to be out of the room by 11:00 AM for it to be cleaned. We were expecting to have until 1 PM as previously mentioned, so that put us in an awkward position. We quickly got ready and packed up our stuff, and she let us store it in another room for the remaining 2 hours.

The pictures accurately represent the space-- the room is large with lots of storage space, hangers and drawers; the bathroom is also very large, with a working shower and bathtub and lots of counter space. The mattress felt comfy at first, but it is very soft and not supportive (probably an Ikea mattress).

The living room is shared between multiple other rooms listed on AirBnb as well, and it has ample seating for everyone with 3 tables and 3 couches.

The location was overall good for that neighborhood. Immediately downstairs there's nothing, but turn the corner and you're on Rambla del Poblenou with lots of stores and restaurants and people strolling or eating. It's also a convenient walk to the beach (just don't take your shoes off, the beaches in Barcelona were very dirty).

Chris et Paulo sont tres gentils et propose tous les conseils dont nous avons besoin. Nous avons logé dans une chambre très spacieuse avec une salle de bain tout aussi spacieuse .....tout étais très propre et bien rénové. Endroit très calme et proche à pied d'une plage très propre et de restaurants. Toutes les commodités sont dans les alentours et pour le centre ville ...un bus vous y emmène pour moins d'un €. Conseil acheter la carte de 10 voyages. Nous y retournerons avec certitude.

L'accoglienza è stata ottima e la casa rispettava a pieno la descrizione dell'annuncio .... appartamento molto pulito e tranquillo ... i proprietari sono delle persone molto disponibili e cordiali.. ottima permanenza

Chris and Paulo are very nice and offer all the help and information we needed. Place is quiet with nice ambiance, we enjoyed our stay @Paulo's for five days in Barcelona. The house very close to the beach. We are foodies, So Paulo suggested the best restaurants available close to the place and those are very good. We will be happy to stay again at this place in Barcelona.
Ok

We had such a great stay at the apartment. Paulo and his family are so friendly and kind to answer questions and help with any information. The apartment is literally 2 min walk from the lovely beach, and about 15 min bus-ride to the center where the Rambla is. It only cost 2,15 Euro to take to bus and it is so easy to find at the main street, buses leave every 15 min. 

In the center we found a little place called Sol Soler and we will highly recommend it for at night out of eating tapas and drinking sangaria! so fantastic and local. We decided to walk to Sagrada familia and it was easy to find. From three girls who had an amazing stay in Barcalona - we would gladly come back for another visit anytime and stay at Paulo's :)

Paolo and his wife have just been perfect hosts, felt like being with family. Helped with an extra-bed, which was really very comfortable, had a bottle of water ready. One big room at center of all rooms is equipped with a clothwasher, a kitchen with all you need and plenty of space for eating/gathering. Sleeping rooms all have an own airconditioning (worked perfectly well). In room 5 (habitacion 5) we even had an own kitchen and 2 fridges, apart from a coach-bed, a table with chair. The surrounding is a little bit old-fashioned, but really quiet (absolutely no noise) and without feeling bad around there. Was told that this zone is getting more and more back to fashion again - really close to all! also the olympic zone. Just very recommendable! Just don't expect a hotel, and you will feel at home.
Paolo would take care of any request or query about Barcelona's sightseeing.
Paolo picked us up at the airport for 38 EUR, which was already a perfect start.
The flat is really very close to the beach, like 5 Min walk on a straight street. Beach is VERY clean and nice! Taking a taxi to town / Montjui / city center / Plaza Colon costs about 8-10 EUR/way (depending on traffic), by bus 1 EUR/person for one way till 1,5hours (you can jump off and on again within time).
Again 1 square further you have Poble Nou's own Rambla, which in my opinion, is much quieter and nicer than Barcelona's city center one! Great food at 'Tertulia' and an even much better Sangria at 'La Roda'. There's also hairdressers, cosmeticians, food shops and fashion shops... really all you can wish for!
If looking for great flamenco, I personally recommend (am a flamenco dancer myself), go to 'Palau Dalmases' at Montcada 20 (in front of Picasso Museum) in Barcelona city center. You will have a wonderful 1-hour performance for 20 EUR/person.
Any entry to museums, e.g. 'Sagrada Familia' take tickets online (MUCH cheaper and you avoid waiting queues!)  - it's an absolutely must-see one.
If you have kids (also teenagers) and it's warm I recommend to plan a 6-hour stay at 'Illa Fantasia' a great aquaparc with lots of funny tubes. It's not the most modern one, but funny. Food will be limited to hamburgers and fries and ice creams, though (ask at a tourist info for an organised trip - cheaper).
Our favourite zone within Barcelona's city center: Born. It's the ancient gothic area, with lots of little shops and bars/restaurants.
All in all, I'm sure to go back to Paolo's and certainly Barcelona - had a real great time!!!
Have fun, too.
By the way, it was our first time in Barcelona and furthermore, on AirBnB. Feel very lucky having hit with Paolo's apartment and even more with his lovely family :-D

Paulo et sa femme son tres gentil et genereux, ils nous ont acceuilli parfaitement et chaleureusement. Les chambres sont impeccable et agreable.

Je recommande fortement ce logement.
good room and nice host

Nos hospedamos en familia con niños por una semana en Casa de Paulo, desde el primer día quedamos muy satisfechos por lo que encontramos. La casa es tal como está descrito en el anuncio, muy acogedora, limpia, espaciosa y tiene todo lo necesario en la cocina. Paulo y su esposa muy amigables, estuvieron a la orden para responder nuestras dudas o recomendarnos lugares a donde ir y como ir. La calle donde se ubica la casa no está muy bien cuidada pero esto no es responsabilidad de los dueños, y a la vuelta de la esquina queda la Rambla de Poblenou, una calle comercial muy transitada donde se encuentra de todo, y las estaciones de buses o Metro hacia el centro de Barcelona están a pocos minutos de la casa. La playa queda a 6-8 minutos de camino, cruzando un gran parque que hace el ambiente muy agradable. Recomiendo la Casa de Paulo!

The accommodation is nice and clean with shared livingroom with extra kitchen. The owner's room is om the same floor with his family so I would pay attention mitigate noise level. But the location is ideal for going out or wisiting the beach. Thera are many nice restaurants within 2 min walk
Everything was fine except the beds were a little uncomfortable.

Very kind and responsible host.
The room was very clean and net. Excellent. I highly recommend.

La situacion del apartemento esta muy tranquila cerca de la playa y muy comoda para ir al centro con el metro y el autobus. Paulo y su familia son muy simpaticos y nos encanto cantar y tocar el piano en el apartamento. Es un apartamento muy bueno y el espacio comun esta muy grande. Todo alli para cocinar, descansar, y disfrutar. El bano esta muy grande y Paulo nos ha dado tambien acceso a una pequena habitacion para mi hijo.

This is  a professionalised Airb'n'b. Paolo was very friendly and flexible. You share the common areas with other guests, not much the family. It is clean and situated in an up and coming part of Barcelona, only minutes away from wonderful coffee and the beach. It seemed a little pricy, but that might be due to the MOBILE fair at the time of our visit. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Our stay with Paulo was great and exceeded our expectations. Paulo was quick to communicate and was able to be flexible in meeting our very late arrival time from Girona airport. Furthermore the large size of the room and bathroom was perfect, and the common areas were beautiful. The apartment was also in very close proximate to the beach and close to central Barcelona. Would definitely recommend!

We had a great time in Barcelona, and this airbnb was perfect for our needs. Linens, pillows and towels were all provided, the beds were comfortable, and there was air conditioning and a fridge. The bathroom was amazing and spacious, and everything was accurate to the pictures and description provided. The shared living area was beautiful and clean, with a kitchen, sitting areas and a piano, which my friend (a composer) appreciated. Paulo was very flexible about us arriving at odd hours throughout the night and was overall a very gracious host. The airbnb is located a fair distance away from the tourist area, but there were plenty of fantastic local stores right next door to get meals and do a little shopping, and we enjoyed being close to the beach. Overall a great deal and a great airbnb experience!
Lovely hosts and large pleasant communal area. Great location near the beach and some nice restaurants
todo bien

El lugar tiene muy buena ubicación, las camas son muy cómodas, el salón es un lujazo y el baño una pasada. Paulo y su esposa son muy atentos y serviciales. No podemos estar más contentos de habernos alojado aquí!
The neighborhood is fantastic and the place is very quiet. We didn't expect it to be a hostel but it was very clean and spacious and we weren't bothered at all by outside noises.
Everything was awesome,  very kind and friendly hosts, apartments are close to the sea. Next time in Barcelona will try to stay here again.

Luogo fantastico, i proprietari sono molto ospitali e le camere sono sempre in ordine e pulite. Per quanto riguarda la posizione è vicinissima alla spiaggia ma un po' fuori dal centro dove però vicino si trovano metro e fermate del bus. Grande esperienza vale la pena provare.

Bonjour à tous,
Bravo à Paulo et sa famille qui nous ont très bien accueilli durant 9 jours en août. Nous avions mes filles et moi la plus belle chambre avec un grand dressing et une très grande salle de bains ! Ce sont des gens très discrets et adorables. Tout était très propre autant à la cuisine que nous partageons avec d'autres que notre chambre.
Vraiment excellent rapport qualité/prix.
Nathalie, Enghien les bains

Nous avons extrêmement bien accueillis par Paulo et Chris .
Paulo nous attendait en bas de l'immeuble à notre arrivée et nous a tout de suite mis à l'aise . 
L'appartement est très joli , propre , spacieux , fonctionnel , 
bien entretenu et très bien placé près de la Rambla ( avenue  avec des restaurants , boutiques , bars etc ) et à 5 mn à pieds de la plage .

Paulo a pris le temps de me donner des conseils sur les lieux à visiter à barcelone et nous a également suggérés des restaurants locaux fréquentés  par les espagnols.

Paulo et Chris sont des hôtes très gentils , serviables et chakeureux  . On ne pouvait rêver mieux !!!!

Our stay with Paulo was brilliant. The room was fairly spacious and the private bathroom was well kept. Paulo and his family were extremely friendly, especially their dog Mimi. The location the stand out feature, only a few minutes walk to the beach. We tried a few of Barcelona's beaches and the one nearest was by far the best. Would thoroughly recommend Paulo's place, if I ever come back to Barcelona this will definetly be my first port of call.

This was one of the best airbnbs I have ever stayed at and I would definitely stay here again and again. Paulo and his family are kind and generous people who made my stay unforgettable. My favorite part was playing the piano they have in the common area with his amazing daughter! 
The bedroom was spacious and clean and had its own refrigerator, so great if you like to save some money on meals.  The private bathroom was also a plus. The common area was decorated with interesting artwork and paintings and had a very welcoming feel.  It is a great way to meet other friendly visitors in passing or can choose to keep to yourself. 
The location is great since you are a 5 minute walk from the beach and literally around the corner from the Rambla in poblenou where there are tons of restaurants and shops.  Also it's a prime location for public transit with bus stops very close by and subway within a 10 min walk.  Poblenou has a special feel to it.  It's still incredibly lively but a nicer place to stay than the main part of the city if you like coming back to a quieter neighborhood to sleep.
