host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I’m an AirBnb host that uses Airbnb when I travel.

reviews.comments: Very nice three-bedroom house in a quite and friendly area. Stop&shop supermarket is close by for food, groceries, liquor. Host is friendly and helpful, ready to assist and provide useful information. Closest subway is Grand Av, 15 min walk.

The house was nicely furnished and the kitchen had a good variety of utensils. The bathroom was remodeled. TV and WiFi worked fine. The neighborhood was quiet, about fifteen minutes walk to the R line, which is a good train for destinations in Manhattan. Communication with host was excellent.

House was great for our needs. Close to public transportation and a supermarket. I am familiar with the neighborhood and was happy to be so close to family and friends for the holidays.  It was great inviting them into "our" livingroom and relaxing with them.
Host was quickly responsive to our needs. Large and roomy, we felt very much at home.

We really enjoyed our time at Desmond's place. It was just as described, and shown in the pictures. Desmond was kind enough to give us a quick walkthrough and give us any important information needed for staying there. He also was kind enough to point us to stores, bus/trains stops, etc. This place is only a short walk to the stop you need to get into downtown Manhattan. There are many places to eat nearby and grab some snacks at a convenience store. We were able to park 2 cars across the street from the apartment. We would definitely stay here again in the future!
Desmond's home is wonderful, in a great location, and lives up to the name 'cozy.' He's available as a host if you need him, and the house was a true pleasure to stay in.

Desmond was kind enough to give us walkthrough the house. It is at a nice location and walking distance from grocery shop. It doesn't match the description; sofa is sagging, floor screeches especially when climbing stairs and house sleeps 5 only. There is only one gas heater in house that is in living area, no heaters in rooms. I avoid gas heaters as pose risk of CO2 poisoning. Bathroom is remodeled but no lock and door doesn't engage so no privacy. Behind the house is railway track and one may hear LIRR trains passing at quiet night time that may disturb sleep of those who are not deep sleepers. Dining chairs are for decoration only so don't sit as parts are already separate.
Home away from home. Loved the house, exactly as it appeared in pictures. Very clean and convenient nearby stores. Awesome stay definitely staying here again next time visiting in New York.

Nous avons passé 3 nuits dans cette charmante maison. Nous avons apprécié le calme du quartier, d'où il est possible de rejoindre Manhattan sans difficulté en 20 minutes de marche (bus possible) et environ 1/2 heure de métro. Venant de Montréal, nous avons laissé la voiture dans la rue qui est sûre. La maison est confortable, parfaite pour 2 couples et 1 personne seule. Nous n'avons pas rencontré Desmond, mais il a toujours répondu très rapidement et aimablement à nos questions.
Nous n'avons malheureusement pas pu rencontrer notre hôte. Néanmoins, tout était prêt à nous recevoir et la maison été bien rangée et propre.

Being that using the service of airbnb for the first time, it was somewhat of a clueless adventure to find something.  Desmond as a host was great and explained everything in a detailed manner. The neighbor hood was quite as a perfect place for my family reunion with my parents from Dubai and brother with wife from Canada. We did enjoy every bit of it. The heating was ample and also the cleanliness of the place and not to mention which was good as there is a water pipe to clean yourself, not the shower. All of our family members enjoyed everything about the place. My overall experience was there is no complain.

We enjoyed our stay at Desmonds place. He was helpful with directions on getting to the subway which was only about 15 minutes away. The neighborhood appeared to be safe for walking day and late evening. I would stay again.

We stayed at Desmond's place after our visit to the Niagara falls. He was accommodating since we had a very late check in. Unfortunately we never got to meet him in person but got our questions answered promptly. The place was very beautiful and the kitchen had all the silverware. People who are going to stay at Desmond's place need to get their toiletry and a door sign for the bathroom. One major drawback to his place was that the bathroom had no lock along with creaky floors and stairs. The best part of the place was the hand shower in the bathroom which my parents really liked. Our experience has been a pleasant one at his lovely home. We will definitely recommend it to our friends and family.

Desmond reageerde heel snel en adequaat op mijn mailtjes. Handdoeken in mandjes, bedden opgemaakt. van het huis naar het subway station is een kwartier lopen, je kunt ook met een frequente bus. Naar Manhattan kost ongeveer een half uur met de subway, dat lijkt lang, maar NY is erg groot!
Nice home great price and convenient location. A pleasure to deal with thanks so much :)

Desmond greeted us when we first check in and even helped us take our luggage up into the rooms. Place was clean and well kept with tons of towels and other basic amenities. 
Location was a drawback for us as we were mainly using public transport and the nearest subway (Grand Av-Newton) was 15mins walk. Other than that everything else was wonderful.

Thanks a lot to Desmond for our stay. We loved our stay. There was a big supermarket near the place. It's really a quite place to stay. Our children loved the backyard very much. We traveled with 5 children so there was enough place for us to sleep. The apartment was fully equipped with all necessary things. We recommend travelers to choose this place!

We stayed at Desmond's house for three nights. The house is exactly how he described. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. We were 4 people and the house can definitely accommodate five or more. His place is a beautiful town house 15 min walking distance from the closest subway station. It takes around 40 min to go to Manhattan. The neighborhood has couple of convenience stores which also has a 10-15 min walking distance from his place. We haven't meet with him but he was available for any questions. We would definitely stay at Desmond's place again.

Desmonds home is very old style new york. Feels very homey and relaxing. He area is calm and quiet. The beds are comfortable and the jetted tub is a plus after walking around the city all day.  I would stay there again !

This was a fantastic stay. We had a total of 5 people stay over and we stayed very comfortably. Desmond responds back same day so it doesn't take too long to hear back from him. I liked the area of the place and overall the house was very nice, clean, and comfortable. The pics you see of the property exactly match what we saw face to face. 

Just two things that were rather disappointing. One of those things was that the driveway down the stairs was not a permanent spot for us to use for parking. Street parking at night was tough. The second was the lack of locks on the doorknobs of each room, especially the bathroom. Keep that in mind. Maybe buy a door hanging sign that says "don't enter" or something. 

Besides those two things, everything else was great. I would definitely use this place again.
Desmond is a great and very professional person. He replied very past and no problem at all. the location is good and neighbor so quite.
家で停電が発生した時の対応が遅かった事とACが一階に一つしかない為､二階が暑かった事を除けば問題はなかった｡
Great experience living in the house, lovely classic style furnitures and clean as discribed, excllent!

I never got to meet Desmond, but he was very friendly and helpful over the phone and text for the 7 nights we stayed here.
The unit is very comfortable and homey with a "antique" furniture style that I quite enjoyed. The bathroom is very new, clean, and modern, which I appreciated--however, I would've liked if there was a lock on the bathroom door. If two people don't mind sharing a full (listed as "double") bed, the unit can fit 5 people at the most.
On the first night staying there, when we had both the AC and microwave on, the breaker tripped, which took about 1.5 hours to resolve (would've appreciated if Desmond gave us a heads up to be careful, but he was at work when it happened so I still appreciated his quick response). We later discovered that even without the AC on, running a blowdryer on high would cause the breaker to temporarily trip, so we had to resort to using a very small travel sized blow dryer we happened to have on hand.
For light sleepers, there is a railway right behind the house that runs at all hours of the night so I've been woken up by the sound of (what sounds like) large cargo trains driving past at 2-3AM and 5AM several times.
All basic info provided, and clearly communicated.  Clean, comfortable, good location. Served our needs as a group of 4 very nicely, Thanks.
The house is super clean. Will have a wonderful experience there for sure.

I really enjoyed my stay as well as my family. Desmond greeted us when we arrived and promptly responded to my e-mail messages.  There was a gym close by which was very important to me, and the walk to the train station was only 10-15 minutes.  The townhouse was clean and there was air conditioning which was wonderful.

What a great experience we had at Desmond's place! The apartment is perfect for 4 people,  with a lot of common space and a nice back porch area. Just 15min walking distance from the metro, quiet and safe neighborhood. Save some money by staying in Queens!
Good experience.
Great home. Desmond is very responsive and gives very quick replies. My friends and I enjoyed our stay in NY and this home was quite comfortable :)

Me And my Friends had such a great stay at desmond's place in elmhurst! The whole house looks exactly like in the pictures and everything was clean and cozy! The subway station is a bit far but we didn't find it as a difficulty! We arrived at 9pm but Desmond was there to greet us and to tell us about the amenities! I would totally recommend staying at his place

Everything was okay except two things
1. The lighting in the entire house was very low. 
2. My wife and his brother did the check in and apparently Desmond very rude during the check in process.

Desmond was very responsive and accommodating with all questions/requests. The place was super cozy (as described) and had everything we needed to make us feel welcome & comfortable. The decor was very antique and cute. We had a wonderful holiday stay!
The home is very clean, cute, and welcoming. Desmond was easy to get ahold of and was very helpful each time we contacted him. Excellent host.

We have been at home, very comfortable, in a quiet and safe neighborhood.
Metro is 15 minutes away and the center of Manhattan is reached in 45 minutes.
We would certainly repeat.

Had a great stay at the townhouse, was able to drop of my bags before check-in time and get some options from Desmond on things to do in New York. The subway station was about a 10-15 minute walk from the house and overall the neighborhood is nice and quiet. Also, it was nice to have a grocery store down the street from the house.
Great house, good location, just the lack of a lock on the bathroom was a little off-putting.
It was very spacious and efficient to stay. Recommended :)

Cozy clean two floors with 3 beds 
House, if in NYC again definitely will be sams house

This is really the cozy house as it says in its description, everything we needed was there during our stay and Desmond was really accommodating even though we did not meet in person. I would recommend this stay if you want a cozy house to come 'home' to.
Clean and spacious place. House definitely has a character. Very pleased with my stay.

We had such a wonderful stay!  The house is so homey making our stay in New York the best yet.  We really hope to stay here again on our next trip.

For New York the house felt very spacious and our 3 yo loved having his own big room with plenty of space to set up his train set either up or downstairs.

The kitchen was also a good size and had everything we needed to cook our meals.

The bathroom was also great with a really nice soaking tub and alternate shower head options.

The beds are comfy and the furnishings are all really lovely.  

We had a snow blizzard while we were there and the heater was sufficient throughout the freezing temperatures.

We also loved the neighbourhood with parks at either end of the street, supermarket just a short walk away and close to many other eateries.  It was a bit of a hike to the train although I'm not sure I took the best route!

Internet was fast and plenty of options on the TV too.

Desmond was very responsive throughout our stay despite never meeting him.  He also cleared the snow from the steps for us.

Overall we loved our stay here and are certainly hoping to stay again in the future.  It was our little home away from home.

Our host was attentive and (BIG PLUS) grocery store 5 minutes away. Checking in and checking out was a breeze. Place was very comfortable and clean. One thing to know is when it comes to parking: We had to drive around the neighborhood to find a parking spot but hey its New York.
Alles verliep heel vlot, leuk onthaal en nuttige tips!
The house is big, clean and has everything you need. It is a 10-15 min walk to the nearest metro station where you can easily get a train into Manhatten or to the airport.

Desmond's place was a great find. it was spacious and located in a nice residential neighborhood. The only problem that we experienced was with the internet otherwise everything was as listed. Desmond was a very gracious host and I would definetly book this location again. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Desmond's house is big and very clean. You can find everything you need in the house. He will message you the details about how to get the subway before you arrive. That was a really good stay. Highly recommend for families.
The best in NYC. You won't find better.
Desmond's place was great and very comfy. Just as described and he communicated with me very well.
Prima verblijf gehad, het huis was netjes en goed uitgerust. Het warme water werkte niet meer op een dag, dit is vlot en volledig hersteld door Desmond. Communicatie is snel en scherp.
A lot of space! My family of five were very comfortable. Desmond was very responsive and helpful whenever we needed info or anything else. About 15 minute walk to the subway.
Desmond is responsible. Some problems happened while we stay at the apartment that he fixed them immediately. If we go to New York next time, we will choose this apartment again.
Nice and quiet neighbourhood, great and pleasant host.

Desmond's home filled all of our needs, as we were attending events at Citifield it was perfect for us.

The private deck in the back is a real gem and we enjoyed breakfast out there every morning.

Getting to public transportation was easy and convenient and if you have a subway pass you can use it on the buses up and down Grand St.
Desmond welcomed us very nicely. Our stay was perfect.
Large clean place perfect for families. I would definitely recommend.
Great host, great communication. Overall, great stay.

The place is really nice. We unfortunately had some issues with electricity when we cam in because work was being done around the neighborhood. Fortunately, Mr. Desmond was very attentive and helpful. He was able to take care of the problem somehow while we were at the US Open watching matches. 

The place is quiet and in a nice little neighborhood. We didn't have any complaint a about the location. 

This would be a great location to stay over the winter because it is well equipped with heating. 

I would recommend this place. Mr. Desmond is a good host.

We had a wonderful time in this house. The check in was quick and we were able to meet Desmond, who is very nice and helpful. The house is beautiful and the bedrooms very confortable. The neighborhood seems very nice with a supermarket really close and the subway like a 15 minute walk from there. Highly recommended place.

This is our 2nd stay here and whilst the location isn't close to public transport we love the house.  It's very homey and a very good space for NYC with large rooms, equipped kitchen and good living areas.  The only thing we weren't aware of was the lack of air conditioning.  If the weather was hotter it would have been unbearable.

We had a great stay in Desmonds apartment. It offers a lot of space, a nice terrace and quiet neighborhood. Perfect for families (3 bedrooms!). Also, Desmond is always helpful and friendly, in case you need help which we did not really. I totally recommend staying at Desmonds. Everything just as in the descriptions. Cheers

Everything was going fine UNTIL...

First the good. Desmond's house is generally clean (if a bit dated) and conveniently situated to transportation, groceries, shopping, a gym, and a park.  Desmond himself is quick to respond to any questions sent. And the price presented a pretty compelling value for a family or group of 5+ people visiting NYC on a tight budget who don't need anything fancy. 

However, there was a bad. Everything was going fine UNTIL...
Desmond and I agreed my family and I could stay an extra night since the house was available. However on that final night, a stranger I had never seen before barged into the house from the basement apartment while we were upstairs getting ready for bed. I ran downstairs to investigate and saw a completely naked and extremely intoxicated man had walked through the house to sit on the back deck off the dining room, barely conscious . I confronted him and he got startled and ran off through the back yard. I thought he was an intruder until I turned around and realized he had entered the house from the basement door which was flung wide open. I closed it but quickly realized there was no padlock or way to secure the door. 

Upon calling Desmond he said the man was "a friend who sometimes stays with him" in the downstairs apartment, and assured me it was a mixup. My wife and I were in complete shock at the experience and had to round up our things and our sleeping children at 11:00PM to go stay somewhere else because we could not stay under those circumstances with no padlock on the door to the basement apartment and a possible naked alcoholic staying below us. 

Desmond apologized for the confusion but I feel that people need to know that if you stay here you are potentially sharing your living space with anyone that might be downstairs with no way of locking the access door or ensuring privacy. At no point prior did Desmond tell us there was a guest downstairs, much less a naked alcoholic. I would never stay at Desmond's house again, and honestly the experience has us questioning whether we will ever use a home sharing service again.

Très bon logement pour les familles. L'endroit est calme et la maison est spacieuse. 
Desmond a répondu à toutes nos questions pratiques et interrogations. Il vit dans un logement au rez de chaussée. Il est venu se présenter le premier matin.
Juste à savoir : le logement est à maximum 45min de Manhattan en taxi.
Nous recommandons !
Good location...near subway, grocery store and restaurants. Comfortable beds and plenty of hot water for showers. It was a great place to stay and explore the city.
Very comfortable place to stay was here for 5 nights. Desmond responded quickly when needed so would stay here again if I come back to visit n.y.
Desmond was a great host, very communicative and helpful whenever needed. Thanks again for a great stay.
Amazing place . Must recommended we had great stay there .... walking distance   to bus and subway ..... supermarket is just few steps away

We had a great stay at Desmond’s place! It was spacious and in a convenient location to many stores. Street parking was easy and available!! 
The pictures are very accurate.. & Desmond went above and beyond to Welcome us and answer any questions we had! Thank you again for a great place to stay! We will definitely stay again!
Was a really great place and i loved staying there. I would definitely return to the home.
Good value for the money.

10 min walk to the subway. Take out and a store within 5 mins. Gas heating kept us toasty when we needed and fans cooled us down when the weather changed. The spa bath was a real bonus. 
Very comfy bed. It felt like staying with friends, a real home away from home. I would happily stay again and recommend to friends.
Would stay here again as well as recommend to other travelers to nyc

Desmond was very nice, replied to my messages promptly and let us check in earlier, which we really appreciated. The place is spacious and clean. There was pretty much everything we needed (with a small excepion of a coffee-maker). Also, it might seem a little distant from he downtown, but we didn't mind taking the subway. All in all, a good value for the money.
Very good place to stay.

A great residential place in a quiet neighborhood. Train station is a bit of a walk to get to. By a cab it takes about an hour to get to downtown. Otherwise the place was very spacious, clean and had a modern and vintage feel to it.

L appartement est conforme aux photos , un peu loin des transports en commun .sinon même si nous n’avons pas vu Desmond , il nous a toujours  répondu très rapidement aux interrogations que nous avions;L appartement est spacieux , nous avons été dérangé par le bruit de train qui passe non loin , sinon séjour très agréable.Merci Desmond
Dům je trošku starší, nicméně čistý, uklizený, a vše funguje, jak má. Byli jsme spokojeni.

Desmond’s place is nice with ample spaces, big enough for 5 people, It is an old row house stile and the basement is not included. The old furniture is nice and the kitchen is well equipped. The back yard needs some TLC but it’s fenced out by the deck. There are train tracks nearby and it can be noisy at night, not too bad if you are a good sleeper or are tired from walking around NY like us .  There are steep steps going up to the house and to the bedrooms, not suited for old or disabled. It takes about one hour to get to Manhattan by transit. We would go backto Desmond place.
We loved the place. It had a great vintage feel to it. Desmond was easy to communicate with. Everything was perfectly fine. I would love to stay at this place if I visit NY again.

Nice smooth place ,enjoyable terrasse , lovely asian neighborhood.
50 min from manathan 
I highly recomand

I came with my family of four and Desmond's place offered us everything we could dream of. The place was outstandingly clean and had a beautiful decor. The beds were well kept and the location was easily accessible to most of New York's touristy places. We would love to stay again with Desmond if we ever visit New York again -- would very highly recommend!

Desmond’s place is very nice and clean. We were lucky to find this place for our stay while we in NYC. The place is close to our Indonesian community in Elmhurst, so it was perfect location for us. Go to the city is very easy, lots of options, bus, subway, uber. Tons of restaurants near by. Close to big shopping mall. Desmond is super nice person, he really easy to communicate with, quick respons and willing to help me with my baby gears rental, luggages and everything else.
Superb host!!
Thank you Desmond!!
It was a nice stay. Very good.
Desmond was thoughtful and helpful and his home was exactly what we needed. Great bedrooms and living space to hang out, and super close to the q40 bus and several subway stations.

Awesome host! 
Great location!
Will be back when in NYC !
This was a great place to stay at and everything was above and beyond. Desmond provided us with everything we needed and could not have been more helpful.

I called the owner on Sunday at 8pm the week prior to the check-in for directions. I understand that it wasn't the best time to call due to being off hours. I would of told him to call me back whenever he wanted, and hung up the phone, but he kept me on the phone for 5 minutes complaining about "it's his time to relax", and how I was "bothering him while he was out". He went on and on as if someone was standing next to him, and he was trying to impress them about how busy he is with his rental; while being extremely rude to me for no reason. Like I said, if he would of said "it's not a good time",  I would of told him no problem call me back whenever and hung up the phone, and it would of been a 5 second call. At check-in the host was nice I doubt he would talk to me in my face the way he did over the phone. The house could of been cleaner. Also there was no A/C on the top floor where the bedrooms are it was unbearably hot unable to sleep in the bedroom, and the only A/C was on the first floor and was undersized to accommodate the whole area.

Très bon accueil et disponibilité. 
Près transport (1'). Compter 30' environ (bus + métro) pour accéder à Manhattan (on arrive au Nord, juste en dessous de Central Park). A noter pour l'accès à JFK: compter 45' à 1h selon attente, avec air train+métro E+bus Q47.
Maison grande. Chambres ok. Salle de bain ok (WC inclus). Cuisine avec meuble un peu ancien mais fonctionnelle.
Pas de clim, mais ventilateurs (salon et chambres), mais juste quand il fait très chaud.
Très proche supermarché (4'). Ouvert 6h à minuit. On trouve tout. A noter qu'il y a une banque dedans.
Quartier calme. 
Desmond est très disponible et réactif.
Bon séjour pour nous.
A great place with a perfect location for an awesome weekend in NYC ! Desmond is an awesome host with great hospitality.

5 stars 5 stars 5 stars 
Desmond 會親自迎接您的到來 
很貼心的菜藍車子方便去附近五分鐘路程的超市購物
捷運站有點距離你可以搭乘Q 58及Q 59公車抵達捷運grand AV還有queen central shopping mall 對我常旅遊的人來說是非常便利的
廚房設備齊全 空間非常非常的大 有兩層樓可以使用 共有三個房間喔!
門口可以停車 非常方便啊!唯一美中不足的是 房間沒有冷氣 白天蠻熱的 但是晚上睡覺倒是蠻涼爽的
Was excellent for what we needed. A home base while we explored New York.
Desmond’s place is just as he described. There’s a Starbucks in walking distance and a market as well.  I would recommend this place.
Desmond is quick to response and flexible to accompdate our needs. I am glad that I chose to stay with Desmond. I would definitely recommend his place!

Rented this for several people for a friends wedding in Long Island. Location is decent, about a 15min walk to the subway was easy. E train runs on the weekends which brings you straight into Manhattan. Plenty of space for 4 people. Off street parking wasn’t a problem. Grocery store 5 min walk away. Only complaint, it’s near train tracks. 2 our of 3 night a train went by around 5am which was kinda loud with the bedroom windows open. But the value can’t be beat! No regrets.
Excellent

My adult daughters and I stayed at Desmond's place in order to attend the big New York City Comic Con. This space and location provided an affordable and convenient option for the event. The house is spacious, clean, and well-appointed. I appreciated the back deck for relaxation and drinks after a long day at the con. It's about a 20 minute walk/five minute car ride to/from the subway station (one time we took a Juno, the other times we walked, and it was fine either way). The beds were comfy enough, the shower and tub were great, and Desmond provided everything we needed. Communication flowed perfectly, and check-in was a breeze. I'd look forward to another stay!
It was a wonderful place to stay at New York. It's really convenient to get Brooklyn and Manhattan. Also, Desmond was really nice.

Everything was great. Nice comfortable apartment. 
Next time, i will try to stay here again
we had a very comfortable stay in this nice house. We can recommend the Irish Pub on Grand for a meal or a tasty pint.

La casa de Desmond es tal y como sale en las fotos. Es bastante grande, bonita y confortable.Está un poco lejos del metro, unos 15 minutos andando, o pillando un autobus justo debajo de la casa. 
El dia de nuestra llegada no pudimos ver a Desmond porque llegamos muy tarde, pero el día que nos fuimos si que vino a despedirnos y fue muy simpático y amable.

Recomendado.
Très bien. Hôte sympathique et réactif.  Maison chaleureuse. Bien accessible avec le bus

Desmond’s place was definitely cozy and clean. It is in a great location as you can just take a bus to the subway to get where you need to go. I also really appreciated how fast he was at responding to any questions that I had and even offered to give great suggestions. Thank you, Desmond!
Great host. Answered texts promptly. Let us check in a bit early.
A fantastic place to stay!
Excellent location, beautiful house with all amenities great host.
Great place in Queens for a great price. During a cold weekend a nice cozy place to stay was just what we needed. Thank you again Desmond
Desmond was an amazing host. Responds quickly to all messages. The place was also well heated throughout our stay. Absolutely no issues

Great house, great stay. Desi was very responsive to any questions I had.
Obviously this is an older house, but I loved the charm of it. There were definitely some pictures I wanted to take off the wall.  The area was very quiet and we were able to sleep well.

If you need a great meal and sports bar I would recommend O’Neill’s. Rob, the bartender was great.
He was so nice, he responsed our requests in time and gave us some recommaditions for travlling new york, and the room is clean. It was a good experience living in hus house. Plus, he is handsome.

The house offered in this host is completely different to the description and the evaluations read on this page, for this I want to express:

1.The house is a very old place with a strange smell when entering
2. The house must be cleaned and organized by each of the guests
3. Under the beds there is dirt and hair from a long time ago
4.The floor wood creaks and sounds at night
5.No parking on the street, my car suffered a breakdown in the mirror without anyone responding
6.One morning when we wake up we find mice in the kitchen
7.The microwave oven is damaged and does not work
8.The doors of the rooms have no security
9. There are no kitchen utensils for cooking
10.No has air conditioning.

The house is located in a good place, but the lack of cleanliness and care makes this experience terrible, I do not understand why other people had qualified it in a five star host, but I do not recommend it.

Very centrally located, not far from buses and trains and also down the street from a few stores. Definitely a good spot to stay if you want to be close to the city but still in a more residential area.

Perfect stay, the house had everything that we needed. A short walk to the subway and Desmond was very helpful on arrival with tips about the area as well as apps to get around while on our trip. The place was clean and cosy, I couldn’t fault a thing!

Place is nicely decorated with antique furnitures. 

Parking on the street is very convenient.

One thing I didn’t enjoy was the cold at night because there is no heating radiator, and only one gas fuelled fireplace on the first floor heated the whole house.

The house seemed like good value, as it is about 15 min walk to subway. The house is spacious for NY and check-in was seamless. We had a satisfactory stay until our last day... 
BECAUSE>>>

Bed bugs in one bedroom, the others were fine (photos were sent to Airbnb, so far they have done nothing). We had to stay in the other two bedrooms because we couldn't find anywhere else to stay at such notice.

There is a door in the kitchen that leads to the flat downstairs. It is locked on the other side so you cannot secure the house.

On our last day, we were eating lunch with colleagues when an aggressive man from downstairs (who apparently owns the house) burst in through the front door and accused my colleagues of being hookers! He must have had a key to the front door...

We felt unsafe and decided to leave immediately, one night before our check out. Desmond arrived on site and sided with his neighbour and aggressively forced us to leave the property. We were shocked and were worried for our well being so we left within ten minutes. Desmond then accused my colleagues of being "transexual hookers" who "must have brought the bed bugs" to the house... ( he sent this message to us through Airbnb)

Our experience at this property is NOT UNIQUE however. Please see Eric's review from September 2017:

Desmond himself is quick to respond to any questions sent. However on that final night, a stranger I had never seen before barged into the house from the basement apartment while we were upstairs getting ready for bed. I ran downstairs to investigate and saw a completely naked and extremely intoxicated man had walked through the house to sit on the back deck off the dining room, barely conscious . I confronted him and he got startled and ran off through the back yard. I thought he was an intruder until I turned around and realized he had entered the house from the basement door which was flung wide open. Upon calling Desmond he said the man was "a friend who sometimes stays with him" in the downstairs apartment, and assured me it was a mixup. My wife and I were in complete shock at the experience and had to round up our things and our sleeping children at 11:00PM to go stay somewhere else because we could not stay under those circumstances with no padlock on the door to the basement apartment and a possible naked alcoholic staying below us. Desmond apologized for the confusion but I feel that people need to know that if you stay here you are potentially sharing your living space with anyone that might be downstairs with no way of locking the access door or ensuring privacy. At no point prior did Desmond tell us there was a guest downstairs, much less a naked alcoholic. I would never stay at Desmond's house again, and honestly the experience has us questioning whether we will ever use a home sharing service again."




We were very disappointed because our trip to NY was very successful apart from this crazy incident.

We had a great stay at Desmond's -- he met me in person for check in and showed me around the townhouse (which looks exactly as pictured) even though I arrived late in the evening. He provided parking tips, and let me know about the various coffee, grocery store, and food options that are within walking distance from the house. It was cozy, clean, and quiet -- perfect for our group. We'll be back!
The only thing that effect my stay is the house is too dark with a low light. But other then that is perfect.

This is a great townhouse with three bedrooms and one full bath.  Starbucks, groceries and liquor store just down the street.  It was perfect for what we needed as we attended a conference not far from here.  You can tell Desmond takes pride in the place and we really appreciated the value we received.  You can't beat it!  We would not hesitate to come back again!  Thanks for a wonderful place to hang out Desmond!

It is an older but quaint and cozy, warm townhouse. The beds were comfortable.  We cooked breakfasts  there (no coffee maker so we bought coffee on way to subway) and ate lunch and suppers out. We walked to the subway station (about 15 min walk)  Desmond was so helpful in helping us find our way around. He responded very quickly to our questions and comments. We were able to check in earlier so we had extra time down town. Would recommend his place anytime.
Place was a great deal takes like 40ish minutes to get to the city via bus and train was very clean, Desmond’s super helpful for anything you would need.

name: Sunny Lower E. Side Ap. near BDFMJZ
summary: Oasis between the Lower East Side & Chinatown. Features a double bed, hanging space, and room-specific temperature control. Amazing food (Asian & otherwise) and an easy walk to SoHo, East Village, Little Italy, and other spots in lower Manhattan. Se habla español, se fala português.

The building itself located just  2 mins walk from Sai Ying Pun Station, 1-2 mins walk to supermarkets, cafes, 5-10 mins walk to HK Macau Ferry Terminal, 5 mins subway ride or 15 mins walk to central. Prime location, very easy access to all attractions, restaurants, bars and parks all over Hong Kong.

neighborhood_overview: Located in between Sai Ying Pun and Sheung Wan, just 2 subway stops away from the luxury yet busy Financial District of HK,  the neighbourhood is funky, lively , trendy, yet down to earth,  easy to fit in. Known as  "French quarter" or "small Brooklyn" of HK,it becomes a new hipster central, attracts to lots of young expats and local professionals who is working hard and play harder:)  The neighborhood is home to lots of brilliant cafés and coffee shops, fantastic local and international cuisine,  antique shops , art galleries and boutique designers shops, the famous antique street and trendy PMQ just 10-15 mins walk from my place. Locals, expats, tourists, businessmen, artists, you can ran into a lot of different people here, very interesting and tourists friendly. Parks: Sun Yat Sen Memorial Park just 5 mins walk, it offers a standard public swimming pool, morning jogging trail along the harbour , soccer field and 2 basketballs courts. Perfect for a morning walk/jogging.  Groceries:
notes: It is a non-smoking, anti-drugs, no pets and pests-free apartment. Wifi is free of charge. I also live here, I have my own job, so please briefly introduce yourself when you are booking my apartment, and let me know in advance your travel itinerary/check-in/out time would be much appreciated. Other than that, if you have 1 or more people who want to stay, please message me in advance to see if it’s available and additional charges will apply. Thank you!
transit: 2 mins walk/literally 200 meters to Sai Ying Pun Subway Station Exit A1, basically it offers to access pretty much everywhere in HK. Traditional tram stop located a block away(3 mins walk) , so you can just jump on one to explore HK island.  Buses, minibuses, taxies are both easy to catch. From/ to airport, it is about 35 mins taxi ride and approx. HK$300, also you can take airport express train, leaves every 10 mins from Hong Kong Station, a 2 metro stops away from my place, it takes about 24 mins to airport. You can use the free Hong Kong Station In-Town check-in service to check in your luggage prior to your flight (usually anytime at the same day of your flight but closes 90 mins before your flight departure. Trust me, I travel a lot , it is super helpful and easy to manage your time).
access: You will share the apartment with me, the hostess. Of course, you have your own private room. You can access to kitchen, bathroom with a hot tub, living room and dinning room.
interaction: I am an easygoing person who have lived in 4 continents, 5 cities in my life, well traveled, enjoys outdoor activities (hike, beach, kayak, sports, etc), also like a quiet night with a glass of wine and some books or TV after work. I would love to give you any advices/ tips about where to go, what to do, etc. Feel free to ask me if you have any questions.
house_rules: Additional charges apply when guest has one more person to visit or stay in, please communicate with host in advance on this matter.

If you're reading this, just stop and book this already! 

Heather's place is amazing and she is the best host I've encountered! 

Prior to arrival, she was extremely communicative. She was proactive with her messages and made sure to include necessary details about her neighborhood in the days before my stay. On the day of arrival, she was extremely clear with her communication and met me when I arrived.

I stayed a total of 9 nights and had a great experience! The neighborhood is perfect - it's central to all the good eats and drinks without the craziness of the standard touristy areas. It's near an MTR station which is super convenient as well. If you want to stay in an area where locals truly live, while still experiencing the allure of Hong Kong, this is it.

Heather's apartment may be small (let's be real, this is Hong Kong) but it's modern and stylish. Her choice of decor makes the space seem larger than it really is. The room itself is cozy with an amazing view. I would wake up every morning in awe of the sight before me! Other than that, the apartment has everything you could possibly need.

Lastly, Heather is the perfect host! She is packed full of advice and recommendations - she is truly a Hong Kong expert. Her years of traveling and living in other places make for some great stories and conversations!

Highly recommend! Heather is a friendly and helpful host. Her apartment is safe (24hrs security), clean, quiet, comfortable and convenient with great view from the room window.
The location of the place is the most pleasing because it’s a 1-2min short walking distance to take MTR/Tram/Bus/Taxi!
Fantastic location and great view from the room. Nice area and nice and clean apartment. Check in and out was easy.

Heather was a great host, who provided great recommendations on things to check out while in Hong Kong. She also has a great place that maximizes the space she has, and has a lot of light coming through.
Super convenient spot right by the MTR with a beautiful view!! Definitely stay if you have the chance!!

I am  keen traveler and always on the look out for a new adventure!

I live by the phrase "Do what you love & love what you do" Simple! It you don't like something job, place, eating certain food, then stop doing it. Life is to be enjoyed and the world is so big, if one place doesn't work for you, try something else!

name: Feel at HOME away from HOME
summary: We're a young couple working and living here in NYC. Natalia is Colombian and Clement is Ghanaian  but lived in The Netherlands before moving to NYC. We love to meet new people from different countries and cultures. we're very organized and clean.
space: Feel right at home here away from home! New York is fast and busy all the time, so after running around all day sightseeing or working you need to come to a nice and calm place to relax.  The apartment is a 2 bedroom wooden floor with large living room and open kitchen. The room available is spacious with build-in closet and it is located in the back of the apt so it is nice and quiet. There is a crib/toddler bed in the 2nd room as well as a sofa bed. There is one bathroom with tub. The apt is clean and there is a dishwasher and a washer/dryer to make it even easier for you! ;-)  The apartment is located in the heart of Harlem, walking distance to 2,3,C,A,D and B metro stations (5-7 mins) and the neighborhood has lots of different restaurants and bars for you enjoy. You are in walking distance to the world famous Apollo Theater, Studio Harlem Museum, Shrine World Music Venue and all stores at the historic 125th Street.
